name: Frankindex! Numbers & Quantities
description:
Description from the publisher:

Professor Frankindex has given the monsters Zeropi and Decamo an impossible assignment; they must feel how many numbers are in the bag. But monster claws are much too big to recognize little objects. That’s why they desperately need your help! The players use their sense of touch to feel how many cubes are in each little bag. Who can whisper the correct eight or more numbers to Zeropi and Decamo? A monstrous numbers and quantities learning game.

name: Ski Run: The Ultimate Skiing Board Game
description:
Ski Run is an action packed race across the mountain where you try to be the first player back to the resort for Apres Ski! A quick interactive game for all the family.

Pick your route across the piste map board by riding up lifts and racing down runs, whilst trying not to Wipe Out! Will you take the easy blue, the intermediate red or the more direct but difficult black run? Watch out for ice, whiteouts, jumps and the big freeze, whilst hopefully avoiding getting lost or colliding with your competitors. Chase the yeti to find his shortcuts and hire skidoos or heliski to catch up. Call a stop at a ski station to delay your rivals and keep your eye out for opportunities to jump the queues or follow the leader.

The lead changes constantly in this dynamic game of fluctuating fortunes, where you try to use the right cards at the right time to stay one step ahead of your opponents. A quick, brilliant, interactive game for all the family.

Contents: Piste map board, 16 ski run cards, 10 lift cards, 20 event cards, 4 special cards and 5 wipe out cards, 12 sided snowball dice, rules sheet, playing counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Ophir: The Divine Eldorado
description:
Ophir: The Divine Eldorado is a brain-burning mancala-style worker placement rochester draft card game. The game consists of cards that are placed in piles in the table, face up. Players take turns placing their workers in the piles from which they wish to take cards, and they will get as many cards from the pile as there are workers on the pile. The player with the most workers on a given pile will be the one who gains cards from it.

Gained cards are sorted in color, but gained in order, and only the latest gained card will earn the player points. Most points at the end wins.

name: Barkolana
description:
Barkolana is the official game of the Barcolana, the most populous sailing regatta in the world.
The winner is the first one to arrive, sailing in his boat a course full of unexpected marine trial, which,if passed, will make him gain money (called "bori", from the name of the wind of the city "bora"). At the end of his turn, the player can use the money to buy in the "bottega velica" (a sailor's shop) some items to make his boat stronger, like new sails, gps, bottle of wine to stop other players, and even cannons to shoot them or forbidden fan or engine (he must pay attention to the sea police).
Also, in each turn the wind will change, affecting the speed of the sailing boats.

—description from the publisher

Il gioco è molto semplice: chi arriva per primo alla casella finale del tabellone, vince la Barkolana. L’avanzamento delle pedine è regolato dal lancio di dado e, a seconda della casella in cui si capita, bisognerà eseguire un compito specifico, tenendo conto del vento a favore stabilito all’inizio del turno e valido per tutti i giocatori. Il giocatore che è di mano dovrà prendere un boro (moneta triestina), utile per acquistare gli strafanici (optional di potenziamento della barca) presso la Bottega velica.
L’aspetto divertente è che per raggiungere il traguardo i velisti avranno a disposizione mezzi non sempre regolamentari: il ventilatore, un motore o i cannoni ad esempio; se avrete la sfortuna di incappare nella Guardia Costiera, dovrete pagarne il prezzo subendo le relative penalità.
Inoltre in mare dovrete sapervi destreggiare di fronte a mille difficoltà: saper recitare una filastrocca in apnea ad esempio, scommettere o mantenere il silenzio radio.
Un’ottima occasione per cimentarsi con un gioco dell’oca molto originale ed imparare qualcosa di nuovo sulle regate veliche, da provare!

Nerdando.com

name: Cinderella Magic: Card Expansion
description: This card expansion offers three new cards to add to the base game: Witch; Rattus which replaces the Rat; and Glass Slippers for a longer game with 6 or 7 players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Prairie of Beetles
description:
You're wandering in a rich and vast prairie filled with lots of colorful beetles. Choose your tool correctly to catch these beetles. Don't mess around or the beetles may be hurt and run away!

To set up Prairie of Beetles, a.k.a. 蟲蟲拍拍, shuffle the beetle cards, then scatter them face down in the middle of the table. Place a net or cage card between each pair of players. Players then take turns flipping over the beetle cards, and as soon as someone flips over a card that matches another one, everyone races to place one hand on the target beetle card and one hand on the corresponding net or cage card.

Once all the beetle cards have been turned face up, the game ends, and whoever has collected the most beetle cards wins.

name: Frogs & Toads
description:
Frogs & Toads: Fight, survive and become a Prince.

A frog and a toad!
Which one do you trust the most? Not everything is what it seems in the swamp: little critters, princesses, ruthless snakes ... Surviving is not an easy task.

Frog will do everything possible to become a prince and win the kiss from the beautiful princess.

SETUP

Each player receives one player game sheet. Also each player will receive one crown token and one waterlily token. To begin with, divide the two decks. On the one hand the F&T deck and on the other hand the action card deck. Later, you have to shuffle the decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Which One?
description:
Trivia game where each round presents players with a card containing 5 questions and 5 answers. Players must individually work out which answers relate to which questions.

Players can choose to gamble and guess any pairings they're unsure of, but any wrong answers will result in them getting no points from the entire card.

First player to 21 points wins.

—user summary

name: Rüssel raus!
description:
Rüssel raus! (a.k.a. Snout Out!) is a card game in which players vote by showing either one finger or no fingers in an attempt to collect sets of matching termites into stacks in front of themselves.

You own four termite mounds, i.e., stacks in front of you in which to collect cards. Each round, you try to send a new termite into the right mound by showing either one finger or no fingers. All players do this simultaneously though, and the sum total of all fingers determines how the cards will be stacked. If you are the first player to collect a set of three of the same termites in one location twice, you win. Until then, be wary of the dreadful pepper spray!

name: Bye! Virus
description:
To stop the spread of the disease, you must distribute the masks properly among the people in need. Neither excess nor shortage of mask supply is a good sign in the war against the pandemic!

On your turn, you must choose one of the two actions: below：
•Draw 2 character cards, and end your turn.
•Reveal the cards from the action deck one by one, until (1) you decide to stop, or (2) the “rush to buy” happens, or (3) a special card is revealed.

No matter how you end your turn, you could play at most a pair of a character card and a mask card in front of you to score points at the end of the game.
Once either deck is exhausted after a player’s turn, the game ends, and the cards still in your hand will make you lose points equal to the number printed on the bottom of the card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medical

name: Sprytna Ośmiornica
description:
Each player puts 3 tentacles on one hand's fingers and prepares his set of cups. The task card is drawn and players try to arrange their cups as pictures as fast as they can. First player to finish shouts "Game stop!" and takes the task card. The player who gets the most cards wins the game.

Contents:

18 cups, 3 of each color (yellow, orange, green, navy blue, blue and red)
9 octopus tentacles
27 cards
rules

name: Color Addict Fruity
description:
The object of the game is to discard all your cards as quickly as possible. Each player has a face-down draw pile and takes three cards from it into her hand. When all players have drawn three cards, the dealer places the top card of her draw pile face up in the center of the table, thus starting the game. Players may discard their cards accordingly if any of the following rules apply:

The background of the card is the same color as the word on the card
The background matches the pattern of the fruit
The word on the card is the same as the fruit
The word on the card matches the word on the card
The fruit choice card is played

name: Bulldonkey
description: Each turn, a player will shake the martini-dice shaker and call out a number. This number can be the true value of the dice rolled, or you can attempt to go for more points by stretching the truth. The higher the number the lower its probability, but the more it’s worth!
mechanics: Action Timer, Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Real-Time

name: PARADOMINETOR
description:
PARADOMINETOR (パラドミネーター) is a trick-taking game from Japan, with a sci-fi theme of time paradox. Players represent various time-travel organizations that are seeking to reach the Space-Time Management Bureau first.

The game is played with chips instead of cards, and these chips are kept behind a player's screen. One side of the chip shows the suit and rank, and the other side shows the time: past, present, or future. Each chip is unique in the game.

Players follow suit as in a normal trick-taking game, but when chips with the same suit and rank are played, they become trump and are resolved based on their time phase; the earliest phase wins the trick, with the latter one earning half a trick.

After fifteen tricks, the player with the highest score wins.

•••

タイムパラドックス、サイエンスフィクションがテーマのトリックテイキングです。プレイヤーはタイムトラベル技術を手に入れた大小さまざまな組織の代表となって、SF設定で当たり前のように存在している、時空管理局を目指します。15トリック行い最多トリック獲得者が勝者です。カードではなくチップでゲームを行います。同スート、同ランクのチップが複数存在し、表のスート、ランクの情報、裏の過去、現在、未来の情報で、3つの情報が合わさりオールユニークとなります。基本マストフォローですが、テキサスショーダウンの様に場にある色は出すことができます。同スート、同ランクのチップが場に出ると切り札化して最強となります。パラドックスで勝ち残ったプレイヤー同士で裏面を確認し、より過去のプレイヤーが1トリック、そのほかが0.5トリックを得ます。
description by publisher

name: Muumi viidakkoseikkailu
description:
In this Moomin-themed pattern recognition game players turn over two cards depicting Moomin characters or some items. Players must find pictures depicted in both cards from the board and place their fingers on the pictures.

First player to do this is rewarded with a fruit tile. If both cards show a comet symbol, the player also gets a comet tile. First player to reach five fruit tiles or two comet tiles wins the game.

The board is assembled from pieces, so it changes between games. The tiles are double-sided: one side is plain, the other filled with jungle, making it harder to find the pictures.

name: No Prob-Lama
description:
In the new card game of the Starnberger Spiele publishing house and the author Tanja Philippeit, the aim of the players is to collect the lowest possible scores in a display of nine initially hidden cards. You could almost mean "No Prob-Lama". But far from it! In addition to a bit of luck in drawing cards, "No Prob-Lama" is especially about clever tactics. Otherwise you end up with an unintentionally high score. And as if that was not enough, then a drama lama or a karma lama can get in the way.

Each player receives nine cards, which he disguises in a rectangle arranged in front of him. These are revealed during the course of the game and exchanged with cards from the stack. The goal is to have the lowest possible card values ​​in your display at the end of a round. You can even achieve minus points by collecting three identical cards in a row or a column. A round ends as soon as a player has revealed all nine cards. Who then has the lowest score, wins the round and may grab a piece of wood in the form of a lama. The first to collect three Lama pieces, ie to win three rounds, is the winner.

Of course, it's not that easy. The collection of triplets is very attractive, but at the same time quite risky. Because the trick here is: the higher the numbers of the cards are in a treble, the more minuses you get. However, if a teammate finished the round, before you could complete the treble, you sit on solid plus points. And you definitely do not want them in this game. So you better play it safe and only collect low cards or rather speculate on the highest possible triplet? Some players even come up with the idea to end the round intentionally fast, when his teammates are currently working on a treble with high cards to mess up their tour. For proper vortex care in between all the special cards. With the drama lama one buzzes additional points on a fellow player. With the Karma Lama on the other hand, you have to give away minus points. There the joy is great - for the others!

So while you optimize your own display, you must constantly keep an eye on the players. Most importantly, you should avoid discarding a card that the next player can use for his triplets collection.

name: Ultimö
description:
There are 15 dice. One is gold. The object of the game is to get the gold die. Take 1, 2 or 3 dice each turn. The catch? You can't take the gold die until the last play of the game! Sure, there are more rules, but you get the idea! Part luck, part brains, all fun!

(From the publisher's website)

Ultimö is basically a Nim game, and is solved and deterministic. Note that while this game uses dice, they are un-numbered and are not rolled, and as such Ultimö would not be considered a 'Dice' game.

name: Stumblebum
description: A charades-based game where performers roll one or two dice to determine the physical challenge(s) - like “stand on one leg” “eyes closed”, "hum a song", "hand on head", etc. Given the physical challenge(s) the performer attempts to act out a short list of words (in 30 seconds). Get teammates to say the words and your team scores. If not, your opponents can steal the card on their way to collect five cards.

name: Viajero Loco
description:
En "Viajero Loco" tienes que completar tu viaje primero que los demás jugadores. El mapa representa la geografía colombiana y los modos de desplazarse por ella (Avión, Tren, Barco, Caballo) Cada carta representa una ciudad o un medio de transporte y tienes que conectarlas antes que alguien más lo haga. Quien primero se deshaga de todas sus cartas es el ganador entonces los demás jugadores revisan con cuantas cartas quedaron en su mano y ese será su puntaje negativo.
Rápido, fácil y educativo, el juego es apto tanto para niños como para adultos.

--

In "Crazy Traveler" you have to complete your journey before the other players complete theirs. The map represents the Colombian geography and the cards represents the cities and the transport type to travel between them (plane, train, boat or horse) the players must connect all their cards before anyone else does. The first player to get rid off all his cards is the winner then the other players show how many cards were in their hands and that is their negative score.

Fast, easy and educational, the game is suitable for both children and adults.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Racing, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building

name: TriTective
description:
The 3-letter mystery word game.

1. Take turns being the "spy" and choosing a spy word from any card.
2. Detectives play their cards one at a time. The "spy" tells them the number of letters their words have in common with the "spy word".
3. Using their super sleuth powers of deduction, detectives narrow down the letters in common with the "spy word" with every card played.
4. The first player to guess the 3-letter mystery word wins the round!

name: Monopoly Junior: Unicorn Edition
description: Collect the most cash while taking an imaginary journey through the colorful world of unicorns! Players move their adorable unicorn token around the board buying and selling properties such as sprinkles, glitter, party hats, and other things unicorns love. It's so much fun for kids to place a "sold" sign on their very own property. And if a player owns both properties in the same color, they can charge double the rent! The Monopoly Junior: Unicorn Edition game is a quick-playing board game designed for kids ages 5 and up, as an introduction to classic Monopoly gameplay.
mechanics: Income, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Escape Experience: Fairy Forest
description:
Become a mighty forest spirit, master of space and time, protector of mushrooms and trees. Alone or with others, you face an evil creature from ancient times. Ally with trolls, goblins and stranger creatures of the forest. Will you be able to solve all the puzzles and save the forest?

The goal of the game is to escape from a time loop. To achieve that, the party has to make decisions which cost time points. When the time points are used up, the party has to restart the game, but keeps collected items and information that can be combined to solve the mysteries. The group wins when it escapes the time loop with a perfect game.

name: Hugo das Schlossgespenst: Gruselplättchen
description:
Hugo das Schlossgespenst: Gruselplättchen is an expansion for Midnight Party.

It consists of 16 tiles named:

Geisterhaft
Geisteskraft
Begeistert
Teamgeist
Von Geisterhand
Mannschaftsgeist
Geistesblitz
Geistlos
Geisterjäger
Geistreich
Geisterzug
Freigeist
Entgeistert
Geisterbahn
Kampfgeist
Geistergrusel


Official Rules (included with the tiles) in german:
"Gruselplättchen

Es wird auf der Spielplanseite mit den Gruselpunkten am Rand gespielt. Alle Regeln aus der "Grundversion" bleiben bestehen.

Zusätzliche Regeln für die 16 Gruselplättchen:
Spielvorbereitung: Die Gruselplättchen werden verdeckt gemischt. Jeder Spieler erhält zu Beginn des Spiels ein Plättchen, das er anschaut und verdeckt vor sich ablegt. Der Rest ergibt den Nachzugstapel.

Alle Guselplättchen sind für den ausspielenden Spieler positiv.
Es gibt pro Gruselplättchen jeweils ein Symbol, das den Verwendungszeitpunkt angibt: Entweder

a) in einem Zug (Spieler Symbol) oder b) jederzeit (Uhr Symbol)

[es gibt 11 a) und 5 b) Plättchen]

Spielverlauf:Zieht ein Spieler eine seiner Figuren aus dem Keller wieder auf die Galerie, erhält er ein Plättchen vom Nachzugstapel. Limit pro Spieler sind 2 Gruselplättchen! Sollte ein Spieler ein drittes Plättchen erhalten, muss er sofort eines der 3 Plättchen ablegen.
Ein Gruselplättchen kann nicht im gleichen Zug, in dem man es ehält, aber jederzeit (dem Verwendungszeitpunkt entsprechend) danach eingesetzt werden. Ein Spieler kann nur ein Plättchen pro Zug ausspielen. Genutzte Plättchen kommen auf ein Ablagestapel. Sollte der Nachzugstapel aufgebraucht sein, wird der Ablagestapel gemischt und als neuer Nachsugstapel genutzt."

Aproximate translation (by kurtsg):
"Fright-tiles

It is played on the Board side with the fright points on the edge. All rules from the "basic version" remain.

Additional rules for the 16 fright-tiles:
Game preparation: The fright tiles are shuffled face down. Each player begins the game with one tile he looks at and then places face down in front of him. The rest of tiles build the draw pile.

All fright tiles are positive for the player playing them.
Each fright tile has one symbol on it that indicates the time of use: Either

a) in the players turn (grey/black player icon) or b) at any time (clock icon)
[there are 11 a) and 5 b) tiles]

During play: If a player moves one of his figures from the cellar back to the gallery, he receives a tile from the draw pile. Limit per player are 2 fright tiles! Should a player receive a third tile, he must immediately discard one of the 3 tiles.
A fright tile can not be used in the turn it is adquired, but inmediately after (using the corresponding time of use indicated by the symbol on the tile). A player may play only one tile per turn. Used tiles are put on a discard pile. If the draw pile is exhausted, the discard pile is shuffled and used as a new draw pile."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Entrepreneur
description: Players open up businesses, build their assets, and then form them into companys. Unless the assets are protected by being part of a company they can be stolen by other players or otherwise harmed. Corporations/companys themselves are also vulnerable to certain cards which allow other players to take them over. When the hand has finished, by someone playing the "grab the money and run" card, the control of the companys/assets is calculated and the player with the most assets wins. But, of course, we should play one more hand...best out of 5 maybe?

name: Tastes Like Chicken
description: In the Tastes Like Chicken game, you’ll match a Pig-Frog to a Frog-Cow or a Lobster-Shark to a Snake-Lobster. The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all your Wacky Animal Cards. But look out for those Tastes Like Chicken cards. If someone plays a Chicken card, you might have to draw a card and skip your turn.

name: Tri 3D
description:
The ultimate 3D strategy board game.
The game is played on a unique 3-tier triangular board, and players capture their opponent's pieces by surrounding or cornering them.
It is similar to games like draughts but not as complex as chess. The ability to jump between the 3 levels adds a whole new dimension to traditional board game play.
It is both easy to learn for beginners, but can be challenging and addictive to more experienced players.

name: Schnappt Hubi Mitbringspiel
description:
Mini version of Schnappt Hubi!

The cheeky ghost Hubi has pilfered the treats of the animals! Together, they pursue him through the haunted house. Can they catch him before midnight.

name: Game of Cat and Mouse
description: A simple game for children. The board is a grid of squares with mice printed on them in different directions. If you land on a square with your mouse you turn it as indicated and make your next move in that direction. Some squares are holes and if your mouse lands there, it falls down into the box, which has cats printed on it. The last player who has a mouse left wins. Alternatively, for the more cruel kids or those who simply enjoy to throw in the mice, the first player to "clean the house of mice" wins.
publishers: Alga, Clipper, Jumbo, Miro Company, Parker Brothers, Piatnik, Schmidt Spiele, Toltoys, Verlag Schmidt Zwiebeltürme, Πάπυρος

name: Squirrels!
description:
Squirrels is easy to learn and infinitely replayable.

Simple to win: collect 5 nuts. But along the way your friendships will be tested as other players try to steal your nuts and foil your chances of winning.

With a variety of wild cards to change your circumstances at any moment, there's no telling who will be the winner at the end of the game.

On your turn, you either play a card or discard a card. If a card was played, you resolve the effect and draw back up to 7 cards. If you discarded a card you simply draw back up to 7 cards. In either case, play continues to the next player in clockwise order. You win the game if you have 5 nut cards of the same color in your hand at the end of your turn.

name: Robert Ludlum's Game of Counter Espionage
description: This game is like a cross between Clue and Scotland Yard. One player is secretly chosen to play a double agent. Each player plays two characters, a station chief and a field agent. They travel by road or by plane on one of two maps (North America or Europe) collecting information about the other agents. They do this by using special supply cards and challenging other players Counter-Surveillance stats with their own Surveillance ability. The double agents task is to keep his identity secret until the end of fifteen rounds. The counter-espionage agents must find and de-activate the double agent by the end of the fifteenth round.

name: Neues Land
description: Players buy ships and employ traders, priests and conquistadors. They need to transport this people from their home harbor in Europe over the sea to the new world. On the sea they fight against other players, pirates and natural disasters. If they survive and reach the new world, they found trading stations and missions. Trading stations and missions deliver victory points every turn. So you need to burn down trading stations and missions of your enemies to get 25 victory points and win the game before they do it.
categories: Nautical, Pirates, Renaissance, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mech Wars
description:
Mech Wars is part logical, part strategical board game which also uses card drawing mechanics. Rules aren't complicated but every game is fun and demanding entertainment.

Here you will get a chance to lead a team of mechs - enormous robot-like war machines. Using a wide variety of weapons you will try to secure a victory against other mechraider leaders.

All the necessary information you can find at game's official web page: http://www.startzpoleposition.com.pl/MechWars


Mech Wars ist ein teilweise logisches teilweise strategisches Brettspiel mit Karteneinsatz. Die durchaus einfachen Spielregeln bieten eine angenehme und trotzdem anspruchsvolle Unterhaltung.

Die Mechs (die Mechwarriors) sind roboterähnliche Kampfmaschinen. Jeder Spieler führt hier ein eigenes Mechkommando. Der Parteien wird eine große Auswahl an Waffen zur Verfügung gestellt, mit der sie sich zum Sieg durchzusetzen suchen.

Weitere Infos auf der offizielen Seite des Spiels:
http://www.startzpoleposition.com.pl/MechWars


Mech Wars to logiczno-strategiczna gra planszowa, wykorzystująca takze karty. Zasady nie sa zbyt skomplikowane , ale zapewniaja bardzo przyjemna, a takze wymagajaca rozrywke.

Kazdy z graczy bedzie mial mozliwosc staniecia na czele druzyny mechow - ogromncyh robotopodonych maszyn bojowych. Korzystajac z szerokiego arsenalu dodatkowych broni kazdy bedzie probowal zapewnic sobie zwyciestwo.

Wszelkie niezbedne informacje znalezc mozna na oficjalnej stronie gry: http://www.startzpoleposition.com.pl/MechWars
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Set Collection

name: Defensores de la Tierra
description:
Defenders of the Earth is an action and adventure game for adventurers of 9 years up.

One adventurers team made of the most famous comic heroes - The Phantom, Flash Gordon and Mandrake - to save the Earth supporting a titanic fight against Ming, the tyrannical monster lover of the intergalactic war, and his wicked schemes.

The game consists in the fight of superheroes against Ming, who is in Ice Station Earth, constructed under an arctic mountain, and to rescue the prisoners who are there.

Content:

- 1 board
- 42 cards
- 4 player pieces: 3 heroes (The Phantom, Flash Gordon and Mandrake) and the bad guy (Ming).
- 2 Dice
- 4 gamer pieces for the ice warriors
- 1 instructions
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Kaboom!
description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2009/2010 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

User Summary

Players try to defuse a bomb by figuring out which wires to cut. The game ends when someone decides to defuse the bomb or when the timer runs out. The player who correctly defuses the bomb is the winner but if the bomb explodes, the player with the most agents out of the building wins.

name: Warmonger (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is a fan based print & play expansion to Dominion featuring 18 new cards.

War and conflict takes its toll from land and men. Weary nobles fight over every piece of land, both by soldiers in the field, but also by deception and ploys. What yesterday was a fruitful part of your country might tomorrow be a ruined and burned land, or belong to another regent.

Warmonger focuses on player interaction with more added Attack cards and Action cards that mess with players in different ways. And then there are ways to interacts with Victory cards, both your own and your oppponents. Victory cards are no longer safe when they are in your deck.

Card Breakdown (note that some cards are dual, so still just 18 cards)
- 4 Victory cards (three supply; one basic, the 15VP Empire card)
- 8 Attack cards
- 2 Reaction cards
- 1 Treasure card (in supply)
- 15 Action cards

In the file section you will find the Rules PDF and the Card Sheet PDF; all you need to print & play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Sushi Dice: Cthulhu Loves Sushis
description:
The great Cthulhu is a gourmet!

If at any time during the game, a player notices that 8 dice are on the same side (stars count as a symbol of your choice), he shouts “ Chop ” and applies the basic rule, but he takes the Cthulhu card which also counts as a normal platter to win the game.

But, if 8 octopus were visible, this card counts for 2 platters. This card can switch from one player to another as long as no one has won the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Timmy räumt auf
description:
Oh, no! The apartment is a mess, with things scattered everywhere — time to clean up! Luckily, Timmy has some children over who can bring everything to the right place.

In Timmy räumt auf, the players take turns rolling dice to move Timmy around the apartment and find items that fit into the color-coded rooms. Each room should have three objects in it, and whoever finds the last missing item in a room earns a point. When the house is tidy, the player with the most points wins.
publishers: Egmont Polska, Korea Boardgames, Matagot, Pegasus Spiele

name: Absedio
description:
ABSEDIO is an abstract game for two players.

It takes place on three boards simultaneously, each board initially has four white pieces and four black pieces, and in the center of each of them, a Skull.

The players, in turn, must make two movements (NEVER on the same board).

The objective of the game is to immobilize the claws of the three boards with as many of your own pieces as possible.

name: Idol Conclave + Million Hit Chart
description:
A bundle containing the two games Idol Conclave and Million Hit Chart



Idol Conclave


An idol-themed card game. Players are all a member of an idol group, but while being in the same group, wants to be voted to top idol. Each player has a set of cards with votes and scandals on and will play these onto the other members of the group. Each player also has one member they openly support.

Of the set cards each player has, one is Backstage Deal, which alows the player to play cards on a specific sheet, where each played cards will have various effects.

The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.



Million Hit Chart


A cooperative game where the players are all members of an idol group, aiming to create a million hit.

At the beginning of the game, a number of Appeal cards are lined up by each member of the idol group. These cards can, during the game, be looked at by players and can also switch places to and fro.

These appeal cards must match the requirements on the popularity sheet and come in a specific order, in order to generate a specific amount of sales. The goal of the game is to get as high sales as possible



MOVIE : https://youtu.be/R3VZEPBlb4A

name: NewSpeak: Deluxe Edition
description:
NewSpeak is a tense game of dystopian subversion in which you take the role of either the 'dissidents' or the 'moderators' in a mind-bending battle of wits to determine the reality around you.

Will you challenge the status quo and shatter your fragile reality or seek to protect the safety of what you know?

Dissidents utilise matching underground codes to coordinate meetings at one of the disturbingly illustrated locations on your map. They then each secretly use their location dials to declare their intended meeting point.

The Mods, in a short amount of time, then have to determine where they expect the Dissidents to meet by inferring their intent from a book of every possible code set the subversives could use, and agree upon a location to direct a state raiding party.

Once they've agreed on a location, the Dissidents each reveal their location dials. Depending on whether the majority of Dissidents have successfully coordinated at a single location, or the Mods have caught them in an attempt at subversion will determine whether that location becomes 'hacked' or 'moderated'.

As the game progresses, moderated locations produce potential accomplices for the Dissidents to recruit, as undesirables are driven from now sanitized districts. However, as the Dissidents progress their mission to 'hack' as many locations as possible, the Moderators strike back with increasing numbers of surveillance outposts, installed to limit the Dissident's ability to move around the city undetected.

NewSpeak: Deluxe Edition includes the NewSpeak base game and two expansions - Rated and Sabotage - all packaged inside one box.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Monopoly: Mickey Mouse 75th Anniversary
description: Buy, sell, and trade classic Mickey Mouse movies in this Monopoly variant celebrating 75 years of Mickey Mouse animated antics.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Blade Runner 2049: Nexus Protocol
description:
In Blade Runner 2049: Nexus Protocol, detectives, citizens, and Rick Deckard compete to figure out who is a replicant posing as a human. They know that one of them is a replicant, but not even the replicant knows who they are.

In this deduction game, you use your influence to meet contacts, gather information, and reveal evidence to identify the replicant. If you discover that you are the replicant, you have to scramble to conceal your identity and avoid early retirement.

Will you find the replicant, or will you be retired?

name: Wild Arena
description:
Send your wrestlers into the arena to fight under secret rules known only to your opponents – except when you set the rules, that is! Your winning weapons in this fun challenge that sends crazy characters into epic fights are tactics, intuition and bluffing – but in the end, it's all just a game!

Each round in Wild Arena – winner of the Cartamundi Award in Premio Archimede 2012 – the first player plays a Referee card (which shows how to win the round) face down and a Wrestler card (which has a value) face up. All other players in clockwise order then play a Wrestler card, trying to guess the rule. When everyone has played a Wrestler, the Referee card is revealed and the winner of the bout is determined!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Sports

name: Crocofant
description:
The animals are playing dress up! The elephant wears crocodile armor, the crocodile comes looking like the tiger look, and the giraffe has added zebra stripes. Crocofant offers two game variants: one a memory game in which one of two dice shows whether an animal outline or an animal pattern must be found. Whoever has just noticed the hiding place of the giraffe must now look for the tiger stripes.

The other way to play is as a reaction game in which a certain combination of animal outlines and patterns is searched for amongst the face-up cards. Who can combine the combinations fastest and snap up the corresponding animal?

name: Rummikub Turbo
description:
Rummikub Turbo is a fast en exciting game. Each time is different due to the combinations you choose while playing!

Each player receives 9 dice. Choose a few (or all) dice and throw them. Afterwards you decide which dice you'll use to make rows, series and combos. The winning player can start the next round.

The player who managed to score the most points after 6 rounds wins the game.

name: The Fall of France
description:
Operational level 1940 French campaign.

Units are mainly corps. Units of both sides are rated equally (Inf div = Inf div) no German supermen units. Germans have operational advantages and initiative which may allow them to recreate the miraculous victory.
categories: Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Mes copains d'abord
description: The Yacht is sinking and you have to save a group of nine passengers. Like the other players you will find out that there is not enough room for everybody in the safety boat. Who will save his/her group when the sharks hang around?

name: Paths and Burrows (The World of Beatrix Potter)
description:
To move your rabbit playing piece from "start" to "home" over 49 steps, using the roll of the dice. You are helped on your way by taking short-cut paths if they are landed on, but you are also hindered if you land on a burrow, and you take a short-cut backwards!

The game is designed as if it was Beatrix Potter herself who had created it. All the parts and pieces used are made in materials that would have been available to her. The box is small and compact to take the well thought out pieces and is in keeping with the small book itself.

Snakes and Ladders is a Victorian game brought back from India and has the concept of good and bad, just right for Peter Rabbit. The illustrations used in the board design show Peter being naughty at one end of the burrow and then the result of being naughty at the other after he goes down. On the Path when he is good he goes up and the illustrations at either end depict this.

The game is very simple and can be played by three year old's upward. It should take no longer than five minutes to play, the concentration span of children of that age and perfect before bedtime. Hence the simple Paths and Burrows on the board and there being only 49 squares. If you want to spend longer then play more times, best of three etc.

The large wooden die has large numbers to help a child learn the numbers from 1 to 6. Each number is also decorated with the same number of rabbits. So there is one on the 1 and two on the 2 etc. Children will love counting these to see what number they have thrown. You can then move this number on the board. This will help them understand the relationship with the board numbers and the dice at an early age.

The pieces are Peter and the three Flopsy bunnies in stone resin and with painted jackets. They will bring Peter alive on the board to a young persons mind.

It is a gift item not a toy. By spending time with the game and taking care of it a child will come to appreciate it as they grow old. The textures and shapes and illustrations all blending to create an experience they will always remember.

name: The Junk Yard Game
description:
In "The Junk Yard", players (solo or with a partner or even in teams) attempt to knock down targets with a steel ball, propelled by flippers. Rubber bands provide the tension for the flippers and drop targets (tin cans, boots, etc).
It is a simple dexterity game, but can provide many hours of fun. The "Keep Out" targets cause you to lose the ball, and the targets have various point amounts, with the center 500 targets being easy to drain down the middle.

Players/Teams can compete to get the highest score.

name: Higher or Lower
description:
Q: What is the average weight of an adult male blue whale (to the nearest tonne)?

How many people would know the answer to this question... not many you may say! But there's always some 'smarty pants' with a photographic memory for this type of information.

And how many games have you played where the person in the lead just moves further ahead... and wins. There's no excitement in that! "Higher-or-Lower" is different. It allows anyone to play... 'smarty pants' or not... and everyone has an equal chance of getting the answer right... even if you don't have the faintest idea of what it is!

"Higher-or-Lower" combines the fun of learning, with a playing board where players can be blocked from moving. "Chance" questions can boost you higher... while those annoying "Group" questions can see you slide lower.

Add to this the delight of the last person (to depart the bottom row) collecting and placing those 'land mine' like yellow "Group" disc's anywhere on the board at anytime, and "Higher-or-Lower" offers a riot of fun and entertainment to all!

(from the back of the box)

name: Ultimate Spider-Man: Face Off Dice Game – Spider-Man vs. Rhino
description: This push-your-luck dice game contains a molded plastic container/dice cup and five dice with the faces of heroes or villains. After a player rolls their dice, they can "go hero" (rerolling dice to build scoring combinations of heroes) or "go villain (rerolling only once, but allowing them to bluff other players for a higher score).

name: Star Wars: Conflict
description:
Conflict between the First Order and the Resistance. The dark powers are growing stronger and a return to harmony in the galaxy is becoming harder and harder. Will the young heroes of the Resistance manage to stop the First Order Leaders before it's too late?

Star Wars: Conflict is a cooperative board game. Players must work together to prevent the evil forces from reclaiming the galaxy. Individual decisions made by players will affect the common goal: thw whole team will either win or lose. It's all in your hands!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: 1500: The New World – England Expansion
description:
These Nations give each player control of a specific European nation during the Age of Discovery! Each deck features a custom mix of cards unique to that nation.

Each Expansion pack also contains the cards and rules needed to add add the nation to the game as an AI non-player participant! This means you can play 1500 with your friends or solitaire against 1 or more non-player decks!
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: 1500: The New World – France Expansion
description:
These Nations give each player control of a specific European nation during the Age of Discovery! Each deck features a custom mix of cards unique to that nation.

Each Expansion pack also contains the cards and rules needed to add add the nation to the game as an AI non-player participant! This means you can play 1500 with your friends or solitaire against 1 or more non-player decks!
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Cybernaut
description:
Elite Government Cyberwarriors combat Rebel Hackers in Joseph Miranda's vision of an oppressive future.

Publisher Blurb

Cybernaut is a two-player game of combat in both the real and virtual worlds, between governmental forces and those of rogue operations called cybernauts. The game includes 120 color playing pieces, an 11" X 17" Map, and 16 pages of rules and strategy guides. A six-sided die is also required for play. This game was originally published in Gamefix Magazine, Issue #11.

name: S'Mores Wars
description:
Chomp, smash, and splat your way through the competition in this fast-paced card game of s'mores construction!

In S'Mores Wars, players race to collect ingredients and build the highest-scoring s'mores, but if two or more players lay claim to the same ingredient, they must battle for it in a sticky and delicious twist on rock-paper-scissors — chomping, toasting, stretching, splatting, and smashing each other's marshmallows until one player emerges victorious.

—description from the publisher

name: Apples to Apples: Jewish Edition
description:
From the back of the box:

Apples to Apples Jewish Edition brings the award winning card and party game, Apples to Apples, to Jewish Families and friends. Players will delight in the clever comparisons while expanding their knowledge of Jewish themes.

Contains fun, new cards based on Jewish life, history and culture.

Part of the Apples to Apples Series.
publishers: Jewish Educational Toys, Out of the Box Publishing

name: Picnic Panic
description: Try to rid your hand of food items by placing one on the board each turn until the picnic basket explodes and sends plastic ants everywhere. If the basket explodes on your turn, you must pick up all the cards that the ants land on.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Cabo da Roca
description:
Cabo da Roca is situated on the very West tip of Portugal. The lighthouse on Cabo da Roca warns ships following one of the busiest sea routes in the world up to a distance of 100 kilometers. Now, you will put yourself afloat on these sea routes heading towards new adventure.

The game has a Carcassonne-style tile-laying mechanic in which players construct a seascape and port locations turn by turn. As ports appear, players can start buying ships to sail around the sea and trade goods from one town to another. Different types of ships are available, with a pirate ship naturally being one of them, and players try to accumulate the most gold possible through trade and settlement.

name: Ten Major Construction Projects
description:
The Ten Major Construction Projects (traditional Chinese: 十大建設) were national infrastructure projects during the 1970s in Taiwan. They were proposed by the Premier Chiang Ching-kuo, beginning in 1974, with a planned completion by 1979, which ultimately cost over NT$300 billion in total.
Please refer to the wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ten_Major_Construction_Projects

Summary :
Ten Major Construction Projects looks similar to Monopoly games in appearance,but it is not a game of trading and negotiation, and you don't have to make others bankrupt.
You just roll the dice, moving Chiang Ching-kuo, deal with events where Chiang Ching-kuo stayed, then collect resouces,
through the Technique cards, you may affect the moving of Chiang Ching-kuo, get more resources, and change your resources into victory points. you may also disturb others' plans by Meeting or Inspecting cards,but you will always need a roll of luck to do this.
If 1.all kinds of Technique cards have been completed. or 2.all Meeting cards have been resolved, the game ends, the player with most victory points wins!

Ten Major Construction Projects is more like a family game than a strategy one.

Publisher: Academia Historica (www.drnh.gov.tw)
Production: 2Plus Studio (www.2plus.com.tw)
Designer: Jong Kong
Illustration: Fumi.03(Zi-wen Huang)
Art Design : Hsin-lin Liu
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Xscape
description:
A game for 2 to 4 players on a kinetic, ever changing board. The object, to collect 5 unique Tokens Cards and return to the Start Tile before your opponents.

A game of logic, on a chaotic board, there is no luck involved (okay, very, very little luck). Just the timing of events created by you and your opponents given the limited options available to the players. Player options (including tile movement and token stealing) are determined by the board tile upon which their pawn rests (each tile allows 2 to 3 options for the player) and the hidden Power Up Cards each player chose at the beginning of the game. Player's must weigh their options wisely to determine the most advantageous choice for themselves while undermining their opponents!

There are two versions of the exact same game available. A Full Color Version, all inclusive, full game, print and play; and/or a Black and White "CB" Version (the original game testers' ashcan version), players will need to supply a deck of cards and a token for each player for the B&W version. The rules are short, simple and contained in a single PocketMod, included in each of the above sets.

Winner: 2011 Print and Play Award for Best Abstract Game
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lady Godiva
description:
This little card game is based on the story of Lady Godiva (and Peeping Tom).

There are 36 cards in total: 28 number cards, 7 Lady Godiva cards, and 1 Peeping Tom card. Note that number cards are arranged in a pyramid style (or "Dalumuti" style): seven "7" cards, six "6" cards, five "5" cards. etc.

At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt with certain number of cards. The first player to empty his or her hand without being eliminated is the winner.

On a player's turn, he can either pass or play some cards. If he passes, he does nothing: it is simply the next player's turn. If he chooses to play, he lays down one or more cards and announces a number, which is seven or lower. For example, if he announces "six" and plays 3 cards face down, he is claiming that those 3 cards are all number "six" cards.

If no one challenges, it is the next player's turn. The next player has to either pass or play some cards, just like the previous player, but he must announce a lower number than what the previous player claimed.

If someone decides to challenge ("Peep"), she opens the cards played by the current player. If the challenge fails (i.e., the challenged player was honest), the challenger should take all the cards played so far. If the challenge succeeds, the challenged player should take all the cards played so far (or will be eliminated from the game immediately if there is any Lady Godiva card among the played cards).

Play continues in this manner until there is a single winner.

name: Monopoly: The Elder Scrolls V – Skyrim
description:
A Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim thematic monopoly game.

Enter the realms of Tamriel in this brand new Skyrim themed edition of the fast-dealing, property trading game, as you experience lore, characters and locations from the bestselling videogame. Whether your plans are to set up villages in Winterhold or construct huge castles in Windhelm, get ready to unleash your inner entrepreneurial spirit as you lay claim to some of the most valuable plots of land in Tamriel. Most importantly, you’ll learn the intimidating new Dragon shout “Fus Ro Deal!” as you bargain, buy and trade your way to success. Just beware those fearsome Dragons who may strike at any moment to destroy your hard earned investment.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Winning Moves Germany, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Diamondback
description:
Created by Dave Sim for the comic book Cerebus, Diamondback was published in a separate edition and given to the masses who demanded it. It's a variant of poker and other betting games, but without suits or sets. The cards have a specific point value, and whomever has the highest total points is the winner of the hand.

Each player is given two cards from a deck of 15, 29, or 43 cards (depending on the number of players in the game), and the dealer reveals one of his cards and initiates the betting. Once the dealer decides the betting round is over, all cards are revealed, and the player with the highest point value wins the pot.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Little Green Men
description:
From the box:

Something very odd is going on deep in the forest! A spaceship has landed, Little Green Men have been sighted! You have been chosen to find and capture them. Are you read for this dangerous mission?

"Giant Spaceship Included"

2-4 Players, Ages 7 and up
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Herd the Sheep
description:
The shepherds want to lead their sheep back to the warm barn. Who will be the first to lure, with delicious flowers, their sheep back from the meadow? This competitive game for 2-4 players has a tactical variation for experienced players.

Ages 4-12.

From HABA USA

name: Collect the Chicks
description:
From back cover of Game box :
Find your chicks that have escaped and are hiding with the other chicks and bring them back to your home.
Every hen and every chick has a magnet inside, which causes the hens and chicks to be attracted to each other or repelled.

Twelve chicks are hiding in the fields from the mother hens who must bring them home to the poultry-yards. Each of the chicks and hens fit on magnetic bases. Players throw the die and move their hen along the path. When the hen comes to a hiding chick, she moves as close as possible. The chick will either cling to the mother or be repelled, indicating which hen is the mother. The clinging chicks are taken back by the mother to home. First player to return 3 chicks wins.

Note that this game cannot (fairly) be played with three players, as this would leave one player (who has the hen polarized differently to the other two) with a wider selection of chicks, and thus would need to move less to obtain them.

name: Piotrków 1939
description:
Polish Wargame about the battles around the city of Piotrkow during the German invasion of Poland in 1939.

Contains quite large hex-map of the area and something around 600 counters which have to be cut out first.

name: Very Silly Sentences
description:
Very Silly Sentences is a sequel to Silly Sentences.

From the publisher:
Learning basic language and literacy skills to give children a head start as they start school is as easy as A, B, C with this fun game.

Colour-coded cards will help your child learn parts of speech and sentence construction with hilarious consequences. The banana jumped over the tree, the cow ate the alarm clock. No sentence is too silly in this addictive game for the whole family.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Word Game

name: Monopoly: Pokémon Gold and Silver
description:
For ages 8+
2-6 players
This is the 2nd version of Pokemon Monopoly.
Includes:

* 6 collectible Pokemon movers - Chikorita, Totodile, Marill, Cyndaquil, Bellossom, Pikachu
* 32 Plastic Poke' Centers and 12 Poke' Marts to improve your Pokemon's strength
* 28 Pokemon Deed cards and 7 denominations of Pokemon-themed play money
* 16 Ash cards and 16 Professor Elm cards, replacing the traditional Community Chest and Chance cards
* Special optional Poke' Rules and full-colour Gameboard

Game info:
In this Gold and Silver Pokemon edition of the classic Monopoly game, you'll travel around the board in search of Pokemon from the Johto World. The more Pokemon you collect, the more powerful a trainer you become. Add Poke' Marts and Poke' Centers to make your Pokemon even stronger. Ash cards and Professor Elm cards may bring rewards or other surprises. Bargain, trade and fight with other trainers to collect the most powerful Pokemon team and win the game!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Courier
description:
Courier is a game in which 2 to 4 players become employees of Hoot Deliveries and must deliver goods faster and more accurately than other employees for the COTY (Courier of the Year) award. Courier is an abstract strategy game. Despite its compact configuration, deep gaming, and cute artwork will fascinate you.

From cereals ordered by someone at a cottage in the deep woods to a winter coat to be delivered by a huge department store, deliver them safely, accurately and successfully!

Players must ship their assigned delivery boxes to a town consisting of 3x3 tile layout. Players move their Courier in town first when it's their turn and then place own of their delivery boxes on the extra tile and push it into the line where their own Courier is in town. This could lead to the other delivery boxes being pushed out of town. Players have to push their delivery boxes into town and push the other player's boxes out of town. When delivery boxes of one kind of color is lined up, its owner obtains a score token.

Excellent Courier of the Year is you!

-description from the publisher

name: Balla Balla
description: Balla Balla is a dexterity game where up to 4 players compete simultaneously in bouncing balls through holes in a wall into a pit. Whilst each player is sitting on his side of the pit, balls come bouncing back or even through to the other side, and quickly the competition, of who is the fastest to sink all his balls in the pit, is on!

name: Aisopos
description:
User summary:
Aisopos is an abstract multi-player pawn-taking game with face-down pawns, played on a 3x3x3 hex board. The pawns' strengths are decided by a two-dimensional scissors-paper-stone method, based on some of Aisopos' fables: The human outsmarts the fox, the fox takes the mouse, but the mouse defeats the human. The Lion defeats both human, fox and mouse, which in turn all three defeat the ant. But the ant is the only one who defeats the lion.

Players start with 2 of each creature and take turns either placing a hidden pawn or moving an already placed pawn. If you move onto another pawn, the attacker secretly looks at the defending pawn, and the defeated pawn is taken off the board and placed before the winning pawn's player.

The game ends when one player is completely out of pawns, and the winner is the player who has most points in defeated pawns. The different creatures are worth different amount of points.
mechanics: Area Movement, Memory, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Dicing Farmland
description:
Dicing Farmland is a game based on the Grid Coverage mechanism.

Different from the game with established shapes, Dicing Farmland requires players to draw the shape of each crop by themselves.

Then place the crop in the big Farmland. After that, the harvest action becomes the last Coverage - Cross out the planted crops. Each step is related, manage the farmland carefully!

Grow the most valued Farmland and gain the most points against your opponents to win the game.

—description from publisher

name: Ben ik... Napoleon?
description:
How many words, movie titles or famous people, can you and your team guess in 90 seconds? Set the word generator on your head, press it and a word appears. More than 2000 names, movies, objects and animals can be shown on the word generator. You're teammates can sing or yell instructions. You should lose no time to guess who or what's on your head because you have 90 seconds to guess as much words or names as possible. Ben Ik Napoleon is a party game where the fun and enthusiasm splashes.

(From the Publishers website)

name: TacDex: Halo
description: TacDex: Halo uses gameplay similar to well-known card game War, with players revealing cards simultaneously to try to claim cards owned by the opponent, but a battle marker determines whether a high or low card wins a particular battle and players each have special action cards to add new twists to the conflict.

name: Sakura
description:
Sakura is a 2-4 player game taking place during the Feudal Japan Era. Sakura is a strategy and a resource collection game.

The game begins by players assembling the game map with individual map tiles. Players then build a city and rice paddies, and collect resources to build an army.

Special Cards can be used to bolster your attack or weaken your enemy.

The game is over when any one player has conquered an enemy city.

name: DOSA
description:
DOSA is a skill game using MagDrop Technology. Players try to score high by throwing the DOSA discs, and have them MagDrop on the game boards. A MagDrop happens when the disc lands on the board without moving even a fraction of an inch!

The game is played over five rounds. Each round, each player throws the three discs, one at a time. Each disc is scored when it lands. After five rounds, the player with the highest total wins!

The game comes with 4 square game boards, 3 DOSA discs, 1 bag for carrying the game, 1 scoring pad, 20 silicone stickers to help keep the boards in place. Can you MagDrop?

name: ITZI
description:
ITZI is all about speed! Be the first to get rid of all five of your letter cards.

SETUP. Everyone is dealt five letter cards. Players should look at BOTH sides of their letter cards, and can either hold their cards in their hands or lay them out on the table.

Place the stack of ITZI cards in the center of the table.


One player flips over the top ITZI card and puts it in the center for all to read --or someone can read it out loud.
Players quickly look at their letter cards (both front and back) and call out a word that answers the ITZI card and that starts with one of their letters. For example, let’s say the ITZI card reads, “It’z an animal.” If a player has a letter card with a “K” on it, they could call out “kangaroo” and at the same time smack down that letter card on top of the ITZI card. (They also could have used the other letters on the card and said, “Tiger!” or “Iguana!” or “Newt!”.)
The first player to call out a correct answer and smack down their letter card gets to discard it.
A new ITZI card is flipped over and play continues.
The first player to get rid of all five of his/her letter cards wins the game!


BY THE WAY…

The letter you use must be the first letter of your answer. For example, if the ITZI card reads, “It’z a breed of dog” and you answer “Golden Retriever” you must slap down the letter “G” (not “R”). Or if the card reads, “It’z a drink with bubbles” and you answer “Root Beer” you must slap down an “R.”

If a player calls out a wrong answer, they have to take back their letter card, and they also have to take an additional letter card as a penalty.

One option is to play where the winner of the previous game gets to read the ITZI cards for the next game. (That person is not an active player when they are the reader.)

—user summary

name: Electronic Arcade Mania
description:
From the box:
"Arcade Mania is a skill and strategy game that features a mini arcade machine that's simple to operate, a challenge to play, and totally portable, so you can play a real honest-to-goodness arcade game away from an arcade!
To challenge THE MACHINE, you must react with lightning-fast fingers. Either to battle alien raiders, to track down a slithering serpent, to blast away at threatening missiles, or to run away from a very hungry monster.
It take skill to score points on THE MACHINE but it takes strategy to win the game. For Arcade Mania challenges you to collect chips during a match... and chips are accumulated either by winning on THE MACHINE yourself or by betting successfully on other players tackling THE MACHINE. You'll discover that WHO to bet on and HOW MUCH to bet takes clever planning and plotting."

The four arcade games are very simple and are played at three different skill levels, as decided by a throw of a die. The game features a colorful board (19 1/2 x 24 inches) and THE MACHINE, which requires six AA batteries.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Assassin X
description:
Nobody knows who or when, but one player is going to be the killer! Discretion and assassination attempt on one side, and vigileance stalking each other. Suspense guaranteed!

Assassin X is based on a user specific trading card (55 originals cards) through which you build your game and influence your opponents. It is a game of strategy and psychology in which deception and bluff you will need to win!

The goal of the game is the first player to have 5 pts. You gains points if
1) Successful murder = 2 points
2) Countering murder = 1 point
3) Discover an assassin = 1 point

Each player receives 5 cards that they keep secret.
The rest is the deck face down. A sense of play is defined for a turn. It will be inverted at each new turn.
Each round takes place in two stages:
- A phase of trading between 2 players.
- A phase of action for any player

If you receive the card or draw Assassin
you become a murderer. Unless you try to get rid of it, you should prepare your murder by collecting maximum points with maps of Crime Guns, Approaches,and Masters. However, be careful not to be detect because it may well be another player sends you the Police and there, it would be over.
Assassinate when you're ready!

name: Catchword
description:
Catchword is a game where players must spell out words using letters represented on cards and dice.

The cards in the game all have consonants while the dice have vowels. Each player is given 5 cards and a coloured token. Each turn, the dice are rolled and players try to form words using their cards and what is shown on the dice. One caveat is that players must also incorporate the die of his/her colour. When a word has been formed, the player sets aside the cards, draws to 5 cards, and play continues.

At the end of the game, the player with the most cards wins!

name: Swag
description:
Swag is a free game that was given away at GenCon 2002. For an additional $5, you could purchase the "Swag Bag" which included all of the components necessary to play.

Players represent convention attendees, wandering through the halls trying to grab the most free stuff (i.e.-swag). Players then deposit their swag in their hotel rooms for points, but don't hang around the Hall too long, or others will steal your new found wealth.

Each complete set of items is worth 8 points, single items are worth 1 point. When a player gets 25 points worth of Swag home, he wins.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Syndicate
description:
Players represent Crime Families trying to purchase legitimate businesses with cash acquired through illegal activities, such as money laundering and making hits on other families.

Each player controls a 'Godfather', a 'Counselor', and up to six 'Soldiers'. Each piece moves by roll of a different colored set of dice, each slightly weighted either high (for the Godfather) or low (for the Soldiers).

By collecting 'bounty' after making a hit, or transporting a briefcase to the 'transaction area', a player earns money. When he has enough, he may buy a factory, an apartment, or a pizza parlor. When a player has built all three legitimate businesses, he wins.

name: Buy or Sell
description: Educational game based on stock market charting. Players each have their own stock chart, created by the placement of tiles that depict stock chart patterns. A player can play on his stock with a rising pattern, or play on his opponent's, with a declining pattern. Not a bad way to learn about this 1960's technique of stock market analysis...don't know if it's still in vogue.
publishers: KMS Industries Inc. Scientific Games Div.

name: Astro-Dice
description:
Astro-Dice [Astroleg is Danish and nearest English name would be AstroPlay] A game for everyone who likes to play dice.

If you are not familiar with astrological terms, this could be your opportunity to learn them in an enjoyable way - by playing. This set of dice includes the instructions and rules for three games.

The Oracle for those who want answers to everyday questions. In this game you interpret the symbols on the dice.
Ruler of the Board - a game from 2 or more players to see who can take possession and become Ruler of the board. - a game from 2 or more players to see who can take possession and become Ruler of the board.

Aspect - for 2 to 5 players, who will use the planets to make aspects to each other within a chart wheel - for 2 to 5 players, who will use the planets to make aspects to each other within a chart wheel.

name: Shuttlewars
description: "A game of tactical, shuttle-to-satellite combat in orbit around the Earth. The Space Shuttle is armed with a 30 ton pulse laser weapon in its payload bay, and the three Killer Satellites are armed with either a similar pulse laser weapon or with proximity-detonated explosives."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Bias, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Variable Set-up

name: MTV: The Game
description: Take turns answering MTV trivia questions and lifestyle questions about your fellow players until one player has collected three tokens and the MTV Video Music Award moon-man. Very simple and straight-forward trivia game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Fast-Break Basketball
description:
Fast-Break Basketball is a dice-rolling game that emulates a three-a-side basketball match

Each player uses three dice to represent their players: forward, center, and guard. Each die has a custom face with its special symbol. The game's main mechanic is that an attacker (the one in possession of the ball) succeeds in his or her action by rolling a number higher than or equal to the defender's; special symbols tend to trump numbers.

The dice are placed on the board such that the centers face off against each other, while the forwards go against the guards. The game starts with a roll-off between the centers. The winner gains the ball (represented by the offensive marker), which grants a bonus to the attacker's dice rolls. Only forwards and centers can take shots to score points; the guards steal the ball. All positions can pass among each other.

The first player to reach an agreed-on score wins and ends the game.

name: The Tammy Game
description: The object of the game is to rearrange your original Tammy cards into a 3 card run and a 4 card run by keeping useful cards and discarding those not needed, always maintaining 7 cards in your hand. A run is a group of the same Tammy cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Three Stooges VCR Game
description: The object is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards, thereby ending the round. At the end of five rounds, the player with the lowest score is the winner.

name: Ego
description:
The first player is the one with the largest head circumference. A handy tape measure is provided to determining this.

Players move their pieces (brains) around the board attempting to be the first one to the finish. Players take turns turning over cards, and all players must vote on which card describes them best. The group by majority moves forward, by the number of votes in this majority group.

The mechanics are such that it is in the interest of all the players, including the player who is being analyzed to vote how they think that person is perceived. Perhaps the player may become a bit stereotyped, but it can be very revealing.

There is little point for strangers to play this game and the game can be unbalanced everyone does not know each other at least to the some extent.

name: Click!
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

Click! is a sophisticated strategy game for two players. The players represent two photographers willing to take pictures of neat subjects, like animals, in order to gather the most points. The game is played in two rounds. During each round, each player plays his own deck of cards: the deck is used both to move the photographer along the path, and to take a picture at the right moment. Animals turn out along the circular mountain trail, and a photographer needs to be ahead of the other if he wants to take a good picture: it is important to have a clear view, i.e. not blocked by anyone. Each subject is represented on a tile, and it is worth a certain amount of points, i.e. "cameras", in this game. At the end of the round, the players exchange the decks so they will both have the same chance of playing, then new subjects are drawn, and a new round starts. At the end of the game, the winner is the photographer with the most "cameras".

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

name: Wigwam
description:
The basic idea behind Wigwam is straightforward and players, while enjoying the elements Wigwam shares with classic board games, quickly appreciate the unique character of the game too.
The enemy Indian tribes, the brave and chief pieces, cross each others paths. The different moves and possibilities open to each of these pieces, together with individual role their tents or tepees play, create considerable suspense. Add to this a board on which pieces can move in 6 different directions and you get Wigwam. The aim is to render the opponent's warriors powerless either by capturing the chief or by encircling all his men, thus preventing him from moving further.

name: Kaiju
description:
Kaiju is a board game in which the player plays the role of a giant monster similar to famous japanese daikaiju eiga like Godzilla or Gamera. The object of the game is destroy mankind while we fight against other creatures.

Kaiju plays in a tile-board game that it's different for each game, with monsters with specific abilities, so it's offers a different fun every time played.

Kaiju is a game for two to four players, that you can download free in PDF format at its home page.

File includes all necessary components to play (rules, board game, tiles, counters, pawns), but player must provide two six-sided dice, pen & paper.
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Maze, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Logofix
description: A set of games played with 50 picture tiles. Players ask questions of each other in order to deduce the hidden tiles. Ages 6 and up.

name: Chequero
description:
The object is to capture all of your opponent's Chequeros.

To begin, all sliders are placed to the far right. At this point, the board looks like a regular Checkers board. A player's Chequeros are placed on the eight spots in the back row of their side of the board.

A player's turn begins by sliding one of the rows, and then moving a piece. The direction of movement is dependent on the color of the square - diagonally if on white, straight if on blue. The piece follows the line as far as the color is uninterrupted. Only Kings may move backwards. No pieces may move sideways.

A player captures their opponents Chequeros when they are on a space in the path of the player's move. The captured Chequero is removed, and the capturing Chequero stops in that spot.

name: The Glory
description: This game represents an abstract confrontation between six powers taking place over the whole world. Players build units and leaders, and using an area movement system send them into battle by invading other countries. The game also uses ships for sea combat. They can also be used to control trade routes. The game is similar in scope to Risk, but is a lot more strategic due to the added complexities of leaders. The Advanced game also includes economic rules.

name: Hopalong Cassidy Game
description: Each player controls two deputies out searching for outlaws. The object of the game is to collect the most reward money by capturing outlaws. When an outlaw is captured, he must be returned to the sheriff's office to collect the reward. If another deputy is able to catch up with deputies bringing an outlaw to the sheriff's office, that deputy may join up and share in the reward. Certain spaces along the trails allow outlaws to escape.
categories: Adventure, American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of District Messenger Boy
description: The object is to see which player will first become the President of the Telegraph Company. The players move metallic messenger boy pawns around a spiraling track. Some spaces direct a piece to advance for meritorious service. Spaces reflecting misbehavior direct a piece to go back, or sometimes to prison which requires a return to the start upon release. The first player to reach the center space by exact count wins the game.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Melodifestival
description:
The game is named after the Swedish version of the Eurovision song contest. The players are divided into teams with two participants in each team. Each teams playing piece advance along a track witch determines their action on a turn. These actions can be singing, charades or suchlike.
Should a team’s succeed in their task they are awarded a letter. They can then score points by writing answers beginning with that letter, to categories drawn at the beginning of the game, on their scoring sheets. Each correct answer scores one point.
The game is mostly memory based and rewards players that are knowledgeable about music.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Klodsmajor rejse spil
description: Traveling edition of Mechanism: Tower Stacking. The blocks are smaller, and the game comes with a little stick so you don't have to use your fingers.

name: Capharnaüm
description:
Imagine a quite clean, well arranged house...
Imagine now from two to six children living in this house who have of another idea in their head to leave their toys everywhere... Imagine finally Papa, Mama and Grandmother who follow them and make them clean up their toys! Here, you obtain CAPHARNAÜM, a game in which each one moves a child of which the goal is to be 1st to get rid of all its toy tokens. But each player also moves the adults with an aim of annoying his/her brothers and sister (and to obtain peace!). CAPHARNAÜM is a game about family in which the players more "aguerris" will quickly see the interest to be combined punctually for the greatest misfortune of their adversaries...
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Moola Money
description:
From the back of the box: "Hold on for non-stop flights, hilarious rendezvous and secret destinations. A Bizarre Chase, Jet Set pace, and a Twist of Fate!"

The first player to build a Swiss ATM account of $1,000,000 wins the game.

Players roll dice and move around the board, collecting and losing money. Sometimes they are forced to give all cash on hand to another player, but money can also be saved in ATM accounts. Specific spaces on the board allow for withdrawals and deposits to your account. Various cities around the world are represented on the board.

Re-implements:

Moolah
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nonsense
