The player with the highest combined total of all 4 cards wins the round and attracts the wren (bird). But be careful! Players can only use each color to score once AND Wild Cards are only useful if you have an odd number.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Pretense: The Geek Promo
description:
The Geek is a BoardGameGeek inspired Pretense role card, that's only available in the BGG Store. The card states "If another player visits BoardGameGeek.com, you may take their role card." Players need to sneakily convince another player that they need to look up a rule clarification, game rating, or anything else BGG related in order to steal their role and gain a point.


Included in Pretense (AEG edition 2016) (renamed as Nerd).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Rise of the Dragonhunter
description:
The thematic trick card game from the specially developed fantasy world "Peladia". Tactics and deduction skills are in demand! Rise of the Dragonhunter affords fast gameplay and long lasting playing inception.

2 playing modes:
1. Teamplay 2 vs 2
2. full competitive

Winner of one match is the one with the most victory points, but that doesn't mean that he will grab the most loot. The player who grabs the most loot wins the game. This can even be the one with the fewest victory points!

name: Génération Y
description: A trivia game with questions from 1995 to 2009 with Quebec cultural and political background. Each player has three cards in hands, on your turn you choose a card and ask the two questions. For each correct answer, players win black tokens. Some joker cards needs a die in order to know which questions to ask.

name: En la escena del Crimen: Especial CSI
description:
Solve the maximum number of crimes to become an expert in criminal investigation.
The goal is to solve a series of crimes and do it before the opposing team. A player reads the case and the rest will be detectives. Any player of the team makes a question to the master, he responds with YES or NOT, then any player of the other team makes another question. When a team has enought clues, try to resolve the case. If the explanation is correct, the team wins the game if not, the other team ask again. The team that resolved the crime before the other, wins the game.

name: Trollin': The Trick-Taking Cardgame
description:
Want a trick-taking cardgame that feels like an Internet flame war? If so, check out Trollin'.

In Trollin', the object of the game is to try to take as many trick cards as possible, without taking the most cards of the poison suit. If a player takes the most cards of the poison suit during a round/hand, they score no points for the round.

The game is playable with a reduced set of standard playing cards. In the 2 player version (the game is playable for 1-6 players), players play with Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and 10 of all four suits. The deck also uses 2 Jokers of different markings that are part of the Trump suit, which is Spades in the game, and are of greater value than the Ace, which is the highest in the trump (Cards go from high to low as Ace, King, Queen, Jack and 10). Players are dealt 9 cards each and 4 cards are not used and are placed face down, and out of play, for the round. As more players are added, more cards are added to the deck used.

The game also uses Hearts as the Poison suit. During a round, a player who took the most Heart cards scores zero points, while their opponent scores 1 point for each trick they won. In case of a tie for Hearts won in a trick, players score 1 point for each trick they won.

The game also features several optional rules, one of which is that a player can declare themselves Trollin' before the first trick is played. If a player declares Trollin', they score as many points as the number of trick they won, and their opponent(s) score 0 for the round, IF they player managed to take all available Heart cards that could be won. If the player declaring Trollin' fails to win all available Hearts, then they score zero points for a round and their opponent scores 1 point for each trick they won.

The game is played for a set number of rounds, or to a target score. The name of the game comes from the inspiration of the game, that is Internet flame wars and people trolling in forums on the Internet. The poison suit was discussed by the designer in Universal Mutators as a play mechanism.

name: Pictionary Dice Game
description:
It's "Pictionary in a can" with the Pictionary Dice Game. The new twist on the classic drawing game has two players rolling dice to decide what to draw next. Out of three descriptor dice and three subject dice, the players choose a die from each category to make a unique combination. The artistic battle is then on.

Draw as quickly as you can to help your team guess the combination. Your opponent's doing the same thing. The first team to guess right scores the point. The first team with five points wins it all, including the coveted bragging rights. Add this to family game night or pull it out at parties for an unforgettable game night full of laughs and really bad drawings.

name: Rechen Fuchs
description:
There are 3 number dice and 52 cards with bigger numbers.
Just draw the card, roll the dice and do the math so that you are the first who make correct calculations according to the card.
At the end of the game who have the most cards is the winner.

name: Hot Wheels: Track Attack
description: In Hot Wheels: Track Attack, players build a custom track together, then grab a car, and start racing. Luck with the die won't be enough on its own to become champion of the race, though, as players also need to avoid dangers on the track. Whoever first crosses the finish line wins!

name: Death Pit Duels
description:
In Death Pit Duels, you and your rival assemble a team of fantasy warriors who then duel in a series of one-on-one matches. Win the duel and take the spoils; lose and...well, it's not called a death pit for nothing! When the dust settles, who will be declared the victor?

The game is divided into two phases: Draft and Duel. In the Draft phase, players take turns splitting up randomly drawn fantasy fighter cards of various races (Cyclops, Goblin, Human, Orc) into two pairs. Their opponent then gets to select which pair to take. The player who originally split the cards into pairs must take the remaining pair of fighters that was unselected by their opponent. This continues until both players have built a team of twelve fighters.

The game then moves on to the Duel phase in which the players fight for a randomly drawn coin by revealing one of the fighter cards that they drafted. Each fighter has a base combat value and may also have a special ability to help them in the duel. The players simultaneously select a Duel card from their hand and reveal at the same time, adding the value of the Duel card to their fighter's combat value. The fighter with the highest adjusted combat value wins the coin. The game continues in this way until all twelve of a player's fighters have fought one duel each. The player with the highest total value in coins wins.

name: Antarctica (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
From the designer:

Recently whilst working in the remote Antarctic (on the Halley VI base), Ticket to Ride has proved to be a very popular game.

At some point it seemed like a good idea to create our own map.

Rules are the same as TTR-Europe, but with no stations.
It's tough to get around Antarctica and not all journeys are successful. When playing it is cramped and there is a lot of competition for few routes so uncompleted destination tickets are commonplace. With 5 players it can be very tough.

The board has little red aeroplanes (twin otters) instead of locomotives for 'ferry' routes and it has crevasses instead of tunnels but these are played the same way as tunnels.

The Amundsen Award (10 points) is given to the player with the longest route that includes the South Pole

Finally I include an alternative set of carriage cards made to represent the different vehicles we have here around site - obviously not necessary but fun for us here.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Röda Tråden Världen
description:
Röda Tråden Världen is a quizgame where the answer of all the questions are either a country, a city or a place. The game plays like the other games in the Råda Tråden series.

The game comes with 80 cards with two subjects on each card. Every subject have 10 clues. One of the players reads a card and knows the answer, tells the other players the subject, and then, one by one, going thru the clues. The players can try to answer on high levels and get a higher score, or wait to answer and get lower score. Every player starts each subject with 10 points, and loses one for each new clue. The winner is the player with most points at the end of the game.

name: Trick Question: The Clever Game of Quick Wit – Served With a Twist!
description:
Trick Question is the party game where things never mean quite what they seem! Every question has a trick up its sleeve, and it's a race to outsmart your friends. Will you grab the US! Totem and solve the riddle yourself, or reach for the THEM! Totem and put the other team in the hot seat? Packed with 400 brainteasers that will keep everyone guessing (and laughing), Trick Question is the next hit board game for clever people!

Sample Question: What is the difference between here and there?
Answer: The letter T

name: Le Trésor des Îles-de-la-Madeleine
description:
Get to the Islands; visit the villages to discover the clues leading to the treasure; be the first to get the treasure and leave the islands with it...before somebody else steals it!

Débarquer aux Îles; visiter les villages pour y découvrir les indices menant au trésor; être le premier à s'en emparer et à quitter les Îles en sa possession...en évitant de se le faire voler à son tour!

How to play the game?
A clue card ("Indices") is randomly selected and placed in the treasure chest. That now becomes the common goal to reach - where the treasure is hidden!

First Phase:

Each player receives a "Villages" card and secretly looks at it. Each player rolls a die; the player with the highest number starts. Players take turns trying to get to their destination ("Villages" card) as fast as possible by rolling two dice and only choosing one. When a player reaches her destination, she can now look at a clue card "Indices". The player draws a new "Villages" card and continues moving. The phase ends when all "Villages" and "Indices" cards have been drawn.

Second Phase:

In this second phase, there is no specific destination. Each time a player stops her movement on another player's village, she looks at the "Indices" card found there. Players collect clues until they think they have enough data (there are 10 clues total in the game - with 9 clues collected, a player should know exactly where the treasure is hidden). Then, they try to move to where the treasure is located. If a player has found the right spot, she takes the treasure and the third phase begins.

Third phase:

The player who has found the treasure first must leave the Islands, carrying it, by boat or by plane. Other players will try to steal the treasure by landing on the same spot. The game ends when the treasure is out of the Islands...and the player who leaves with it wins!

name: カルガモ★マーチ (Duck ★ March)
description:
Parent and child of Kalgamo is a good friend.
Always walking together, it is the same when crossing the road.
If, If you wait too long and the stray,
ducklings can not cross the road.
Then, there are a lot of danger on the road ... be careful!

name: Operation Pedestal: Convoy to Malta
description:
TPS Pocket Game #4

One of the post-card inclusions by Turning Point Simulations.

This is a Mini-game that simulates Operation: Pedestal which was a Convoy to Malta from Gibraltar in 1942. The game consists of 17 counters and a progress track.

name: Hot Seat: NSFW Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready to turn up the heat on the Hot Seat? These cards will have you sweating when it's your turn and laughing when it's someone else's. We've held nothing back and neither should you.

Ever wonder what your friends will only do when their drunk? Or what their most disturbing sex dream was about? There’s only one way to find out!
Hot Seat is required to play this expansion.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: 150th Limited Edition Canadian Trivia
description: This is a Canada-based trivia game released to coincide with the nation's 150th anniversary in 2017. It is a simple game where players or teams compete to cross the nation (board) on dedicated paths by answering trivia questions correctly.

name: Festival of Thousand Cats: Sakazuki Promo
description: Before setting up the game, add these two special cards into the deck to replace the two cards of the same season number from the basic game. The special cards will change the game end condition.

name: Match and Catch
description:
A fun game with words

Want to know a fast way to learn to read? Play the reading game from The Brainy Band!

Knowing letters is not enough to read! By playing Match and Catch, the kids will learn to put letters into words in a fun and easy way: whoever reads the fastest, gets the most tokens. The game is designed in such a way that the process automatically induces children to read and do it faster and faster.

To start the game, just open the box, place the tokens on the table and try to collect the most of these two-sided cards. The kids like to play, studying the brightly-coloured pictures and winning tokens. The game is great to take on the road, for vacation or to visit friends — wherever you are, prepare for some fun!

The game helps to develop the skill of reading words. Match and Simple rules and interesting game mechanics draw everyone in from the very first round.

name: Sussed?: Vices and Virtues
description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including what makes you brave, greedy, ambitious, cynical, truthful, hostile, ingenious, reckless, loyal, selfish and optimistic (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

name: Inside
description:
Inside is a game in which you can learn about each other's personal stories. Aren't you curious about what others have in their mind? Don't you want to know what's inside of a person you've just met today or a person you have known for a long time? Inside is here to open the door for you.

Randomly pick three cards from 101 story cards. Players other than the active player pick a topic tile. The active player secretly marks what they have in mind with the answer cards. The other players guess what the true answers are with the given clues.

Players gain 1VP (victory point) per card they guessed correctly. The active player gain VP equivalent to the numbers of the wrong answers from all players

Round 1 ends after all players have been the active player. Whoever has the most VP at the end of the round 2 is declared the winner.

name: Le Dernier Casse
description:
In Le Dernier Casse, you're trying to crack into opponents' safes and steal their ingots before they can get into yours.

Each player starts the game with three safes (i.e. three screens), a number of gold ingots that they secretly distribute within their safes, and three secret code numbers on cards. They look at the numbers, then place one under each safe to represent its combination.

At the start of the round, the active player reveals one more number card than the number of players. Each player in turn gives one of these cards to their left or right neighbor. The person receiving the card places it to the right of all their safes if the number on the card matches one of their combinations; otherwise this player places the card in front of one of their safes if the card is higher than that safe's combination and behind the safe if it's lower.

After everyone has finished the first phase, each player can attempt to guess the value of an opponent's combination. They must ante some gold, then identify a safe and a number. If they're wrong, the owner of the safe keeps their ante; if they're right, then the safe owner hands over all the gold in that safe to the active player. If all your safes have been cracked, you're out of the game!

name: Dragon Castle: The Look-Out / The Glass Fortress Promo
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter.

Double sided promo featuring The Look-Out (best for 2 players) on one side and on the other side The Glass Fortress (best for 3-4 players)
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Spider-Man Into the Spider-Verse Prowler Attack 3-D Game
description:
It's a race across the 3-D gameboard to become the hero of the Spider-Verse! The excitement builds as Miles Morales and his friends are under attack. Choose to play as a favorite Spider-Man character: Miles Morales, Spider-Gwen, Spider-Man Noir, or Spider-Man. In order to save the city, players can power up with the Spider Symbol. But watch out for the Prowler -- he can attack with his rolling die from the top of a skyscraper. Be the first hero to capture the Prowler to win! Game includes Prowler action figure.

Includes 3-D gameboard, 4 Spider-Verse character pawns, 12 Spider-Verse tokens, 2 web walls, spider symbol token, 12-sided die, 6-sided die, Prowler figure, 4 pawn stands, and instructions.

name: グリムフォージ (Grim Forge)
description:
Grim Forge is a drafting game played over seven rounds.

First you draft the hero cards that will be summon during the game. After that, each round you draw one mana card to place in front of you, and then you go to the Summoning for that round. In this round you use the mana cards you've collected so far to summon a hero.

When summoning a hero, you place them face down in front of you and pointed at another player. All heroes are revealed simultaneously and have one of three effects: they can steal points from the player they point at, they can steal from the neighbors of the player they point at, or they can deflect incoming attacks to the player they point at.

After seven rounds whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Hella 90s Pop Culture Trivia Game
description:
So you think you know the 90s?

Play over 400 pop culture questions crammed with pictures, trivia, and various game challenges. Relive da bomb movies & tv, phat toys, mad tech, fly fashions & OMG the music! You can even listen to the soundtrack on Spotify!

With Hella 90's Pop Culture Trivia Game teams battle each other over who rules the 90s in a series of turns between teams! Play over 400 pop culture questions crammed with pictures, trivia and various game challenges. If a player answers a question correctly they score 1 point for their team. The first team to score 7 points is the winner and will bask in 90s glory (cue the music)!

name: Cards of Olympus
description:
Build your army and defeat your fellow Gods to conquer Olympus.

In Cards of Olympus, Players share one deck of split-face, two-sided cards representing Mortals, Heroes, Gods, and Monsters that they can enlist to earn victory points and defeat their opponent. New cards can be purchased to build up the deck and cards can be upgraded to rotate or flip the cards. Doing so not only changes your future actions and resources but your opponents, creating a unique push-pull dynamic.

name: Tank Hunter: Girls and Panzer Edition
description:
This game combines the rules of Tank Hunter 2E with art and tanks from the Girls & Panzer series. The rules are the same as Tank Hunter 2E, but with some parts removed to make for an easier to learn and more streamlined game.

At the start of the game each player is dealt five tanks and one event card, and then you draft those to determine your starting hand. All tanks start out face down, but only face up tanks can attack or be attacked. You can flip your own tanks face up at any time, but you'll need to scout to force other players to flip up their tanks. Each turn you can attack, scout, or pass to draw an event card.

When you destroy a tank you collect it and it counts for points at the end of the game, with stronger tanks being worth more points. The game ends when all but one player run out of tanks or after the third Boco event card comes out, and whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: Spook Mansion
description:
Spook Mansion is an asymmetrical two player game.
One player is the investigator trying to escape and the other is the house itself attempting to ensure that this does not happen.

The investigator player uses action points to move through the haunted mansion trying to escape as the the house player places cards to expand the house or blocks of exits to draw more cards.

The investigator wins if he escapes before he runs out action points. Three times he can regain all his action points but there is a price, for a ghost will appear.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Map Addition, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Eat the Rich!
description:
Vive La Revolution!

On July 14, 1789, the peasants of Paris stormed the Bastille fortress, signalling the beginning of the bloody French Revolution. Join the fight with this fast-paced card game for 1-2 players!

Based on the Gridcannon system, Eat the Rich sees players draw a single card each turn before placing it in or around a 9 card grid. If you draw a Noble (Jack, Queen, or King), place it around the perimeter of your grid (or an opponent's, if playing against friends). If you draw a numbered card, an Ace, or a Joker, place that card in one of the 9 spaces on your grid. Choose carefully, because you can only place a card on top of an equal or lesser-value card.

Line up high-value cards for clever combos and calculated attacks on the nobles, but don't get ahead of yourself. If you draw a card you can't play, you'll lose points. Destroy all twelve nobles to win the game. A simple, intuitive score system allows solitaire or competitive players to track their progress.

Includes 2 decks of traditional playing cards for classic games. Add a second set and play with up to 4 players.

—description from the designer

name: Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz
description:
Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz is a fast, fun and strategic card game for all ages.

Duellerz is rock, paper, scissors....but not as you know it. We've added in special card tiers (Singles, Doubles and Rainbows) plus some game changing cards (Rock N Roll, Steal and Freeze).

It's simple. Each round, players play one card from their hand of five cards, with highest ranked card taking the pile. Rainbows beat Doubles, Doubles beat Singles and Rock N Roll beats them all. Or to mix things up you can play a special Steal card (to steal the highest ranked played card) or Freeze card (to Freeze the round for players to each play another card in the round).

After each round, player pick up to re-stock their hand to five cards. Once all cards from the game pile have been played, players count their win pile.

Win more cards than your opponents to become the Rock Paper Scissors Duellerz champion!

-description from publisher

name: Tomtens julspel
description:
What does the word Advent mean?
What is the plot called in Norway?
When did Arne Weise end up as Christmas host?

What do you know about Christmas baking, Christmas trees, Christmas calendars, Christmas in other countries, Christmas food, Jesus, Santa, Lucia and much more?

Question cards, Christmas songs and Christmas rhymes for adults and children.

The game is about collecting Merry Christmas tokens. Most tokens at the end of the game win. The correct answer gives a token unless the card indicates otherwise.

There are five types of cards; Question cards, True or False cards, Christmas rhymes, Humming cards and theme cards.

—user summary

name: Brno šalinou
description:
Brno šalinou:
The aim of the game is to travel from one place in Brno to another in the shortest possible time.
Delays, pickpockets or even forgotten bags complicate the players' journey.

Goal:
be the first player to complete his/her route.

Gameplay
At the start, everyone draws a start and finish points.
Then all player try to reach their destination around the city as quickly as possible.
In addition to trying to be the fastest, it is also possible to harm opponents and delay them.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Operation Perfection
description:
Players use the included tweezers to pick up the different ailment parts. But in this edition, they place them into the holes on Cavity Sam the way they're shown on the Operation card. The timer counts down as players hurry to insert the parts correctly. If they're successful, they keep the card and add up the points at the end of the game. If the timer goes off, all of the pieces pop!

Contents: Game unit, 20 ailment pieces, 21 Operation cards, tweezers and instructions.

name: Seinfeld: The Party Game About Nothing
description:
Celebrate the hit ’90s TV show in this hilarious head-to-head party game that will challenge what you know about the “show about nothing.”

Score points by answering trivia questions, charades-style acting, and guessing who said or did some of the most hilarious bits ever aired on television! You’ll even get a chance to fish for the marble rye like George and Jerry did!

It’s hundreds of Seinfeld-celebrating activities for outrageous fun!

Players will form teams of two and each turn roll the challenge die. There are five types of challenges and one "Newman!" icon. The different challenges will be asked to the current team and if they get them correct they will score some points.

The first team to 70 points or more wins! However if both teams have at least 50 points, one team may skip their regular turn to attempt the Marble Rye dexterity challenge (yes, just like the show!)

-description from publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Tempo
description:
Welcome to the unique show of Tempo, where your voice harmony, rhythm and melody will be the stars. Aren't you good at singing? Do you have no rhythm? Don't worry, it'll be fun!

Choose one player to be the metronome, they'll be in charge of keeping the tempo and dealing the cards.
The metronome chooses the cards according to their difficulty and shuffles them.
The first times you play, we suggest starting with value 1 and 2 cards.

The metronome deals one card facing up to each player and starts marking a time signature (one, two, three, four) repeating it throughout the round. This will mark the rhythm to follow.

After the first time signature (one, two, three, four) the rest of the players will sing the note on their card at the same time.

It the player has a (crotchet) card, it will last the same time that a number of the 4/4 time signature. A quaver will make us sing the two syllables in that same time, a triplet quaver, three and a semiquaver, four.

In each time signature, before number three, the metronome will give a new card to one of the players. Those will have to switch between their notes from now on. For each number of the time signature, they will sing a note. A player shall never have two cards more than another.

If at any time, the metronome detects a mistake, stops the song shouting 'TEMPO!'. All the players keep their card with the highest score, except the one who made the mistake, who gives their highest card to the metronome.

If nobody makes any mistakes and all the players get to sing their 4 notes during a time signature, each one keeps their card with the highest score and the metronome doesn't keep any.

The remaining cards are shuffled again and the player on the right of the previous metronome becomes the new one.

The game ends when all the players have played as a metronome once. The one with more points wins.
mechanics: Player Judge, Singing, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Sasaki (사사끼)
description:
Sasaki is a very fun game that is comparable to poker, blackjack, one card, and hula, and once you learn this game, you will not be able to get out of it. This climbing game for four players is said to be very popular in North Korea. It is named after one of the special combinations that can be played: Sasaki (사사끼) means 44A, that is two Fours and one Ace.

As in all climbing games the basic aim is to get rid of all one's cards before the other players. A player leads a card or a valid combination of cards and each player in turn must either beat the previous play with a higher or combination or pass. When no one can or wants to play higher, the played cards are set aside, and the person who played highest begins again.

Sasaki is a team game with temporary partnerships determined by the location of the two red 10's, so as well as playing their own cards, players try as far as they can to help their partners.

Sasaki is played with a 48-card deck made by removing all the Twos and Jokers from a standard international deck. The cards rank from high to low A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6-5-4-3. 1. 48 cards are dealt to 4 players, 12 each.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Prepper
description:
Don’t be scared – be prepared!

Do you think you’ve got what it takes to handle things when the shit really hits the fan? There’s only one way to find out…

If you’ve ever wondered whether or not you can weather a huge, destructive storm or total infrastructure collapse using nothing more than your wits, an axe, a paracord bracelet, a bottle of vodka and a dog, then this is the game for you.

The first main goal in Prepper is to build up a cupboard filled with everything you need to get through a crisis. While you’re doing so, you advance around the board and pick up extra items and skills by testing your own prepping, survival and general knowledge and abilities, during a fun and challenging trivia round in which you’ll answer questions and also interact with your surroundings and each other. By the end of the first round, you’ll have a great prepper cupboard – packed with items that could range from a packet of painkillers to a domestic electricity generator. So far, so good. Right?

Wrong. Prepper is a game of two halves. And in the second half, things really go south. You see, once you’ve tested your knowledge and built up your prep store as best you can, disaster strikes. What this disaster is, you don’t know for sure. It could be anything from getting lost in the forest to a total infrastructure collapse. And it’s happening to you, right now, and you need to do something about it.

A lot of people think they have the gumption needed to make it through a crisis. In Prepper, you get the chance to find out. And it’s not just about having the right stuff in your cupboard. Far from it, in fact. It’s also about having the skill to come up with creative solutions using only what you have at hand. It tests your ability to barter with your friends for the things you know you need right now – and which you’re also going to have to convince them that they won’t need any time soon. And, it measures your willingness to help others in their times of need – after all, one day you might need their help, too.

But more than anything else, it’s about using your wits and your kit to get through tough situations – which might range from a cut thumb or a power cut to the roof literally being torn off your house – while still, somehow, keeping it all about the LOLs.

You’ve got what it takes to play Prepper. In fact, you were born ready. Now all you have to do is prove it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Role Playing

name: No Dice
description:
Players use five dice to create math equations and try to score as close to zero as possible. Three dice have numbers while two dice have arithmetic operators (plus, minus).

Player roll dice up to 3 times to make an equation and score points. The final remaining player to not reach or exceed 30 points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Talaref
description:
Talaref is a trivia game that revisits the 90s and 2000s

The goal is to accumulate the most "refs" (the points in the game) alone or in team, by answering correctly questions on TV shows, music, cinema, news, sports... related to the 90s and 2000s !

When it's your turn, roll the dice.
If it's a category, answer the question to win the card and the associated "refs". The more difficult the question is, the more refs you get (from 1 to 3).
The dice can also indicate a challenge. In this case, compete with your friends by proprosing an answer on the topic described on the card, one after the other. The winner can steal a card to its opponent :)

600 cards
900 questions
150 challenges

name: Monopoly Polska
description: Monopoly Polska is a beautiful game designed for everyone who loves to play board games. In this edition based on the original one, the places You visit was changed to the local Poland favorite places. Those were chosen in the national vote! Invest wisely, be a tough negotiator - there is only one winner. Find your own way to get a fortune!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Rainbow Go!
description:
Compete over ten rounds to claim victory in this fast paced trivia game.

One player hosts the game and everyone else battles it out. Each question has seven clues but only one right answer. The clues get easier, but the less you use, the more points you win! Any player can answer every question, so it's a race to react and slap the "go" card first.

How will you play? Go! for a high score, guess early, and risk crashing out of the round? Or Go! steady, use more clues and cunningly capture more points?

After the ten rounds whoever has the most points wins!

-description from publisher

name: Sports Festa
description:
Sports Festa is a trick-taking game featuring characters from the Sanrio universe participating in various sports, such as swimming, track and field, or jump rope.

It is a must-follow trick-taking game without a trump suit. At the end of each trick, the players look to see if anyone has achieved any of the public goal cards, such as play the 2nd highest card in the blue suit, or sit to the right of the player who won the trick. If a player has achieved such a goal, they take the card and a new one is revealed.

The game lasts one hand, and at the end of the hand, the players count the points they've collected from the cards they took in tricks and the goals they completed. The player with the most points wins.

name: Der 6. Tag
description:
Cheat evolution. Breed new creatures from elephants, tigers and the like by mating. Funny combinations arise, such as the crophant or the turtdile.

But watch out for the rabbit! His mating behavior can mess up your planning a bit...

The 6th Day by Axel Hennig is a solo game for ages 8 and up.

Help nature a little bit. Pair two animals with each other and marvel at the result. Your goal is to have the most valuable collection of animals after four generations.

Shuffle all 18 numbered cards except the rabbit and place the first green, blue and yellow card from the top of the pile in the center of the table.
As a deck, you then take the remaining 15 cards in your hand. The red end-of-round card goes behind the deck.
If you play the rabbit variant, the rabbit goes behind the end-of-round card.

Each turn, you look at the top three cards of your deck.
After that, you have two choices: The evolution pause or the mating.
If you can't or don't want to mate any animals, you put one of the three cards to the right of the three cards in the evolution pause and then you take one of the three cards and put it behind your deck.

To mate, use the mating options shown on the cards.
Directional arrows also show you action requests for pairing. You turn one of the two cards involved either around its center axis or its long side and then put it behind the deck as usual.

If you see an exclamation mark next to the direction arrow, put the card aside. If you do, you won't be able to develop it, but it will earn you points in the end.

The other card used for pairing is placed in the center of the table. Then take a new card from the three already there and put it behind your deck.

As soon as the red end-of-round card is the top card in the deck, turn it according to its directional arrow and put it back behind your deck.
After the fourth round, total up your points by adding up the values of all the cards (from the center of the table, your deck, and the cards already set aside), taking into account any bonuses you have unlocked.

For example, if you have upgraded both Chameleons twice, you get nine points instead of six.

VARIANT WITH RABBITS

Once you have familiarized yourself with the game, you can use the rabbit.
Play two rounds, one without rabbit and one with rabbit using the same card order in your deck. Before starting the first round, write down the order of the card numbers to be able to create an equal deck for the second round.
Try to avoid a mating rabbit as this costs you victory points.
Your goal is to score more points in the round with the rabbit.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kukacvadászat
description:
Voracious worms ate the apples in the garden. Now it's useless trying to hide, the birds will find them sooner or later. Which little bird will be the most skillful? Which one will find the most worm?
Observe and memorize. Try to find which tree hides worms.
Roll the dice and move to a tree with your bird. Check if the tree hides a worm. Who finds the most worms wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Verborgen im Museum
description:
Verborgen im Museum ("Hidden in a museum") is an escape game full of riddles and puzzles that consists only of cards.

This game is about a long forgotten treasure that is hidden in a museum. The exhibits in the museum mysteriously lead the way to the hiding place. Can the players solve the riddles and find the treasure before it falls into the wrong hands and is gone forever?

By the way: The game material remains intact and can therefore be used again and again.

name: Únikovka: R.U.R.
description:
In the game, you find yourself on Rossum's Island, and you are Alquist, the head builder of Rossum's Universal Robots (R.U.R.) robot factory and the sole survivor.
The escape game R.U.R. follows the plot of Čapek's drama years after robots have taken over the world.
Experience an extraordinary adventure as the surviving Alquist and try to save the fate of humanity. The game will test your imagination, perception, and logical thinking.
categories: Card Game, Math, Novel-based, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Aves Argentinas
description:
In Aves Argentinas you will find a selection of 60 species of birds from all over Argentina.

Each card shows us three characteristics of the species it represents: the way they make nests, their favorite food and the place where they prefer to live.

What is the mission?

Find seven cards with one of these characteristics in common and shout Game! (or flap, or sing, or fly away, all are valid options).

Aves Argentinas is a game to learn about the birds of our country, essential for the natural spaces we inhabit: they pollinate plants, disperse seeds, control pests, and are part of the life cycle of other species. Their presence is an indicator of the health of a natural environment.

name: West Texas Railways
description:
In the print-and-play, flip-and-fill game West Texas Railways, players lay track, purchase shares, and build junctions, all while balancing the money they have and everyone else's actions.

West Texas Railways is a shared incentives game, meaning that company values are added up (across all players playing) and divided amongst the purchased shares of all playing as well, so whether there are two of you or ten, it's a wild ride.

Once someone empties their bank, the game end is triggered. The player with the most money wins!

To play, players need a partial deck of cards and sheet printouts.
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Goosebumps: The Game
description:
Maybe some monsters are better left on the page… Play out favorite Goosebumps books with your horror-loving friends in this board game based on the spooky childrens books series. Work together investigating to find items and Scare Score to rid the neighborhood of monsters to win, but don’t get caught! If even one monster achieves their win condition, you lose! Fans of Halloween and scary stories will love playing out scenarios based on their favorite fantasy books. Spin Master brings the fun of children’s entertainment home by offering a range of kids toys & games including baby toys, toys for girls, and board games. Collect your favorite stuffed animals, fidget toys, RC cars, action figures, dolls & accessories + more. From special gifts for men to baby & toddler toys for kids at heart, make your birthday gifts a breeze by shopping our diverse catalog selection. Still hungry for more, explore kids games, pool toys, outdoor games, and monster trucks for any time of the year. Get creative with arts and crafts, building toys and RC cars and take the action to the table with jigsaw puzzles for adults or card games. Spin into the sandbox today with Spin Master!

—description from the publisher

name: Cheap Shot
description: Cheap Shot is a rummy-style game of insults, with each player starting with a hand of seven cards, which take the form of subjects, conjunctions, verbal phrases, and retorts. On a turn, the active player tries to use the cards in hand to create an insult: "Your Secret Boyfriend / is a drama farmer / and / tells only lies." Unless the targeted player can come up with a block card, such as "Oh grow up!", the insult will stand as points. The more cards in the insult, the more points you score!

name: The #UpsideDownChallenge Game
description:
Each turn in The #UpsideDownChallenge Game, the active player draws a challenge card, which might be an individual challenge or a group challenge. Whoever the active player is dons glasses that flip their vision upside down, then they try to do what they've been challenged to do, such as giving someone a high five, pouring water into a glass, or drawing a picture.

You win and lose points along the way, and whoever first collects six points wins!

name: Falling Sky: La Révolte des Gaulois contre César (Deluxe Edition)
description:
Falling Sky: The Gallic Revolt Against Caesar, formerly Gallic War, takes 1 to 4 players into the military actions and complex politics of Roman-occupied but not-yet-conquered Gaul. Caesar and his hard-hitting legions cannot be everywhere and will not triumph without powerful allies among local tribes. But each Gallic confederation has its own agenda and must keep its eyes not only on the Romans but also on Celtic, Belgic, and Germanic rivals. Players recruit forces, rally allies, husband resources for war, and balance dispersed action with the effectiveness and risk of concentrated battle.

The Deluxe Edition includes both the base game of Falling Sky and Ariovistus expansion presented together in a square box with the "Vercingetorix throws down his arms at the feet of Julius Caesar" painting as cover art.

Released as an Ulule campaign, a Wogomat neoprene mat with the Gaul map cn also be included (mat dimensions: 100cm x 60cm x 2 mm).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Sinco
description:
A kind of Lotto for Christmas time. Instead of numbers, the game uses a traditional deck of Neapolitan cards, 40 in all in the traditional Italian-Spanish suits of Clubs, Coins, Cups and Swords. Each player has a mat showing 25 cards making several combinations of 5 cards each. The scores go from the single central card to 5 cards combinations, or Sinco.

The man on the box cover photo, is the designer himself, Emilio Salvatore. The other people are members of his family, daughters, wife and nephew in particular.

name: Bra$ilis
description:
In Bra$ilis, most of the citizen that come to politics try to take advantage of their position with schemes, make some extra money and raise in status and power. What move Bra$ilis is the power, in this game you will be able to feel that power.
Each player takes roll of a politic that has as a main objective obtain the majority of votes.
And for that, every move counts!! Make partnerships, create intrigues, lie and make a fool of other politics... in resume, everything you find in politics! Run away from scandals and corruption and try, at max, help (or trick) the population for more votes.

In each turn, players reveal a card/news containing three atributes: votes, image and money. Each of this political news will be disputed by the players according to their strategy. Players have a set of cards in their hands and place their political influence and power in front of them or in front of the other players, when they think their participation is enought they can chose to 'pass'. The politician that cointains the higher value of political power in front of him by the time everyone has passed is considered the autor of that scandal published and recieve all the information displayed in the card.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game accumulates more votes.

In the path to the victory, the administration of your image and money are essentials! With money you can buy political help, hiring a lawyer, marketeer or even a advertiser.
Your image, despite being the first tie-braker, will help you gain more or less cards during the game. But beware! The population is not watching the corruption quietly, there is a scale for their 'angryness' and they can start a revolution at any time!!
































































Em Bra$ilis, os cidadãos que entram para a vida pública querem, quase sempre, se aproveitar dos diversos esquemas e falcatruas e, com isso, faturar uma graninha extra e de quebra um pouco de poder e status. Afinal o que move Bra$ilis é o Poder e, nesse jogo, você poderá experimentar esse poder...
Cada jogador será um político de Bra$ilis que fará de tudo para, ao final do jogo, obter o maior número de votos possíveis e, assim, obter maior poder político. Mas não pense que isso é tarefa fácil, pois todos estarão brigando pelo mesmo objetivo e a população estará de olho no que acontece no Planalto.
E nessa hora vale tudo!! Alianças, intrigas, trapaças, acusações falsas, manipulações... Enfim, tudo que existe na política! Fuja dos escândalos de corrupção e tente, ao máximo, ajudar (ou enganar) a população para conseguir mais votos.

Source: Back of the box.

name: Secret Square
description:
From the publisher:

The Game of Great Questions! Kids love to ask questions, and Secret Square encourages great questions. One player secretly hides a chip under a square, then the other players ask questions to remove squares . . . until the only square left is the secret square. Simple enough for a 4 year-old, challenging enough for parents and older children. Great developmental game for young children—it enhances deductive reasoning, set-building, and sequencing skills. 1997 Parent’s Choice Toy Approval Award Winner.

name: アメノキリフダ (Heavenly Trump)
description:
In アメノキリフダ (Ameno Kirifuda), players play a trick-taking game where the winner of a trick places a chip on a 4x4 grid in the row corresponding to the suit of the card they played.

The suits of the cards represent the seasons, and the trump mechanism used is that the lead suit is subordinate to the "next season".

In addition to the cards used to take tricks, players draft cards which will grant points based upon having chips in certain suit patterns on the board. Players also earn points for having chips on the board, regardless of these cards.

The game lasts for two rounds and the person with the most points wins.

name: Archipel
description:
The fishermen in the Chinese islands must catch six kinds of fish and bring those to market. Each fish requires its own kind of bait, so it's not as easy as it looks — not to mention that sharks can also take the bait! The weather might get worse, and you might run out of fuel or bait, so look to your fellow fishermen to ensure that together you can get those fish to market.

On a turn in Archipel, you navigate between the islands. If you're at a harbor, you can get fresh bait, fuel and other equipment, and you can also have a look at the weather. Weather tokens are placed on the game board, making sailing more difficult between storms. Fish are placed face down on the game board. To try to catch one, you flip it over to reveal it, but you must have the right bait on board. You'll possibly then need to sell the fish at market immediately as your boat can hold only so much fuel.

If all the villages are fed and all players return home, then the day was a success and they've won; if no more fish can be delivered, however, they'll have to try again another day.

name: Batman: The Animated Series – 3D Board Game
description: Batman has fallen asleep at his computer. He dreams the cave has been invaded by criminals and Robin is in danger. Your objective is to earn the highest score as you help Batman capture the villains and save Robin.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Pit Stop
description: Pit Stop is a Formula One themed racing game where players roll the dice and move along the race track to be the first across the finish line. Various "Chance Spaces" add some variety by forcing players to re-roll the dice and refer to a "Chance Table" which has a variety of moves that can affect any of the players in the game. Players may also vary the progress of the game by changing lanes to try and block another player or by moving to an inside lane to decrease the total number of spaces until the finish.

name: Alarme
description:
(English: Freddy from the Firebrigade)

In each round a big plastic firetruck is shaken. That changes the order of a number of colored balls in the truck's clear plastic lid.

This order determines the order of cardboard firemen (neutral back, colored fronts) who have to be turned face-up in the correct order.

If a player makes a mistake, one of 9 haystacks (cardboard chits) goes up in flames.

name: NinjitZoo
description:
NinjitZoo is an action packed card game in which you assist a bunch of martial art animals - the Ninjanimals - escape their caged confines within an obstacle rigged zoo.

Three characters are randomly dealt out to each player at the start of the game. The first person to assist all their ninjanimals in escaping - wins! This is accomplished by using the escape routes, which are drawn from the deck each turn. However, the deck also contains obstacles that can block your ninjanimal from freedom.

But you'll have lots of help along the way. Don the Mysterious Mo to slip past a patrol of guards, or grab a Thickslick Rope to rendezvous on the roof. That Hovering Heli giving you trouble? Throw down a Smoke Bomb and Back Flip out of there!

And watch out for the robots, time portals, piranha infested moats, and all the lasers.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Humor

name: Patolli
description:
Patolli is an ancient Aztec board game that takes its name from the Aztec word for bean - patolli, meaning fava or kidney bean. The game is played on a curious diagonal cross-shaped board with red and blue markers and 5 bean-shaped tokens as dice. Patolli was associated with gambling and players often wagered vast treasures on its outcome.

The game consists of throwing beans (dice) to bring tokens onto the board, and move them towards an exit ramp at the other end. Tokens are safe on some squares, but mostly can be "eaten" if an opposing player lands on them.

The Kirk edition of the game includes a 49-page booklet on the history and background to the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: (Public Domain), Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Ludens Planet, Museum Rietberg, Steidl Verlag, The Kirk Game Company Inc

name: Pirate Rumble
description:
Online Purchase:https://mizo-games.wixsite.com/website/webstore

Pirate Rumble is a multiplayer party game with two modes- "Duo mode" and "Camp mode". Players playing the role of legendary pirates from all over the world pass through time and space to Arizona, United States in the late 19th century, competing for the mysterious treasure “Lost of Dutch”. Each pirate must compete with other pirates for the treasure even if they might sacrifice their life.

GAME PLAY

On each turn, all players play 1 card from their hand simultaneously. Then, everyone reveal it at the same time and immediately do the gesture on the card. After that, Count the effect of cards played on this turn.

There are 6 basic cards in the deck of each pirate. You can play "Load" to collect bullets; "Shoot", "Shoot Twice" and "Fire" to deal damage; “Dodge" to defend the damage; "Search" to find special cards which are more powerful than basic cards.

Everyone has to eliminate other pirates until one player survives alone. If only one player (one camp) survives, then the player(the camp) is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Articulate! Phrases
description:
The mechanics remain the same as in the original Articulate!, but rather than you're partner/team having to guess a single word, they have to guess a number of phrases or proverbs from cards drawn within a specific time limit (provided by a sand timer). The team then move their pawn a number of spaces around a board dependent upon the correct number of phrases they guessed. The board spaces determine the next rounds subjects from the cards drawn - Everyday, Pot Luck, Sayings, Leisure and a Free-For-All space. The winner is the first team to cross the finish line by making a circuit of the board, and then being first to answer the Free-For-All question.

—description from the publisher

name: Rette die Million!
description:
Rette die Million! is an adaption of the British quiz show "The Million Pound Drop" wherein participants compete in teams of two and start with €1 million in forty bundles of €25,000 each. The two-player team is confronted with two categories and chooses one of them from which to answer a multiple-choice question. The first four questions have four answers, the next three only three answers, and the final question only two answers.

The guessers must wager all of the money they have on each question, and they can divide their bets on multiple answers if they like – but one answer must have no money applied toward it. They keep whatever money was bet on the correct answer and lose everything else. If they run out of money before all eight questions, they're out of the game.

In a two-player game, one player is the quizmaster and the other the guesser. When the round ends, they switch places, and the player who keeps the largest sum of money wins. With more than two players, the player split into multiple teams; each team gives answers for one round, one player from another team is the quizmaster, and everyone else hoots and hollers whenever the first team goofs up and loses money.

name: Map It! US Edition
description:
Map It! U.S. Edition uses the same game play as the German-language 'Ausgerechnet!' series of games: Players deal three piles of 15 location cards from a deck of roughly 200 cards (naming cities and landmarks in the U.S. for this edition). They take one deck of 15 cards and put one location card on the direction board, pointing north, south, east and west.

On a turn, a player draws a location card – keeping the latitude and longitude on the back of the card secret from all players – then places the card next to the direction board, indicating how they think this location relates to the starting one. Is Honolulu west of San Francisco? Why sure, so place it by the west arrow. Location cards can be placed between cards already on the board.

After each location card is placed, any player can challenge the positioning of that card. That player reveals the back of the most recently placed card as well as one adjacent card. If the challenge was correct – and the card placed wrongly – the challenger wins a point chip from the placer and the card is removed; otherwise the challenger hands over a chip to that person.

After 15 cards are placed, there is an interim scoring in which all players secretly guess how many cards have been placed correctly. Guess correctly, and you score two chips; if no one is spot on, the closest guesser wins a chip.

After three rounds and the final interim scoring, the player with the most chips wins.

name: Diffusion
description:
Diffusion is a two player game which employs a Mancala board and a set of like-colored stones. Here a 2×6 board with 48 stones will be used. Initially the board is set up with four stones in each of the small pits and no stones in the large pits. Each player owns the 2×3 pit block to his left. The winner will be the first to empty all stones from their block. Diffusion is a unique, robust addition to the family of Mancala games. Draws and ties cannot occur in Diffusion. Mark Steere invented Diffusion on January 20, 2006.

Online Play


Super Duper Games
Play Diffusion on games.wtanaka.com (real-time or turn-based)
Play Diffusion v2 on games.wtanaka.com (real-time or turn-based)

name: Galactic Expanse: Starship Battles
description:
Publisher's description:

This is an exciting card game of strategy, tactics and chance in deep space combat between the warring space-faring humanoid species who all feel that the galaxy is not big enough for all of them. Their starships combine the awesome firepower of powerful particle accelerator beam energy weapons and devastating hyper-speed torpedoes for close combats and long-range raids by smaller ship-borne strike craft and the deadly mercenary shadowcraft. The four different species can ally in various patterns, resulting in different combinations in different games, or they can operate alone. Players determine when and where to seek battles; to launch distant raids or close with the enemy for battles within star systems or nebulae. The side that scores the most victory points by vaporizing enemy ships and winning star systems wins the game. This is an entertaining and fun card game where every playing is different. Playing time is one to three hours.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Astrum Resurrectione
description: Build your own solar system in this fast paced, space game for 2-7 players. During the game players race to connect planet and star cards together to form a unique, expansive, solar system scene. Final victory is secured in the end by the player with the most galaxy points.

name: Invasion of the Brood
description:
In the year 2025, the telepathic monster Broodmaster Magnalux has established a base on Earth’s moon. As the human player, you must alert humanity to the threat, and rally armies, navies, and air forces against the alien menace. As the Broodmaster player, you must subvert the Earth, using your mind control to gradually take control of Earth’s most vital defenses.
Invasion of the Brood is a two-player strategy game, in which the two sides have greatly different strategies, abilities, and even turn structures. Will humanity pull together to stop this alien invasion, or will the sinister Broodmaster take over the world? You decide!
categories: Dice, Horror, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Bakugan Brawl
description:
From the back of the box:

Strategy is your most powerful weapon. Use it wisely and claim victory.

Go head to head! Choose to play as Dan or Masquerade in this action-packed board game. It's one part chess, one part card game and all Bakugan action. You have 13 warriors to command on the battle board, each with G-Powers and elemental bonuses. With your strategic use of playing cards, you can either bring sweet victory or crushing defeat. Arm yourself with strategy and protect your Brawler at all costs!

Submitters' Note:
Looking at the rules, it looks more like "one part Stratego" more than "one part chess".
mechanics: Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Prinzessin Mina: Juwelen-Memo
description:
Prinzessin Mina: Juwelen-Memo is a memory game and jewelry-making kit in one!

To set up, lay out all of the tiles face down; the tiles come in different shapes — round, oval, octagonal, etc. — that match the shapes of cut jewels. On a turn, a player reveals two tiles, and if the tiles match, the player keeps them, stringing one of each on either side of their starting player tile, thereby creating a necklace with their winnings as the game progresses. In the end, whoever has the longest necklace wins!

name: Rise of the First Dynasty
description:
In Rise of the First Dynasty, 3-5 players vie for control over the whole of Egypt as the potential leader of the mythical first Dynasty of the ancient land along the Nile.

Each player has a set of three identical actions. Played over ten Aeons (or rounds), in each Aeon each player chooses one of his action cards. Depending on the actions chosen by each other player, the player will gain actions, such as conquering new lands, blessing the lands he has already conquered, or using Edict cards to thwart the other players' plans and protect his own. Light, quick, and downright dirty, Rise of the First Dynasty plays in around 30 minutes and scales well regardless of players.

name: Typ-Dom
description:
TYP-DOM is a combination of dominoes and crossword puzzles, using interlocking pieces with letters on them. There are fifty of these tiles in black with consonants, and thirty in red with vowels. The rules provide for several game variations involving players taking turns using random tiles to construct words and score points. The first player to exhaust his tiles or score the most points is the winner.

TYP-DOM was granted a patent in Austria in 1938, and may have had more success abroad if not for the interruption of World War II. More recently, Piatnik has published several editions in Europe.
publishers: F.X. Schmid, Franz Weigl, Piatnik, Schmidt Spiele

name: The Game of Life: Disney Parks – Theme Park Edition
description:
Here you leave today and enter the world of yesterday, tomorrow and fantasy. Welcome to the Disney Parks! Be our guest as you venture through all the wonder and excitement that the Disney Parks have to offer in this special Theme Park Edition of The Game of LIFE.

Magic in the details
Your Disney Parks Guide will be there as you wish upon a star, but beware, a Disney Villain may cast a spell and rain on your parade. Make all your wishes come true and bring the magic and memories home to your own castle in the sky.

name: Pocket Ungame: Couples Version
description:
Pocket Ungame - Couples is another expansion for "The Ungame" that can be used as part of the original board game or by itself as a standalone talking game. Like other Ungame expansions, this one comes with 2 decks. Deck one contains light questions meant as ice breakers and deck 2 contains questions meant to spark deeper conversations.

In Pocket Ungame - Couples Version, players are encouraged to share their opinions, feelings, and beliefs through the asking of simple questions. Questions come from card prompts; there is a 'light-hearted' deck and a more serious deck of questions. Ideal as an ice-breaker as it is fundamentally non-competitive.

Contains 140 cards.

From the Publisher:
Examples of Pocket Ungame “Couples” Version:

What quality do you like best in your mate?
What is something you really like about your relationship?
What adjustments must be made when a couple has children?
What emotion is most likely to interfere with your relationship?

name: Kopernikus
description:
Wooden board contains four concentric rings in which balls representing planets (Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn) are held and dips where they may rest. Players get cards depicting planetary positions and attempt to move planets into the correct configuration of their "constellation" card. The first to make 7 constellations wins.

In the original Edition Perlhuhn edition, 10 constellations were required for the victory.

name: Am I a Banana?
description:
Content: board, 40 cards, 4 pawns and ribbons in 4 colors,

"Am I a donkey? ...Or perhaps a washing machine?"

Which one of the 80 items could you probably be? The player with the mos skillful questions will find it out first and win. Through different questions come to know which object you have stuck on your forehead with a headband. You must ask one question at a time.

name: Salamanca
description: The battle of Salamanca is a Napoleonic operational game that simulates the historical confrontation between a French Army (known as the Army of Portugal) commanded by Marshal Marmont and an Allied Army, commanded by Viscount Wellington of Talavera, and composed of British, Portuguese and Spanish Troops. The Battleground lay a few miles south east of the ancient city of Salamanca, The battle was fought on the 22nd of July, 1812.

name: Cleopatra's Gambit
description: Cleopatra's Gambit is a game of strategy played across three separate boards. Players take turns placing a piece upon each board simultaneously, trying to form one of three special patterns. Each board is made up of 36 hexagonal spaces in a different configuration. Where you place your piece on one board dictates where you can legally place on the other two boards. The first player to form one of the three winning patterns on any of the boards wins.

name: Grapple
description:
From back of box:

Players compete to outguess each other in this crazy mixed up word game. Everybody chooses his own secret word, assembles the letters and scrambles them before showing the other players. Can you find a word in the mixed-up letters? You have to be quick, your opponents are looking for it too.

name: Commando Raid on Rommel
description: Originally published as a mini-game in Panzerschreck Magazine #5. The game and map needed to be photocopied and mounted prior to play. Commando Raid on Rommel focuses on a British Special Forces attempt to kill Erwin Rommel during the war in the desert. Subsequently issued in a "Zip Edition" featuring color counters (plus 9 counters not in the original game) and a cardstock map. The counters still need to be mounted prior to play. The Zip Edition also contains optional rules for more aggressive play.

name: Espionage
description: 12 pieces per player with variable move pattern need to recover microfilm tokens from the center and return to home base over square grid symmetrical base. Quality feel to box board and pieces. Simple rules.

name: Bible Charades
description:
The historical game of hysterical fun!

You've played charades before, but never like this! A new twist on Bible knowledge games that is guaranteed to animate every party, youth group, classroom, or family gathering. Teams of players race around the game board by correctly guessing charades of clues in one of six categories.

Bible Charades provides an excellent way for families and friends to strengthen their knowledge of God's Word.

Simple versatile rules allow for limitless variations

1,200 charade titles in 6 categories

Color coded categories with convenient on the board reference

Optional timer - select your own pace

2-4 teams, Ages 10 and up

Games includes: 200 boxed topic cards, game board, four playing pieces, die, 30 plastic chips and instruction sheet.

name: Trailer
description: Trailer is a quiz game about movies. Players are divided in four groups and have to reach the end of the board by drawing a card and answering the correct name of the movie that's written on it. It can be a comedy, a drama, an adventure, a classic or a thriller, depending of the area that the players are in the board. The less hints they use to guess the movie's name the more they're able to move.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Spontan, Woran denkst 'n Du ?
description:
This is a game for ages 14 and up. The box contains a board, 8 pawns, cards and an hour-glass.

The cards contain numbers (1 to 6) and words.

On your turn you have to call a number, take a card from the stack and read the word next to the number you have called. You write down the first word that comes into your mind. The other players have now to guess one by one what word you have written down.

If someone guesses the right word you can both move your pawn 2 fields on the board. If no one was able to guess the right word, everybody can guess as long as the hour-glass keeps running (45 sec). If someone is able to guess the right word now, you can both move your pawn one field on the board.

The first player to reach the destination field on the board is the winner of the game.

name: Reise durch Europa
description:
Travel through Europe collecting souvenirs. The first player to get 25 Souvenir-Points (Stars) and return home wins the game.

Event cards can hinder your opponents, foiling their plans to visit a city before you.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Syl-la-bles
description: Syl-la-blesis the game that encourages you to think big. Choose a bigger word to get more points, but spell it right or you score zero! "Thesaurus" and "Spelling Bee" cards test your vocabulary and spelling skills. This is a unique game for playing with varied ages, because you set your own point goals--for individuals or the group--before you start the game. Tested by the Canadian Toy Testing Council and recipient of the 2007 Seal of Approval from The National Parenting Center.

name: I Am, I Do
description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

A fantastic mime game for children. Can you imagine a giraffe dancing or a tortoise playing a trumpet? In this mime game you have to act out many crazy and hilarious things. Throw the coloured die which decide who you are and what to do. Afterward you act out what the die wanted you to do, and the other players try to guess what you are acting. If somebody guesses correctly, both you and that player move forward on the board. If you are lucky the spinner will permit you to move forward faster. Be careful when laughing! If a player laughs at the player acting, he/she must move backwards on the board. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

name: Virvar
description:
Virvar is a children's memory game that is also quite fun for adults. At the start of the game, the twelve symbol chits (numbers, fruits and animals in four colors) are put under the cups and placed on designated places on the board.

During the course of the game, players move their pieces and must perform specific actions, like swapping two cups or guessing which symbol is where. A player may also challenge another player. With each mistake, the player loses one life.

To even out age differences, players may start with different amount of life cards.

Contents:

1 game board
12 symbol chits
12 cups
4 playing pieces
28 life cards
1 die

name: Sustentabilidade
description:
Be part of a team with a serious and urgent mission: to save the Earth from human agression. Teach people about future risks, research new technologies and fight critical dangers. You must create solutions as a group to restore the environmental balance of our planet.

Sustentabilidade is a Pandemic-like cooperative game where the group of players must defeat four modern problems: Garbage, Nuclear Menace, Pollution and Deforestation. To achieve this goal they have to search for two kinds of solutions for each problem: discovering new resources (The Way of Science) and teaching people about the risks and how they can help (the Way of Consciousness).

The board is a map divided into regions and oceans. Each round has five tasks:

1)Players receive a certain number of action cards and use them to execute tasks (move pawns, remove crisis marks, move the ship, play dice to achieve the way of the science or use shapes to achieve the way of the consciousness).

2)Each region that has at least one crisis mark receive one more mark of the same color.

3)Destruction count: the stone of destruction is moved the number of regions that have a crisis. When the stone reachs 80, the players lose.

4)New Crisis: one player draws a certain number of region cards and add crisis marks to them.

5) Players receive new action cards.

The players win the game when there is no more crisis marks on the board.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Russia: What Do You Know About It?
description: Game "Russia: what do you know about it?" Consists of 2400 interesting questions about Russia and Russian people. Issues are distributed in six different disciplines: history, culture, science, geography, sports and general knowledge. During the game you learn more about their country. You also do not interfere with luck, to win this game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lassos & Longhorns
description:
Lassos & Longhorns is a cooperative dice game where players work together to drive a herd of cattle north to the rail station. By balancing the speed at which they travel, the weight of the herd, and the health of the cowboys, players race competitors to be the first to Wayward Falls to sell their cattle for the highest price. But Butch Montgomery's gang of cattle rustlers, as well as the terrain, weather, and wild animals, aren't going to make it easy for them.

Lassos & Longhorns uses simple, push-your-luck mechanics, to allow for one to four players to work together on the cattle drive. The game is free to download over on the Corvid Games website.

name: Estiméo
description:
In Estiméo, players are presented with questions on challenge cards that must be answered with numbers. Sometimes the cards have fixed answers, while sometimes the answers are variable — possibly even something that needs to be verified with the included tape measure.

What's important, though, is not necessarily the exact answers, but whether you can sort the cards in ascending order...

name: Eureka!
description:
In Eureka!, players race to spot a shape on the table that matches the challenge card that's just been revealed: Which shape has two sets of parallel sides? Which has a perimeter less than or equal to seven? Which has three or four obtuse angles?

Each player has three cards in front of them, with these cards having been taken from their personal deck; each one shows a shape against a grid (to help players identify the properties of that shape). If a player chooses the correct shape, that card is discarded, and if that card was in front of an opponent, the active player discards one of their cards as well. If the player chose incorrectly, they put their own card under their personal deck and draw a new one (thus setting themselves back one card); if they chose the opponent's card, then they place that card under their deck, helping their opponent and hurting themselves.

The first player to get rid of all their cards wins.

name: Fashion Show
description:
A selection of patterns. Can you find an outfit that fits you? In Fashion Show, you are to quickly match a pattern combos on the game board as shown in the style mixer. Once you find the right combo, place one Fashion Show model on it to dress her. But be quick, you don't want anyone stealing your skirt! The first player to 'dress up' all of the eight models win the game!

The game board is full of patterns. The style mixer has four dice that will show random patterns, and players must place their tiles on the board so that the patterns underneath the tile (the tiles have holes so you can see through them) match two of the dice.

name: Ubongo Mini Demo
description: Free demo version of Ubongo Mini for 1-2 players. Contains six puzzles and twelve tiles per player.

name: Elemonsters: Das Kartenspiel
description:
The Monsters are unleashed. And only a master of the elements can defeat them.
The whole world contains only less than 100 chemical elements. Everything we know is made from them. But what, if the elements would come alive as monsters?
In this game, you can let the monsters fight each other. You can create chemical compounds and learn interesting things from the world of chemistry.
Elemonsters in action.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Monster sind los! Und nur ein Meister der Elemente kann sie bezwingen.
Die ganze Welt besteht aus weniger als 100 Elementen. Alles was wir kennen, ist aus ihnen gemacht. Was aber wenn die Elemente als Monster lebendig werden?
Mit diesem Spiel kannst du Monster gegeneinander kämpfen lassen, Verbindungen erschaffen und Interessantes aus der Welt der Chemie erfahren.
Elemonsters in Aktion!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: You Laugh You Drink
description:
150 cards with hilarious prompts that will make you laugh! On your turn, do what the card says and don't hold back. Can you keep a straight face? Keep a straight face or bottoms up!

HOW TO PLAY


The funniest person draws a card first. They are now the Joker. The Joker silently reads the card to themselves.
The Joker then tells the group who they are going to target. The Target is the person they are trying to get to laugh.
The Joker now has 30 seconds to do whatever is on the card, doing their best to make the Target laugh. Everyone else (including the Joker) is allowed to laugh.
If the Target laughs, they drink and the Joker keeps the card and gets a point. If the Target doesn’t laugh, the Joker drinks and the Target keeps the card and gets a point.
The person to the Joker’s left now becomes the new Joker. The new Joker draws a new card and picks a new Target. The same person can’t be targeted twice in a row!
First to 7 points wins.


Note: The Joker can always pass on their turn if they don’t want to do what’s on the card. They should take a sip of shame if they choose to pass.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Questions and Answers, Storytelling
