name: Investigation Files: Meurtre à Paris
description:
Investigations Files is coming to Paris! The League, an international detective agency, has been contacted about the death of Hannah Dubois.

It immediately seems obvious that his death was not as "accidental" as the Paris police would have us believe.

However, when it comes to such a wealthy and respected family, the truth is not easily uncovered.

In the investigation game Investigation Files - Murder in Paris, you will have to decipher codes to solve puzzles, read police interrogation reports and witness statements, analyze clues, unlock new stages thanks to advance of your deductions.

The mystery awaits you! The League needs you!

name: Wildcatter
description:
"The Authentic Oil & Gas Exploration Game" has an educational aspect to it, as the drilling success ratios, drilling depths, costs and monthly production figures were taken from the real world.

The game is played within the U.S. and Alaska; the players lease properties and drill for oil and gas, trying to get rich. On each lease, you must decide whether to go for shallow or deep wells --once a well has been drilled, even a dry hole, all future drilling must be done at the same depth, even if the lease changes hands. The first few wells are Exploratory and have lesser chances of success; once a producing well has been drilled, further drilling is Developmental. When you land on a player's lease, you buy its monthly oil production from him; landing on your own lease nets you double that amount (paid by the bank). Payments also roll in every time you go around the board.

Random events are injected by Wildcat and Blowout cards. The rest of the game falls in line with what its design is: a Monopoly clone. Big box with lots of fairly nice bits, however.

name: Garfield's Crazy Card Game
description:
A Garfield themed variation on the card game "Uno". From the back of the box:

"A pick up, put down game for sneaky people who get a kick out of tricking other players. The trick is to make them pick up while you're putting down. If you're tricky enough you'll get rid of all your cards."

The box contains 72 Garfield cards and a rule sheet.

There are four colored "suits" with cards numbered from 2-6, and a number of special cards which can affect turn order and force other players to pick up cards, miss turns, etc.
publishers: F.X. Schmid, Murfett Regency, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Houdini's Poutini
description:
Harry Houdini is throwing a dinner party for the world’s greatest magicians. To make this evening more special, he has prepared a unique delicacy — poutine! Unfortunately for everyone at the party, Houdini is a terrible cook. Each player must use their skills in magic to escape from the party without hurting Houdini's feelings.

Houdini's Poutini is a competitive game in which each player represents a group of five magicians. They must collect a combination of item cards with which they can perform magical escapes from the party. The Houdini card will mingle about the party, making it more difficult to escape the party without hurting his feelings. You must use your skills as a magician to get your entire group free from the party before time runs out and the poutine is served. When only one player remains or time runs out, anyone who was unable to escape must politely choke-down Houdini's ill-prepared Franken-dish.

A variation on rummy with a splash of Old Maid with lots of screwing over your opponents, Houdini's Poutini is a fast-paced and exciting card game for any with a strong mind and stronger stomach.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: My Little Pony Game
description:
The Little Ponies have gone to the fair.

Players travel around the board representing the fairgrounds. The primary feature of the board is the merry-go-round. While going around the fair players try to collect gold rings. Riding the merry-go-round is the best place to get them, but you only get to ride once each trip around the board unless you have a free ride token. The first player to collect five gold rings and leave the fair wins.

This is a great game for kids, but has enough to keep adults entertained as well.

name: Flibbix
description:
Flibbix is a "make-your-own" board game, the first game by Merillian Games. The board consists of a series of magnetic tiles which can be flipped for different effects. A game begins by laying out the tiles (Merillian provides some sample layouts, but you can create your own order) and selecting various rules from a checklist (who goes first, what happens if you land on another player, etc.).

Once everything is set up, it's a roll-and-move board game with the addition of cards that allow you to move extra spaces, swap places with other players, swap tiles on the board, or flip tiles over.

Flibbix is a combination of Flip, Blend, and Mix, describing the way that the game is played.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ultimate Driver 300 Deluxe Edition
description:
Taken from the game's official web site:

"The object of the game is to be the first to complete three laps and win the ultimate prize on the podium and the glory of winning –“Michael J. Richardson’s Ultimate Driver 300!©”. The trick doing this is to play “Race Point” cards in front of yourself face up to speed yourself along and get those laps locked away as fast as possible and to play “Event” cards and “Damage” cards on other players to slow them down and hinder their race so you can be the first to complete three laps, (300 points), and win the race."

name: Lightning Dice
description:
This is a fast and furious game of competitive dice rolling. ALL players are rolling ALL the time until a victor finally emerges!

Lighting Dice is a game that is simple, quick, and everyone plays every turn. It takes a combination of luck and skill to win but mostly it takes a quick eye and fast reflexes.

The winner is the first player to reach 20 points by matching the required numbers of the faceup goal card. Each player is assigned a player number (player 1, player 2, etc), chooses a color and takes the matching dice and pawn of that color. All the goal cards are shuffled and placed to the side. Everyone places their pawn on the start of the score track, and now you are now ready to play Lightning Dice!

name: Museum Pictoris
description:
Museum Pictoris is the board game in which players become great collectors of painting masterpieces.

The players will be able to compete collecting, buying and selling the best paintings of the History of Art.

Museum Pictoris is recommended for any age, from 8 years and up. Museum Pictoris is the best way to go deeply into the fascinating world of the History of Art. It is not necessary to have any knowledge about art to play and win, but after a few games and without any effort at all, one will become an art expert.

Museum Pictoris includes 144 high quality reproductions of painting masterpieces, selected among 50 museums worldwide, of 89 great artists from the XIV century Gothic Style to the XIX century Romantic Style.

Museum Pictoris is much more than just a game; it is a fascinating trip through the History of Art.

name: Alias Matkapeli
description:
The same classical Alias game that we all know and love is now available in travel version. Take it with you where ever you go!
The game is word explanation game and it is played in teams. One explains and other has to guess the exact word other is trying to explain to him! There is game board and you and you partner will move as much as you guessed. Winner is the one who finish first.
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Race, Team-Based Game

name: Frida's Fruit Fiesta Game
description:
Learn letters with Frida! It’s lunchtime in the rainforest and Frida is collecting letters for her little ones. Spin, find, squeeze, and set four letters in a row first to win this fruity preschool letter game. For 2-4 players.

Teaches letters and the alphabet
Develops fine motor skills
Develops strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking

Alphabet game for preschoolers

name: Garden Surprise
description: Players take turn picking sugar beets from a garden. Will you get a good harvest or has something been nibbling at your veggies? The player with the best memory will come out on top.

name: The Usual Suspects
description:
The Usual Suspects is a deduction game playable with common components. Players attempt to deduce which of twelve spies are innocent - with no knowledge, initially, if any spies are in fact innocent. Players record their suspicions during the game, and score them only when the game ends, such that everyone remains involved until the game is complete.

This game was released to the public in the Re: Geek of the Week #69 - Joe Huber thread.

Please note that this is a different game from the much better known and professionally published game Unusual Suspects.

name: Hard Day's Knight
description:
King Elvish has proclaimed his daughter, the Princess, has decided to marry. The Princess has narrowed her suitors down to the finalists present. You are all Knights in service of King Elvish. And like all Knights of the Kingdom you are madly in love with King Elvish’s daughter. After much discussion, King Elvish and his daughter have agreed that the most valiant of her chosen suitors will become heir to the throne. The first Knight to present the Princess with the 3 Gifts of Gallantry she desires will win her favour. To acquire these gifts you must complete quests and obtain Laurels of Valor. Many Quests are impossible to complete alone. So, to demonstrate you are a born leader, you must hire and lead an adventuring party chosen from the most Motley Crew of the Kingdom. But, as a Knight of the Kingdom, you have worked your whole life in service and in turn been supported by the King. You have no gold to spare. In order to secure the necessary gold to pay your crew you must moonlight on OPQ (Other Patron’s Quests). Use your gold and crew wisely to quickly complete as many quests as possible. Thereby securing your place as the true Rock Star Knight of the Kingdom and rightful heir to the throne.

In Hard Day’s Knight each player holds 3 action dice, 1 patron die, some gold coins, and a hand of Motley Crew cards. Each round begins with the available Quests of the day posted at the center of the table. A round is a single hard day in a Knight’s life attempting to complete as many Quests as possible. All players simultaneously roll their 4 dice at once. The patron die randomly determines the turn order for each round. To complete a Quest and receive the Laurels and daily income from that Quest card, players must match their action dice with the dice icons on the Quest cards. But don’t be so quick to grab those Quest cards. Each player has a chance to hire Motley crew members and disrupt the dice on the table, or possibly the turn order, as you fight it out to be the first to complete the available Quests of the day.

name: Little Rainbow Caterpillar
description:
A multicolored collecting game for 2-4 players.

Each caterpillar has a headpart and a tailpart.
Shuffle up the 6 different colored bodyparts.
Roll the die and match the color of the visible bodypart.
If it match, add the bodypart to your caterpillar.
Or wait untill next turn.

Who can complete his caterpillar, with 6 different bodyparts, first and wins the game?

name: Collect
description:
Stanley Gibbons Collect: as it says on the box, "share the excitement and tension of building a major stamp collection". Stanley Gibbons is a famous UK firm that sells postage stamps to collectors and published this game in the 70s to promote the hobby. There wasn't much to do in Britain in the 70s.
The game has a board of a 6x6 grid of squares giving certain instructions, a deck of cards showing stamps which fall into various categories (Great Britain, USA, Animals, First Day Covers etc), and some playing cash. Players also have 4 markers to block the board to other players. Players are dealt 5 stamps to start and may swap one with the stamp dealer (banker). Then you roll 2 dice and choose which instruction on the board to follow. So if you roll a 2 and 4, you can use the instruction at 2/4 or at 4/2 on the grid. Players buy, swap, sell, auction, exhibit, damage or fake their stamps until they make a winning set collection.
The stamps are nice.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Authentic Demolition Derby
description:
This is a simulation of a real demolition derby as it is done at your local fair grounds.

The box contents are:
A toy car for each player.
Damage tracking sheets.
Combat cards.
Derby action cards.

The car damage areas are divided into Engine, Tires, and Frame. Each area starts with 7 points. Cards are played indicating how the cars hit i.e. front-to-front rear-to-driver-side-tire, front-to-Passenger-side-door, etc. When the Tires or Engine are reduced to zero points your car is disabled and you are out of the game. When the Frame is reduced to zero any further hit there will do a point of damage to the Tires and the Engine.

The toy cars track relative car positions on the playing field since these have an effect on what area of a particular car is available to be hit.

name: On-sets
description: ON-SETS is an exciting and colorful resource allocation game that teaches set theory–the foundation of modern mathematics. Players in ON-SETS explore the concepts of union, intersection, difference of sets, complement of a set, set identity, set inclusion, and the null and universal sets. ON-SETS captures the same creative problem-solving and strategic intrigue as EQUATIONS and WFF ‘N PROOF. The basic game can be taught to players as young as six; as players develop skill, the game becomes more sophisticated and ultimately expands to levels that will challenge intelligent adults.

name: Zzzinity
description:
From the box...
It's a reckless roller-coaster ride through the high-pressure world of big business booms and busts. That's Zzzinity, the game of chance and skill where anyone and everyone can play the financial market like a real entrepreneur. In this tense and exciting game for all ages, Zzzinity stands for the pinnacle of business achievement - and it's within your reach. With a little imagination, lots of intuition, zeal and creativity, you too can climb to the summit of success.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Hexenkompott
description:
Players are witches trying to make their potion. Each witch is associated to a secret color with match a cauldron. In turn each witch rolls a colored die and must put a face down mushroom in the cauldron indicated by the die using a wooden spoon. Other players try to guess whether she is putting a right color mushroom or a wrong one.
Guessing right stops the witch and reduce the number of available mushrooms of the guesser, accusing a innocent witch increases the available mushrooms of the guesser.
The game ends when a witch is left without mushrooms and she gets one extra point for herself and subtracts one point from a chosen cauldron. For each cauldron a right color mushroom scores one point to the secret owner and a wrong one subtracts one point.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Children's Game, Fantasy

name: Stress
description: Another card game by Dal Negro. Put the cards on the board horizontally or vertically and try to score the most points.

name: Big Fat Burger
description:
Big Fat Burger moves you to the fast food bar. You play as cooks whose mission is to make as many burgers as possible. In successive rounds you will be able to fulfill orders placed by customers that get quickly annoyed with waiting. The unforeseen events will be added to your special cards as a tip.

It’s a fast card game in which in the following rounds, players reserve incoming orders, collect the necessary ingredients, prepare burgers and interfere with other players (thanks to special cards). Time to serve customers is limited and when it runs out players will face consequences.

—description from the publisher

name: TKKG: Der Schatz im Teufelsmoor
description:
The TKKG - the gang, which consists of the kids Tim, Karl, Kloesschen and Gabi - are looking for a stolen treasure, hidden in the "Teufelsmoor" by the burglars. While TKKG tries to find the treasure as soon as possible, the burglars try to stop them.

The game consists of a board, divided into several bigger and smaller areas, 8 cardboard figures (4 for each team), 33 cards and 2 dice, one normal, one showing the direction. In the beginning the burglar player chooses one of the fields on the board and writes it down: here the treasure is hidden. The aim of TKKG is to find it until the end of the game. In his/her turn the players can move on the board according to the dice result rolled. If the player lands on a "star"-field, (s)he is entitled to draw a card. The TKKG-player can ask a question, depending on the kind of question on the card, which the Burglar-player has to answer with yes or no. If the Burglar-player draws a card it is just put on the discard pile. Apart from questions regarding the whereabout of the treasure, there are also luck-cards, which allows the player to move a certain amount of steps on the board. If one player figure moves on a field, where an opponent stands, the opponent is taken hostage. If both players have hostages they can make an exchange, if the parties agree.
The game ends when there are no cards left. The TKKG-player then has to choose a field, where he thinks the treasure is. If he is right he wins, otherwise the Burglar-player wins.

The game was later re-released under the name Piratenschatz with a new topic.
categories: Deduction, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Obsidian Lords
description:
Obsidian Lords was one of three new Collectible Token Games (CTGs) released at Gen Con 2001. Vortex by Fantasy Flight Games and Sack Armies by Precedence Publishing being the other two.

Obsidian Lords feels very much like Magic the Gathering with dice rolls. You summon creatures with Obsidian tokens (mana) and send them off to attack your opponent. Your opponent can defend with their creatures and gratuitous dice rolling ensues.

You must make your Strike Roll in order to hit. If you hit, you then roll for damage and apply it towards the enemy creature's Life Points. A pencil and paper is required since creatures have huge life totals, a Centaur Paladin has 53 life points for example. If the defending creatures survives, it can make a counter-attack by rolling even more dice. You continue until all attacking or defending creatures have been removed.

You can also cast Spells and equip your minions with Weapon tokens. Most creatures have cool special abilities which gives you plenty of options for customizing your deck.

name: Least I Could Do: The Card Game
description:
Two to four players portray young men competing for the attention of women. Each player plays cards to increase their Charm, Looks, and Money statistics. (If you happen to be actor Nathan Fillion, all of your statistics get an extra point.) Before awarding the woman in question to a player, a six-sided die is rolled to determine with one statistic is doubled in value for all the players. The players, then, total their statistics and the player with the highest total is awarded the woman. The player who first scores ten points worth of women is the victor.

The game is based on the eponymous web comic.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Gaburu
description:
In Gaburu (ガブル), two players face off, with each starting with a supply of twenty tiles, some numbered and some with symbols.

Each player has a hand of three tiles visible to them, and they take turns placing a tile standing up in the closest empty space of one of the columns on the 8x5 board — with the columns having five spaces in them — then refills their hand to three tiles. When the player's tiles meet in a column, they then lay those tiles face up to reveal them and determine who won that column. The first player to win three adjacent columns or five columns overall wins!

name: Top That!
description: The 72 cards are each divided into three bands of color. Each player in turn tries to play a card that matches and covers two of the colors on the card currently face up on the table. First player to empty their hand wins.

name: Cult Classic
description:
In the humorous card game Cult Classic, players each take on the role of a fledgling cult leader to see who can create the best cult.

At the start of the game you have nothing but your charismatic personality. The game has six cult leader cards, each with his own special power and ideological focus. As the game progresses, you may gain cards representing beliefs that your cult adheres to as well as material assets you've managed to get your mitts on. The beliefs may be in line with your leader or completely unrelated — just watch out for contradictions!

The goal of Cult Classic is to be the first cult to reach ten points, thereby becoming the most powerful cult on the block.

name: Raid
description:
Raid is a strategic, micro deck-building card game with a Norse mythology theme focused on competitive play. Take control of a Norse God and draft/draw warriors to your clan. The goal is to build longboats from your warriors, destroy the other player's longboats, and finally raid the other player by sending your warriors to their village. The player with the least amount of Raid damage at the end of the game wins. To further help you defeat your enemy, you can use your God and Rune powers available to you. Go forth and conquer Midgard!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Verbindung Gesucht
description:
The game is played on a board divided into squares. One player is black, the opponent is red. Each has one starting square on each side of the board.
At each turn, the player rolls three dice with black/red patterns on it: curves or bridges of both colors, or white crossings useful for both players. The player choose two dice to be placed on the board wherever he wants, building paths across the board. (The first player rolls two dice for the first two turns, to balance the starting advantage.) White crosses must be chosen.
The player connecting his four starting squares wins. If in doing so he also connects his opponent's starting squares by mistake, he loses instead.

name: Connect 4 Cut The Rope
description:
From the publisher's page:

The award-winning CUT THE ROPE app is brought to life with CONNECT 4 CUT THE ROPE. OM NOM is a curious little monster who loves to eat candy. But you need to get the pretend treats into his mouth first. Swing the rope to land 4 candy discs in a row. First to four gets to release the goodies and feed OM NOM!

Feed OM NOM with 4 in a row

It’s CONNECT 4 play with CUT The ROPE action! OM NOM is at the bottom of the grid, just waiting for some delicious candies to drop. Can you CUT THE ROPE to get 4 candies in a row? Just place your disc in the rope, pull back and then let go! Try to land your discs to make 4 in a row. If you’re the first player to get 4 in a row, you get to drop the candies to feed OM NOM.

Let your candies fly!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Grow: The Organic Building Game
description:
Grow: The Organic Building Game is a three-dimensional building game in which 2-4 players guide the constant growth of a tree and compete by blossoming flowers around it. The game features a simple-to-learn set of rules, ideal for younger children, while offering a deep level of strategic nuance for more seasoned players. The core mechanisms have been designed to lightly simulate the life of an actual tree, complete with seasons, flowering, and even bugs! Players are given the ability to grow the board, or tree, in any way they choose – resulting in a unique and interesting play experience every time. The game's length is completely adjustable and can be set up to last anywhere between 20-60 minutes.

Each player is represented by a flower color. The goal of the game is to have the most point-worthy flowers of your chosen color before the seasons — represented by stacks of leaves — run out. To do this, you perform one of three simple actions: place a bud which will blossom into a complete flower the next turn, place a leaf to help guide the tree's growth, or use a beetle to attack or protect flowers. Since flowers can connect only to leaves, and leaves can connect together to form chains, points are determined by how many leaves each flower is from the nearest branch. The game also features several unique, seasonal events that can be very beneficial or harmful to the tree's growth including locusts swarm, bee pollination, and wood rot!

Grow: The Organic Building Game was created by Tap Pribbenow, Chris Hassebrook and Kyle Bromley on the idea of blending traditional sculpture with tabletop gaming, while providing a fun way of incorporating plant ecology.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Monster Mash I
description:
Players choose a character and travel on a random board made of individual tiles. They face monsters which re-spawn until monster generators are destroyed. Monster generation and combat are resolved by rolling dice.

Goals vary with the type of game selected. In a cooperative games and solo play, players must get rid of all monsters. In death match, players must kill each other and are only eliminated when killed by another player.

(This is the new name for the Ultra Vilelence Box Set. There are some rule improvements)

Each expansion comes with two unique player characters, monsters and their generators, items, traps and encounters. All components include (8) 6.25" x 6.25" tiles laid out on a 1 inch to 5 foot scale and (150+) die cut pieces; all in full-color.

Integrates with:

Cthulhu Mash for a 5-8 player game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Känguru
description:
35 cards (out of a total of 40) showing grassland or bushland are laid out in a 5x7-grid. Starting on one small side of the grid either one of the 2 players moves his kangaroo through the landscape eating the cards. Therefore he performs one of three actions on his turn: moving the kangaroo one grid, flipping the kangaroo card from a standing kangaroo to a sitting one or vice-versa or eating a card next to the kangaroo space. Grass will be eaten while the kangaroo is sitting and scoring 1 point, bush (2 points) is eaten while the kangaroo is standing. When all cards have been eaten the game ends and the winner is determined by the amount of points he scored.
This card game was handed out to every elementary school participant of the mathematical kangaroo competition 2011.

name: Wipper
description:
From the box:

¿Aquatic animals beginning with D or I? Being faster than the rest of the family, Kevin hits the beep and activates the sound & light referee. Then he have 3 seconds to give his answer: "Dolphin!" He wins! Kevin discards a card and the game continues

It's easy!. Simply find a word beginning with a particular letter on one of the 66 entertaining topics. Only your own quick thinking and coolness will allow you the victory. To increase the variety and interest of the game, we propose two levels: 33 cards with easy and distracting issues to Play with the children and most difficult 33 tokens for the adults.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Chicago Cribbage
description:
About the Game (from the Outset Media Website and the Package)

• Ages 10 and up
• 2-4 Players

An exciting twist to the traditional game of cribbage, where players can demand a recut, stall their opponents, trade hands, and even prevent 'fifteens' from scoring. At the beginning of each game players are dealt seven special cards to be used during that game, adding a new level of strategy and fun. Have you been dealt lousy cards? No worries! Play the right card at the right time and watch your luck change instantly.

Contents

• Illustrated 54 card deck
• 28 special cards
• Instruction booklet

name: Billionaire
description:
Long before Parker Brothers came out with its Billionaire game, a company in Minnesota called Happy Hour, Inc. came up with its own distinctive version of a Billionaire game. In this 1950's Howard Hanson design, the players race to move their marbles over a 3-D board in a dash to a Uranium Strike. Short cuts and pitfalls lie ahead to both aid and hinder the players in their race. Each marble that successfully registers a Uranium Strike is scored and started over on the board; each marble that falls into Dead Man's Gulch is trapped and lost. The game ends when only one player has any marbles left. High score wins.

Happy Hour also offered players "a BILLIONAIRE CERTIFICATE AND BUTTON" in exchange for ten winning score sheets and $0.25.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flakk: kapphlaupið að forna hliðinu!
description:
From the publisher:
Flakk - kapphlaupið að forna hliðinu is an exciting, non-violent Icelandic boardgame with fantasy theme where 2-6 players race to victory. The first player to get to the end wins. The game is for 10 years and older.

To begin each player chooses one of twelve characters, either a boy or a girl. Each character has it's special talent cards which the player uses in the game. Players move around the board using two dice and draw event, treasure or puzzle card according to the space they land on.

name: Stormvault
description:
Stormvault is a cooperative game of exploration and adventure in which mighty Stormcast Eternals heroes search for lost artefacts and battle the fearsome champions of Chaos. Questing throughout the Mortal Realms, you must work together to locate the scattered relics known as Gateway Shards - the only means of unlocking the mysterious Whispering Keep and rescue the arcane treasures stored within. But time is short, and peril lurks in every shadow - you must not fail.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Conquest of Orion
description:
ORION - yours to conquer. Once just a distant constellation, Orion is now being explored and colonized. Will you lead your alliance to victory or suffer defeat at the hands of your enemies?

Conquest of Orion is a team-based card game played over several rounds of conflicts. For each conflict, players play a single card and then evaluate the winner. However, technologies and leaders have special abilities that will influence the outcome of each conflict. Through careful card play and strategy, players will work with their partner to lead their alliance to glory!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Mazescape: Labýrinthos – Demo
description:
This entry is for the playable demo, which features a small extract of the full game.


Mazescape is a fascinating and intriguing game of labyrinths for one player that guarantees intense brain racking moments as you search for the exit. It is a game you can take anywhere and play time and time again to discover all the different nooks and crannies of the seven maps included.

It is a completely unique concept that promises to equally surprise and create headaches in equal measure. In this original game from Devir, you will unfold a map on the table, where you will start at the compass rose with the pointer you will find in the box, moving it along the labyrinth paths marked in white without ever lifting it from the map. You will have to open and close different parts of the map in search of the Impossible Triangle that will allow you to escape the maze. You can go under bridges, climb up ladders and run around in circles in the maze and in your own head until the exit finally leads you to… the next map!

In Mazescape: Labýrinthos you will go through three well defined territories: the docks, the graveyard, and the mountain. The first of the maps will help you to understand the most essential concepts of the game. Then. from there, they will become progressively more complicated until reaching the final challenge. They also have a bunch of secondary objectives that you can explore to get the very most out of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Beutezug
description:
A robbers card game for 2 to 6 players. The title translates to Prowl in English. After a robbery you and the other robbers try and get the most loot from the haul. There are master thieves, pickpockets and thieves cards and 1-8 numbered value cards in a deck of 112 cards.

The game uses matching of cards to raid your opponents loot and has an element of role selection as you can use cards to choose to raid another player or the discard pile. The mechanism involves using your cards matching them and plundering points from other players. For example the master thief card allows you to steal a pile of loot from another player, the pickpocket allows you to get a card from an opponents hand. The game ends when the draw pile is empty.

name: Runestone
description: Themed on Anglo-Saxon runes, players roll dice with the runes and remove their markers from the board.

name: You Said It
description:
An exciting word game that's fun and educational. Perfect for two players or twenty... ages 12 to adult. Each person or team is in competition to bluff the other into believing the real meanings of extraordinary words, that really exist! Who's telling the truth... who's fibbing? It's a humorous race to gain winning points for you or your team while you increase your vocabulary in the bargain.

Learn to judge personalities as the game intensifies. You'll notice your opposition becomes shifty eyed, with an uncontrolled smile or a silly grin... their foot is busy tapping or they look away. They're bluffing and you know it! If you're right, you've won a point, if you're wrong, you've been bamboozled... and you're ready for another round of You said it!
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Consequential
description:
Teams compete to reach the winning square first. On a turn, a team is given a card with five words on it. They roll dice to determine their sequence of letters (e.g. B-J). Then the timer starts.

The team's active clue-giver must use single word clues, in sequence, to get his or her teammates to guess the key words. An example from the box bottom:

Block... Cold... Dry... ICE!
Electric... Fluorescent... Glows... Halogen... LAMP!
Pass I (Yes, you can pass, but be careful)
Jump... Bronco... Cowboy... pass D... Event... RODEO!

That's about it.

name: Route 66
description:
Race from Chicago to Los Angeles along one of the most famous roads in the World; then see as much of America as possible on the way back.

Players have to play a valid State Card before moving on the first leg (the race to LA), and also play a Speed Card to either alter their own or another player's speed. On the return journey, State Cards are collected; players travelling as slowly as possible to see the most sights. The player who arrives back at Chicago with the most State Cards wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Movie Moguls
description:
This game is similar to a bare bones version of Traumfabrik in that you're collecting movie stars to finish movies. It's also very Monopoly like.

It's based on 20 movie productions. Players take turns moving around the board and have the option to buy various productions of older movies like Casablanca, High Noon, or A Streetcar Named Desire. There are title cards to represent ownership, with a list of three actors on them. If someone lands on your production they pay "studio fees." The cost depends on the number of movie stars and awards you've collected for that movie.

There are several ways to acquire stars. The flimsy cards feature nice b&w photos of actors such as Humphrey Bogart, Marilyn Monroe, and 58 others. Once you've completed a production, you are eligible to receive rewards. There are also Production & Publicity cards much like Chance and Community Chest cards in Monoply. Bankruptcies occur if you have to pay more than you have. There are rules for three short-game variants, which are described as lasting about an hour. The regular game is said to take two to three hours.

Reviewed by Rex Reed, for a finishing touch.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Events, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Box Office
description:
From the back of the box:

Box Office is the game you've been playing all your life. Everyone has a favorite movie line, and Box Office has over 2,400 of the best movie quotes of all time! You won't need to know them all to win! Some of the lines have "clues" in them and some are so famous you'll know them right away.

Playing Box Office couldn't be easier. Hear a movie line and just guess the movie title. Watch out though! You may land on Flop squares or Impersonate Hollywood's most famous stars on your way to fame and fortune.

Contents:
1 playing board, 1 die, 50 Flop cards, 40 Impersonation cards, 450 Quote cards, 5 player pieces, 25 Nomination Chips, 1 set of directions and 1 card box

name: Caesar
description:
From the rules summary:

Each turn represents one year in the life of a Roman estate. Until the War deck is exhausted, players are jockeying for position trying to get the most votes. Whoever has the most votes at the end becomes Caesar and wins.

Each player is a senator starting with a modest estate, influence in the senate, and two legions to command.

Players will build their wealth to acquire votes by by shrewdly managing their fields, bidding for public works and the favor of the gods, or on the battlefields against the barbarians.

[GS9204]

name: Bliss o' still
description: Traditional Coin game. Throw three coins with 1 or 2 or 3 on the head-side and a picture on the tail-side. If you go over 12 in total then you score zero points. If you have exactly 12 you get one throw for free. So the maximum you can have is 18. The game lasts 6 rounds, where the number of the round is a multiplicator for the points.

name: Pokerkub
description:
The Multi-Directional Poker Game That's Fun For Everyone.
From the Makers of the Original Rummikub.

In this fast-action poker board game for the entire family, players build the best "poker" hands possible to try to outscore their opponents.
Pokerkub is an exciting combination of Poker, where players build melds (straights, flushes, full houses, and 2, 3, or 4 of a kind), and your favorite crossword board game where strategically placed tiles can score double or triple their value.
Players place their tiles on the board, trying to score as many points as possible. Opponents add to existing melds to increase their chances of winning.
Strategy is keen. You must play offensively as well as defensively. But luck plays its part too. And the winner is undecided until the last play. So, if you're looking for a game of luck and strategy that's packed with excitement, you'll love Pokerkub.

name: Prinzessin Pimpernell
description:
Players are knights trying to save princess Pimpernell from the dragons' cave.

A facedown track of tiles is laid out between the knights' castle and the dragons' lair. Each player controls three knights of different sizes.
The active player rolls has two options:
- roll all three dice (which correspond to the knights) and move the knights in any direction. If a knight lands on an armor tile, the player has to say what armor it is. If correct, the player can keep it, if not, the tile is returned.
- or look at an armor tile.
If a knight lands on a dice tile, the player can re-roll the corresponding die. On plain tiles, nothing happens. When a knight lands on a tile with another player's knight of the same size, that knight is sent back to the castle.

A player who moves a knight into the dragons' lair flips over one of the dragon tiles there. The back side of the dragon tiles shows a piece of armor. If the player has such an armor tile, s/he defeats the dragon and wins the game. If not, the dragon is removed from the game and the knight returns to the castle to go and try again.

name: Director's Cut 2
description: Test your movie knowledge in questions on films from the 1960's to present, this trivia game asks questions in various forms from straight knowledge of films to "first person" who-am-I. If you get the question right you get to roll again. There are some variations listed that punish you for wrong answers by moving back spaces moved forward in that roll and giving other players the chance to steal if incorrectly answered incorrectly.

name: Lust!
description:
From the box:

Lust! is a game for lovers that allows you to explore both romantic and physical intimacies with your partner! You and your partner begin by placing your markers at the start of the gameboard. As you land on various footstep spaces you select cards that have you and your partner acting out or sharing various romantic and sexual indulgences with each other.

While venturing along the path you also earn love-making cards. The love-making cards explicitly illustrate either a foreplay activity or a sexual position. You and your partner use these cards to build and agree on a sexual fantasy. The first person to reach the bed at the end of the path takes the collected love-making cards and initiates the techniques and positions depicted on the cards. Each game ends with a unique love-making experience because there are over 30,000 possibilities within the love-making cards.

Contents:
1 gameboard
60 Foreplay cards
40 Love-Making cards
2 game markers
1 die

name: Whoozit?
description: In Whoozit you try to identify pictures of famous people throughout history then answer 2 of 3 questions about them. This full version of the game includes 50 cards in 6 subjects (Entertainment, Sports, Arts & Literature, Science & Technology, Politics & History, General Subjects)with 9 different individuals pictured on each card. That's 2700 pictures to keep visual-trivia buffs happy for a good while!
categories: Civilization, Educational, Memory, Political, Sports, Trivia

name: Thorns
description:
Thorns is a variant on the game Hex. The gameboard is made up of "Thorns", which are squares with triangles on each side. The squares and triangles are arranged in a grid.

Players alternate turns. Each turn, a player marks one of the squares with their symbol (X or O) and draws a line through the square and into two of the triangles on opposite sides. This creates a "thorn". The players are attempting to create a continuous path of thorns from one side of the board to another. Thorns are considered touching if they touch or if their triangles overlap

The first player to create a continuous path from one side of the board to the other is the winner.

Part of the 3M Paper Games Series.

name: Takeover: The New Zealand Sharemarket Game
description:
Object of the game:
is to increase your wealth by wise buying and selling of shares. Buy shares low and sell when high if possible and build up a well spread portfolio of companies. as time proceeds your financial position should increase substantially and you should find yourself in a position of owning 20% shareholding of a company or companies. Takeover approval cards are required to increase your shareholding over 20%. when a 50% shareholding is obtained then you shall be deemed to have Company Control. the benefits of this are substantial, for example increased Dividends and collection of Penalties. The ultimate object of the game is to be the first player to obtain 100% ownership of a company and thus end the game and collect a $6,000, 000 bonus.

name: Cyclone sur les Caraïbes
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #3.

A simple naval race game from New York to Corpus Christi, with a hurricane thrown in to make things more challenging...

name: Annexion
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Strategie #11. Game of the second French wargame championship (1981)

"Napoleon's last battles" system on an hypothetical struggle for the province of Arkham (sic).

name: Regatta: The Game of Champions
description: Regatta: The Game of Champions was the official boardgame of the America's Cup 2000 yachting event in New Zealand. Countries included are Japan, United States of America, Italy, France, Australia and New Zealand. The game is rather light and reasonably quick, with cards representing events that can change the race, including wind shifts, tactics and incidents. Movement is set depending on what wind speed your yacht is currently experiencing (the dice are used to determine whether wind speed increases or decreases for each yacht each turn). Regatta can be played as a traditional one-on-one race, four player race or a 3-6 player fleet race.

name: The Batman Jigsaw Puzzle Game
description:
The game box contains 4 identical 20 piece jigsaw puzzles, and two special "bat" pieces which do not go into the puzzle. Players start with 5 random pieces, and take turns drawing one piece out of the box. All pieces except the "bat" pieces have text written on the back, which is one of: "Holy jigsaw, use this piece", "Zowie! pick 2 more pieces", "holy Batmobile, pick 1 more piece", "Zap! Lose one piece", or "Riddler strikes lose 2 pieces." If a player draws one of the "bat" pieces he returns it to the box and takes a piece from any other player.

Players may keep duplicate pieces which are useful when directed to lose one or two pieces. When drawing as directed by the text on the back of a piece, text is not read or followed on the pieces drawn, and if a "bat" piece is drawn this way it is returned until a non-bat piece is drawn.

The game is won when a player completes his 20 piece puzzle.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Puzzle

name: Lovers Wild
description:
From the introduction to the rules:

Lovers Wild is a fun spoof of sexual morality today. As a player you have been invited to a wild party along with twelve naughty but nice characters. The object of play is for you to score as many "seductions" as possible.

The board is set up as a modest movie star type estate with various rooms. Bedroom, den, kitchen, etc, with an outside garden, pool, and entrance way. The objective of the game is to move various characters about from room to room, with the intent of gathering as many together in a room as possible. You must have the characters and the room card to score points. So as you move a character towards a room to have a group seduction with other character cards you have in hand, another player may have the same character card, and wishes this character to have a seduction with the players they are gathering in a different part/room of the estate. The more people you can gather in a room together the more points you score. There are optional rules that allow for gay seductions. Like Ticket to ride, the longer the track built the more points, in Lovers Wild the more characters in a room having a seduction, the more points. Multiples of characters must be as equal as possible, if 5 people in a room are having a seduction, 2 or 3 must be women, one woman and four men does not make an seduction or scoring hand. Fast moving game, lay your hand for points if you can, draw a card, move a character. The more players the more difficult larger seductions are. The board in nicely done, and character chits are humorous with a variety of people types, that fits well in with game, with names like Hands a Roaming, Lucy Love Lace, Dolly Pardon. This may be another game lost to the gaming world, where even the author could not put me onto a replacement copy.

name: The Game of Great Composers
description:
From the back of the box:
Players travel the board collecting Works and Travel cards necessary for acquiring Composer and Period Cards. Active interaction between players allow for frequent exchanges. The goal is to acquire Composer Cards and Period Cards for three historical periods. On a second level of play, the winner is the one who can correctly answer questions about the composers collected.

name: Strat-Ops
description:
Spirit Racing and Entertainments were a small UK publisher in the seventies and early eighties based in Croydon, Surrey which transformed into the Spirit Games shops in Burton-on-Trent (they have three shops on one street!).

Strat-Ops is a combination of a roll-and-move monopoly-like outer track where types of actions are determined, and an abstract wargame between two sets of opposing allies played in the centre of the board where the actions are applied.

Players have factories to produce Heavy Bombers, Medium Bombers, Day Fighters, Fuel and Munitions, Tanks and Air Defence - and these are used to attack the enemy's armies, factories and convoys.

You win the game by having all your enemy players in one of the following states:
(a) Capital city is captured
(b) All factories are destroyed
(c) All Fuel and Munitions factories are destroyed and no reserves are left

From the 24-page rulebook:
Strat-ops is an ingenious and exciting game originally devised by a British airman during the Second World War. It is played with 2, 4, or 6 players and is suitable for anyone aged ten upwards. players need luck as well as skill, so the game can be a challenge for the enthusiast or simply an absorbing evening's fun.
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Wargame, World War II

name: Edgar and Ellen The Mischief & Mayhem Game
description:
A game based on the book series Edgar and Ellen.

From the publisher: The tormenting twins are up to their usual dastardly deeds, planning the prank of all pranks! But when their collaboration turns into sinister-sibling rivalary, they go their separate ways and vow to out-prank each other!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Bären-Blues
description:
A "Mini-Spiel" by HABA stored in a metal tin.

From the box: "Very carefully the little red bear climbs on the shoulder of the blue bear. The tower of bears is already four bears high and gets more and more wobbly. A moment of carelessness is sufficient to make the bears lose their balance and tumble down.

A game of skill for 2-4 bear-piling players ages 5-99.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Party Game

name: Exposure
description:
The board consists of five columns of eight colored marbles, the colors being arranged randomly in each game. On each turn a player takes any number of marbles, but marbles may only be removed from the top of a column and all marbles taken on a single turn must be the same color. The object is to amass the most marbles.

In an optional variation (in Take All (Orda Hebrew edition) and Toma Todo (Spanish edition)) there is a single black marble which is worth 5 ordinary marbles.
publishers: Implás, Orda Industries Ltd., Skye Marketing Corporation

name: Små kloka barn på djuphavsfiske
description:
The task in this game is to explore the deep sea and find so many fish as possible.
The "wise" deep-sea fisher will find different types of fish like, sharks, moray eels, octopuses, amongst other small and big fish.
If you answer the questions correct you may fish in water with lots of fish. If you answer wrong you must fish in waters with very little chance to catch any fish.
The person with the most fish in the end is the winner.

name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Wissen, Lachen, Sachen machen
description:
From Adam Spielt:

A set-collection and action game. This fun-filled roll-and-move game with mouse and bear doesn't just demand knowledge, but also activity! Mouse asks all sorts of interesting questions, and Bear asks the players to carry out all sorts of actions. Lots of new things to learn and lots to laugh about! Guaranteed fun for young and old!

Contents: 1 game board, 6 playing figures, 80 cards, 1 die, 2 watch hands.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Superman Returns
description:
With the help of the ultimate, invincible super hero, vie to own it all and relive the most unforgettable moments from SUPERMAN RETURNS with the world’s most famous board game, MONOPOLY. Team up with the Man of Steel to protect the citizens of Earth from the perilous greed of his arch nemesis, LEX LUTHOR. Join SUPERMAN as he returns to Earth and reunites with LOIS LANE to try and halt Lex’s latest evil scheme.

The SUPERMAN RETURNS edition of America’s favorite board game comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens of SUPERMAN, SUPERMAN’s Crest, CLARK KENT’s Glasses, SUPERMAN’s Boot, DAILY PLANET Globe and KRYPTONITE and even includes a 60 minute speed play option for a shorter game with the same amount of fun. So what are you waiting for? It’s time to fight for TRUTH, JUSTICE, AND THE AMERICAN WAY!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Don't Quote Me: TV Guide Edition
description:
By successfully identifying famous (and not so famous) quotations, players move their pawns around a pentagonal board. Players move three spaces by guessing without taking a hint, two spaces with one hint, or one space for picking the right answer from a multiple choice list. The first player around the board wins.

The categories are:

Comedy (Sitcoms, Variety Shows)

Drama (Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Western, Romance)

News/Talk/Sports (World Events, Politicians, Newscasters, Talk Shows, Sports Figures)

Movies (Movies, Movie Tag Lines)

Stay Tuned (Cartoons, Children's Programs, Game Shows, Reality Shows, Commercials)

Home Page: http://dontquoteme.com/
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Squaryd
description: This game is played on a 7×7 grid,with an empty space in the middle. Each player tries to place his checkers-like pieces (single or double) to form a square of any size with single pieces, while preventing his opponent from doing the same (blocking him with double pieces). He does this while avoiding forming a square with his own double pieces. The problem is that players compulsorily must place a double piece before playing any single piece!

name: Vinna eller försvinna
description:
The title means Win or vanish and this is a light take on disarming bombs. Players are trying to find the bombs and disarm them by finding the correct combination of color tiles in less then 45 seconds.

Contents:
Gameboard
Spinner
4 chit-holders
128 chits
Clock
Pawn
Rules

name: Be Quick
description:
Each player gets a number of cards that is played face down in front of them. On card is played face up in the middle of the table. At the same time everyone looks at their cards and tries to find one that has similar a element. Once you find a card with a similar element you toss it into the middle. If everyone agrees with your pick then you card becomes the start card for the next round. The first one to play all their cards wins!

The game is playable for 2-6 players but is recommended for 4 or 5. This is a free to print and play game.

name: Canadian Football Game
description:
With the aid of 3 spinners the team on offense tries to move the football down field for a touchdown.

Spinner A represents passing play attempts, Spinner B running attempts and Spinner C, kicks, field goals or conversion attempts.

NOTE: Unlike American football, Canadian football only allows 3 downs to make 10 yards.

name: An Evening of Murder: Last Call
description:
from the publishers:

It started out as just another friendly night at Nick's Cocktail Lounge. The Piano man was playing softly over the low din of conversation. But, he wasn't the only entertainment… there were also the colorful characters at the bar, providing an intriguing atmosphere. They could have kept you entertained, all night long.

But, who would have known, tonight, the main attraction would be – murder!

Each murder mystery party game comes equipped with:


A complete Party Planner with instructions, costume suggestions and an optional dinner menu
Invitations and name tags for your guests
Character profiles with secret clues and backgrounds
An audio CD which re-enacts the sounds of the murder and outlines the plot
The Author's Solution to the murder

name: A.K.A.
description:
The game plays similarly to games like Balderdash in which players make up a meaning to a phrase and everybody votes on which they think is the real phrase. In this game, however, players are trying to guess the correct description to the scientific name of a plant or animal.

The game contains 968 plants & animals on 242 cards.

name: UNO: National Football League NFL Editions
description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

These two football themed editions of UNO feature pictures of AFC and NFC stars on the cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Champs Card' - When this card is played, the player who plays it selects another player to draw cards. That player must draw until he has drawn a number 4 card or seven cards total. The player playing the 'Champs Card' also selects the new color of play.

name: Face to Face
description:
FACE TO FACE
The Famous Face Guessing Game
Le Jeu Des Portraits-Énigmes
(Description from the back of the box and instruction book)

Tired of playing games with the same old friends... instead, why not invite 560 of the most famous faces in the world into your living room? Famous faces of your favourite Celebrities, Athletes, Politicians, People in the News and more!
Players get to open windows on one of the four View Finders and guess the names of these famous faces as they are revealed bit by bit. The face may be on the top of your head but the name might stay on the tip of your tongue.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
To be the first player to collect eight Face cards (two each of colour; Mauve, Peach, Green and Yellow), and also correctly identify a Final Face card.

PLAYERS
Two or more individuals or teams.

EQUIPMENT
One card box; 560 Face cards (140 of each colour; Mauve, Peach, Green, and Yellow); one die; four View Finders (one of each colour; Mauve, Peach, Green, and Yellow) with locking windows; six playing pieces; and a game board.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 4D Tic-Tac-Toe
description: This game is played on an empty 3x3x3x3 cell board (or one 9x9 square board), divided up into 3x3 areas. On each turn, each player drops a stone on an empty cell. When all cells are occupied, the player with more 3 in-a-rows wins.

name: Official Baseball Card Game
description:
Teams are drafted from a deck of the best players of the day. Hank Aaron, Ernie Banks, Lou Brock, Rod Carew, Roberto Clemente, Tommy Davis, Jim Fregosi, Bill Freehan, Tom Haller, Frank Howard, Reggie Jackson, Harmon Killebrew, Mickey Lolich, Juan Marichal, Willie Mays, Willie McCovey, Sam McDowell, Dennis Menke, Don Mincher, Phil Niekro, Rico Petrocelli, Boog Powell, Frank Robinson, Ron Santo, Tom Seaver, Mel Stottlemyre, and Tony Taylor are some of the players represented. Once the players have their teams each organizes a line up.

Another deck of cards represents the possible outcomes of an at bat. This deck is shuffled and one card for each player in the field is placed face down on the playing surface.

An at bat consists of rolling two six-sided dice and if the result is a two the batter has drawn a walk. Seven means a strike out. Otherwise, check for the number on the back of the batter's card. The number corresponds to a fielding position and check that fielding position of the result. An outfield result is more likely to result in a hit than an infield result. any card used is replaced from the top card of the draw pile and the deck is reshuffled when depleted. All standard rules of baseball apply.

The game is a prized collectible. Milton Bradley also released an Official Baseball board game at about the same time.

name: Hopla Verstoppertje Spelen
description:
Hopla Verstoppertje Spelen is a game for children from as old as 6 months to 4 years. For the youngest it's a game of finding Hopla (the well-known bunny) and for the older kids you can use the cards to give clues as to where Hopla might be hiding.

Hopla calls out 5 times (Hopla! Hopla! Hopla!) and needs to be found within that time. Different variants are in the game's rulebook and will be added to the website later on.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Bert Smets Productions, Identity Games International B.V.

name: Indicios Junior
description:
The game of the 10 clues.

Similar than original Indicios but oriented to children.

The teams must guess the secret word on the card with as few clues as possible.

Wins who ends the 4 tracks corresponding to 4 topics: Geography, Nature, Prominent figures and Miscellaneous.

Was edited in Argentina by Etapa Nueva S.A.

name: Ice Age
description: Did hunters kill off the last of the mastodons, or was it tuberculosis? In this single-stash Icehouse game, one player uses the large pyramids (representing the mastodons) and the other uses the small and medium pyramids (representing the cavemen). The humans surround and kill the mastodons, who must trample the cavemen to survive. Do the mastodons have a chance?

name: Dungeon Crawl
description:
After building the dungeon, players move their characters (pawns) around the dungeon seeking treasure (crown coins). Monstrous denizens (moon coins) and deadly traps (sun coins) pose hazards which may cause damage (value-up coins in players' holdings), but defeating these challenges earns experience useful for later encounters (suit-up coins in players' holdings). Players may also attack each other in an attempt to steal treasure or equipment (arms coins). Once the final treasure has been found, the game ends,and the player with the highest total value in treasure wins.

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Pickett's Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg
description:
Easily the most famous engagement of the Civil War, Pickett's Charge was the high-water mark of the Confederacy. A frontal attack across open ground by 12,000 - 15,000 men against the center of the Union line in the teeth of withering artillery and small arms fire, Pickett's Charge was the defining moment of the battle of Gettysburg and, although militarily futile, represents to many the courage and glory of the Confederate soldier. Pickets Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg is a small-scale, fast-play simulation of historical events of July 3, 1863.

Game Features

* Small Scale Microgame
* Only 26 Unit Counters
* Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
* Brigade-Level Tactical Play
* Five-Page Rules Booklet
* Game Play Sheet
* Counter Sheets
* Quick Play Rules
* Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)

Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Mobius
description: A connection game somewhat similar to Hex, the objective is to connect the three areas in your color on the ends of the board or to connect two areas and loop around the board. The board simulates playing on a Mobius strip, so the lower left corner connects to the upper right hand corner and so forth. The magazine includes a photo-copyable page of boards so the game can be played with colored red and blue pencils or crayons.

name: Alarm für Cobra 11: Das Brettspiel
description:
Get into your car, catch the runaway criminals and be the first to return to the Motorway Police District.

This is the official game of the 1996 German TV serial "Alarm für Cobra 11 - Die Autobahnpolizei" (Alarm for Cobra 11 - The Motorway Police).

Contents of the box:
- 30 Wanted cards
- 19 Joker cards
- 6 reward cards
- 1 cardboard map
- 6 stand up cars
- 1 rulebook
- 3 dice

name: Golf: The Card Game
description:
Golf the Card Game is a fast paced and exciting game that can be played with 2 to 6 players. Each player received 4 cards and uses memory and chance to reach the lowest stroke total for each hole - just like real golf!
If you can't beat 'em at the course, beat 'em at the table.

The object of the game is to trade cards with the draw pile or the discard pile to reach the lowest stroke value for each of the four cards in your hands.Stroke values are added up at the end of the hand to determine the winner of that hole. Hole totals are added up after nine or eighteen holes and the golfer with the lowest score wins.

Game includes: Playing cards, score cards, pencil, instructions

name: Munchkin Sherpa
description:
User SummaryMunchkin Sherpas are Sherpa pen holders with Munchkin-related artwork and special rules for Munchkin games. Currently there are two versions, one with a fantasy Munchkin theme and one with a Munchkin Zombies theme.

They were made in very limited quantities, were listed at high prices ($50 for fantasy and $40 for zombie), and sold out quickly. As a result, Munchkin Sherpas are among the rarest Munchkin promo items.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies

name: Il était une fois... Notre Terre
description:
From the box:

Find again Maestro and the figures from the animated series "Once Upon a Time... Planet Earth" and everything concerning sustainable development. The game includes 2200 questions regarding water, energy, recycling, global warming etc.

A game of co-operation: The players try to save the planet by means of co-operation. The purpose of the game is to get the planet rid of pollution and save the endangered species. The players must fight together the catastrophes created by nature and man.

Family game: There are four levels of difficulty so that children and adults can play together.
categories: Educational, Environmental, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Buck Buck Moose
description:
This is a color matching game for younger children, where players have fun in the forest with moose!

Players take turns dealing cards featuring Buck the Forest Ranger and his pokey pal Moose. Get a "Buck" card and do nothing -- get a colored "Moose" card and race the other players to slap the stack of cards with the matching color. Get there first and you win the card! The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins! Fast-action, color-matching forest fun!

name: Żołnierze wyklęci
description:
Self published 2 person card game, donated with the money from polish Ministry of Culture. On some cards there are inscriptions with educational or biographical informations. The game was sold in randomized starter packs with single cards avalaible for separate sell.

The game is set in historical setting. It tells a story of a dramatic 20 years struggle between anticommunist insurgents and communist government security forces "UB" in forests of central and eastern Poland between 1944-1963.

Players can play cards -fighters, equipment and areas from both sides of a conflict in corresponding zones. One player communist army fight with the others insurgents and vice versa. Combat is resolved via dices and strenght of a fighting pack.

name: Capone says
description:
A challenging free Print and Play game for one player, aged 10 and up, lasting 10-20 minutes

Story:
Year 1930. The Outfil leader, Al Capone, is running Chicago unchallenged. Until a bunch of federal agents, known as the Untouchables, tries to stop him. build up the case collecting pieces of evidence, patrol the streets, raid illegal bars, protect witnesses... Will you read Capone's intentions in time? Are you big enough a man to send him to prison?

Gameplay:

The player starts with 5 pieces of evidence and tries to collect 10 pieces of evidence in a maximum of 10 turns. Each turn the player lets fall randomly cubes on face-down tiles, which are Capone's orders. Then the player tries to counter Capone's choices by placing his 3 characters in one or several locations on the central board.

The game is won if the player gets 10 pieces of evidence. The game is lost if the amount of evidence ever falls to zero, if Eliot Ness gets killed or if the court jury is utterly bribed.

name: Stress
description:
Stress is a speed-based, simultaneous play, standard deck playing card game. The object is to get matched sets of cards face value..

You begin by dealing four cards to the center, and equal stacks of four cards to each player. Therefore, for three players there will be four face-up cards in the center, and each will have three stacks of 4 cards in front of them. Players swap single cards with the center until a stack has 4 of the same face value. They then flip the set over. Once all of their sets are flipped over the player says "Stress" to indicate they've won.

name: Lilli Lotto
description:
Lily Lotto and her friends are happily playing together. But oh dear! It’s verging on pandemonium. Toys, fruits and clothes are piling up in a heap of different colors. Everybody now has
to find all their belongings again. Can you help the four friends?

Whoever collects the four items shown on their picture cards collects a tidbit as a reward. The first player to collect two tidbits wins the game.

name: HyperSwipe
description: From Publisher's website: HyperSwipe will put your reflexes to the test as you race against your opponents to collect the most image matches. Image cards pop out of the HyperSwiper as fast as you can grab them, so you’ll have to think or match fast and move at hyper-speed!

name: Rahan: Jeu de la Préhistoire
description:
Rahan is a French comics series about an intelligent prehistoric man, that appeared first as part of Pif gadget, then published in albums of 2 to 4 complete stories. It was initially written by Roger Lecureux, and after his death in 1999, by his son, Jean-François Lecureux. Most of the artwork is drawn by Andre Cheret, as well as some other artists (Enrique Romero, Zam, DeHuescar)..
In 1986, Rahan was adapted into an animated series.

The Game :
Each player have a Prehistoric cave man wich moves with movement cards.
They must reach "Fire" or "Water" area and bring them back to the cave.
They shoot at wild animals with the "silex".
They try to meet Rahan to recover an invention from him.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Prehistoric

name: Seven Spades
description:
From Wikipedia
Seven Spades is a card game, apparently created by Johan Wästlund in 2002. It's similar to Bullshit in that bluffing plays a key role; however the game is more fast-paced and, arguably, more intense.

While originally intended for two players (which is still the best way to play it), any number of people can play.

The gameplay is simple. A deck of 52 cards is used. The dealer shuffles the deck and places it on the table face down. The player to the left of the dealer is the first to go - he picks up a card from the deck, taking care not to show it to anyone. Now he can either discard it on the table, face up, or declare it a spade and put it in front of him, face down. If the latter happened, any other player can, but is not obliged to, challenge the first player by opening the card. If it's not a spade (i.e. the player attempted bluff), the first player is out of the game; if it is a spade, the second player is out. When only one player is left, he is declared the winner; with two people playing, the winner will always be determined on the first challenge.

The only other way to win is to collect a pre-determined number of spades - seven spades in the two-player version. The last (seventh) spade has to be a real spade, and is put face up, not face down. The person to do this is declared the winner.

Anyone can challenge a person who claims to have a spade, but only immediately after the card is put down. When the next player picks up a card, you are no longer allowed to challenge the previous player. Only the last card a player put down can be challenged, not the other ones.

When more than two people are playing, the number of spades to collect is adjusted so that it's always possible to win without bluffing. With a single 52-card deck, the number of spades to collect is:

for 2 people: 7
for 3 people: 5
for 4 people: 4
for 5 people: 3

To increase the number of spades, or to allow more than five people to play, more than one deck can be used. The number of spades to collect is then multiplied by the number of decks used.

Optionally the following rule can be added when more than two people are playing: if a person challenges another player and proves him a liar, he gets a free turn. This promotes challenging and makes bluffing a bit more expensive.

name: BitQuiz
description:
What color is Pac-Man? What was Nintendo doing back in the year 1800?

BitQuiz is a trivia card game sporting 500 questions on computer and video games where each card holds five questions suitable for anyone, with the Difficulty Mode ranging from Easy all the way up to Nightmare.
categories: Card Game, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Monster Con
description:
The setting is a horror convention. Your goal is to get close enough to nab the guest of honor—Desiré Delamorte, your dream girl—before the convention attendees discover that you're not just in costume. At game's end, one monster's going to get mobbed by con-goers. And one just might get away with the girl.
Each deck contains 56 cards--that's four monster suits and a couple of extra-special cards. Each suit includes the monster itself, ten convention attendee cards, one Desiré Delamort card, and one Flash Armstrong card (her sports star boyfriend).

The idea is to capture as many Desiré Delamort cards as possible, while avoiding attendees of your own suit. You especially want to avoid the Flash Armstrong card; he riles up any suspicious attendees.

Fortunately, each monster has a special ability: Dracula's mesmeric gaze, Mummy's whirlwind, Werewolf's shape change, and Frankenstein's Monster's sheer strength, for example.

Add suits for monsters from the other decks in the series (Return of Monster Con, Son of Monster Con, and Monster Con: Cthulhu Pack), and you can play with as many as sixteen players! Each game also contains a pair of non-suited cards—from "Sleeping in the Movie Room" to "Necronomicon"—to add their own twists to play.

The 4 decks include the original with Dracula, the Mummy, Frankie, and the Werewolf; the Return of Monster Con with the Amorphous Blob, Alien Changeling, Invisible Man, and Swampy; Son of Monster Con with the Bride of Frankenstein, Undertaker, Phantom of the Opera, and Ghost of Room 13, and; the Cthulhu Pack with the Cthulhu Cultist, Innsmuoth Cousin, Pickman's Apprentice, and Nyarlathotep.

With each deck, you can play with three or four people ages 13 and up. Playing time is about 30-45 minutes.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Monopoly: Málaga
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Málaga, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Experior
description:
Experior is a 2-player game with minimalist rules and an emergent complexity.

The game is about a combat in a fantasy world between a Human and an Elf. A character can perform three types of attack (sword, bow or magic attack), and each attack can be strong, causing great damages, or quick, causing damages more often. The damage intensity depends on the experience in that type of attack. A successful attack increases the experience of the fighter in that type of attack.

SETUP
Players choose randomly who is the Human and who is the Elf.

In a common paper is written down the initial experiences for each type of attack and the initial number of wounds of both characters, as shown below. Another option is to print the board in the section files.

ELF
Wounds: 0
Sword: 2
Bow: 3
Magic: 2

HUMAN
Wounds: 0
Sword: 3
Bow: 2
Magic: 2

ATTACK: TYPES AND MODALITIES
There are three types of attack: sword, bow and magic. For each of those there are two modalities: quick and strong.

So, each player has 6 cards for every possible attack: strong sword, quick sword, strong bow, quick bow, strong magic, quick magic.

You can print the custom cards in the images section. Another options is to use 6 cards, for each player, from an UNO game: two red cards with 1 and 3 values for quick sword and strong sword, two green cards with 1 and 3 values for quick bow and strong bow, two blue cards with 1 and 3 values for quick magic.

Winning order: sword beats bow, bow beats magic and magic beats swords.

TURN
Each player places a face down card in the middle of the table. When both cards are placed, they are revealed.

• With a successful quick attack, the opponent takes a number of wounds equal to the value of experience the winner has in that type of attack.
• With a successful strong attack, the opponent takes a number of wounds equal to the value of experience the winner has in that type of attack multiplied by 3.

After the opponent’s damaging, the winner increases his experience in that type of attack by one.

The winning order (sword > bow; bow > magic; magic > swords) determines who has done a successful attack. If both players chooses the same type of attack, the winner is who played a quick attack.

In case both players choose the same type of attack and the same modality, the player with less experience in that type of attack increases by one that type of attack and nobody takes any wounds. In case both players has the same amount of experience neither of them gain experience.
