—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Scrabble Turbo Slam
description:
Players receive a hand of letter cards, and four letter cards are placed on the table. Slap down cards to change the words on the table. Players slam fast when they hear the turbo sound, from the Turbo Slam unit. If they slam first, they get one of four action cards:

Hyper Slam: Give 1 or 2 cards to every other player.
Mega Slam: Discard 2 or 3 cards of your choice in the discard pile beside the action card deck.
Slam Dunk: Give 2, 3, or 4 cards of your choice to any other player of your choice. Hint: Give them to the player with the fewest cards!
You Got Slammed: Take 2, 3, or 4 cards from any other player of your choice. This player chooses which cards to give you.

name: Commando Actions: A Game of Tactical Level Combat in World War II
description:
Commando Actions is a turn based hex and counter small unit level simulation of commando actions or raids during WWII. Hexes are 25 meters, elevation levels 150 feet, turns are 10 minutes and counter are 3-10 men teams or single tanks, guns, ships, buildings, etc.

The game rules are divided into the basic game (book 1 of the rules) and optional/advanced optional rules (book 2). Optional rules:

Night and sunrise turns
Dummy units
Alert status and alarms
Sentry units


Advanced Optional rules include:

Aircraft
Naval shore batteries and support ships
Blind fire and scatter
Evade movement
Run movement
Voluntary suppression/pin
Parachute drops
Passenger vehicles
Anti-aircraft units
Split fire
Opportunity fire
Close assault
Overrun
Recrewing unmanned weapons
Fieldcraft modification
Officer modification
Unit surrender
Smoke
Emplacements
Flail tanks


Commando Actions is very similar (more compatible than similar) in scale and mechanics to Pacific theater game Beachhead: A Game of Island Invasions in the South Pacific 1942-1944.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Snap Dragon
description: What's all the grumbling about. These dragons are really hungry. See how fast you can feed your dragon the most marbles. But wait, the blue ones taste better to dragons than the orange ones. Better grab those first. Grab one marble at a time and snap it back into your dragon's tummy. Hurry, the dragon with the fullest tummy, and the most points, wins.

name: Norge Rundt
description:
This is a Family game with a mix of questions about Norwegian geography, history and culture.
Every Player are to visit 16 random towns/villages, and have to plan their own route and try to be the first to return to their "home town".
You move around by throwing dice, and there are little twists like ferry that you either have to have a ticket for or throw a 1 or 5 on the dice to pass. and you can also get plane-tickets which makes it easier to get from one end to the other quick if you are lucky.
in most games getting a 6 on the dice is good, but here you have to answer a trivia question, and if you manage to answer the question-card tells you how many places you can move.
if you're lucky(?) you can go through the whole game without having to answer an actual trivia question.

it's a good game for the whole family, but I would recommend from ages 10 and up. it's a better game if players are on more equal terms.

name: Catching Fire: Shuffling the Deck
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Will you gain the support of the people of Panem and use your inspiration to help overthrow the Capitol?

In the card game Catching Fire: Shuffling the Deck, players secretly take control of one of the main characters of Catching Fire (the sequel to The Hunger Games) and lead them to gain the support of the people of Panem. Through a series of challenges, you will provide a source of hope and inspiration for the citizens of the Districts and become a symbol for independence. But be wary as the eyes of the Capitol – and President Snow – are always watching!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cthulhu: The Great Old One
description:
Cthulhu: The Great Old One is a Lovecraft-themed quick-play card game for 2 to 10 players.

Each player is dealt cards until all cards in the deck have been dealt. Each player then makes pairs from the cards that player holds, making either Matched Pairs or Linked Pairs. Then each player, in turn, chooses one card at random from another player, in the hope of making more pairs. Players may choose to play one Horror or Cultist card at the end of their turn, after taking a card from another player, to cause an in-game effect.

Once all cards have been paired (other than The Great Old One), then all players add up their total scores based on the pairs they created. Matched Pairs are worth two points, Linked Pairs are worth one point; and having all four cards of a Linked set is worth 4 points, no matter what order you have the two Pairs in. Horror cards are worth one point during the scoring phase. The player who ends the game holding The Great Old One loses the game, all other players compare scores to determine the winner.

The Cultist card is a separate card which may be played instead of a Horror card at the end of a player's turn, and although it subtracts 1 point from the player's final score, if a player who has played the Cultist ends the game holding The Great Old One, they win the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Slap
description:
A quick trivia game.
The Quizmaster reads a question ands everyone else answers in writing at the same time. The first player to give the right answer scores. To determine the right answer the player are writing on some pads, that fold into the middle if released. The bottom pad was released first.

name: The Big Bang Theory: Das geniale Spiel
description:
Leonard, Howard and Raj want a killer robot; Penny, Bernadette and Amy a preserved snowflake; and Sheldon? How about a "device for virtual presence"?

The Big Bang Theory: Das geniale Spiel challenges you to fulfill the wishes of the seven main characters from the television show, and you do this through two-colored cards that allow you to play them on one side or the other. Paradox tiles can change up the rules.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monster-Pups
description:
It helps to remember that the "u" in Monster-Pups is pronounced like "ooooo" as that gives you a clue as to what this game's about. Yes, each player controls a monster that needs to use the toilet to do its business and drop a load, specifically a crystal that is placed underneath the monster.

Will the business happen, though? You place the monster on one of the toilets on the game board, use the stick end of the plunger to turn the wheel, and (maybe) a hole opens in the game board underneath the toilet. Listen for the plop! If you hear it, you can use the plunger to pick up one of your face-down tokens. With luck, you reveal a full roll of toilet paper to clean up after yourself. Whoever first finds three rolls wins!

name: 1500: The New World – Spain Expansion
description:
These Nations give each player control of a specific European nation during the Age of Discovery! Each deck features a custom mix of cards unique to that nation.

Each Expansion pack also contains the cards and rules needed to add add the nation to the game as an AI non-player participant! This means you can play 1500 with your friends or solitaire against 1 or more non-player decks!
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Plný kurník
description: In Plný kurník ("Full Chicken Coop"), players collect eggs, feed chickens and hens, and try to protect them from bird flu and a sly fox. The breeder who is the first to place nine adult hens on the perches of his coop wins! The game is intended for 2-4 players and can be easily handled by more skilled children from 5 years old.

name: Say Cheese!
description: If you’ve ever been inside a photo booth, you know what it’s like to act wild and crazy under the pressure of time. We’ve tried to capture a little bit of that frenetic feeling in this super fast dice game. As you quickly roll dice and look for matches, you’ll not only sharpen your reflexes, but you will also strengthen fine motor skills and visual acuity. Race to the photo finish in this dice game that plays out in a flash! Quickly roll your dice to match the characters on the photo booth cards. When you match a pair, shout "Cheese!" and collect the card. Win all the cards and you're picture perfect!

name: Pegity
description: An oldie. Pegity is a game where players insert wooden pegs into a punch board. The object is to get five pegs of your color in a row. There are also little pieces of paper inside with designs on them, such as a house, doll boat, etc... which younger children could make with the game's contents instead of actually playing the game. Not a particularly rare or great game, but probably an early 20th century borrower from the game of Go-Moku, much earlier than say Othello for example.
publishers: (Unknown), Bell, Borras Plana S.A., Chad Valley Co Ltd., John Waddington Ltd., Merit, Parker Brothers

name: In The Dark
description: "Connect Four" with a twist: the balls are kept hidden from both players, so they must try to remember which colored balls are where. When a player thinks they have four in a row, they pull the lever that drops the balls into sight. If they are right, they score a point. If they are wrong, their opponent scores a point. The first player to eight points wins.

name: Hot Cocot'
description:
Cluck... Cluck... Quick! There are six hard boiled eggs to eat but only 5 cups on the table! Anything goes - well almost. The aim is to get your egg into the cup using chop sticks. No easy task. Who will be quick with their hands and not left holding the last egg and which of you will be the most skillful?

With the aid of two sticks try to quickly position your eggs in one egg cup. At each turn a player is eliminated because it lacks a egg cup at the center of the table.
Be quick at the end, there will be more than one!

Contents
5 Wooden Egg Cups
6 Wooden Eggs
12 Wooden Sticks
Game Rules

name: Planet Defiant: Onslaught of Vanas
description:
General Overview

Planet Defiant: Onslaught of Vanas is a cooperative sci-fi horror board game set in the far future where rare humans are capable of extraordinary feats due to technology and genetic manipulations. Earth is severely overpopulated and is searching for habitable planets to live on. With time being a factor several military groups are sent to far reaching ends of the galaxy to search for these planets. One such group comes upon a promising planet only to end up crash landing on the planet. After emerging from the wreckage they find the first alien race humanity has ever encountered but these creatures were not what they were hoping for and now they are in for the fight of their lives just to escape the planet... can they survive?

Game Mechanics & Features

Planet Defiant: Onslaught of Vanas will feature multiple factions fighting for survival against an aggressive alien species. Aliens will spawn every turn with more coming the longer you are playing. You will be fighting epic battles against multiple creatures and insanely powerful bosses to find the resources needed to escape the planet. Only with the help of your teammates can you hope to make it off the planet alive.

The Bullet points

Onslaught of Vanas supports 1-8 players that scales difficulty on the number of players

46 total miniatures

D10 (ten sided dice) for all combat and skill checks.

Over 500+ cards including every alien, character, weapon, and item in the game, all with amazing artwork

Large Game Board with 30 unique locations to visit.

A day and night system that completely change what you encounter and how you play.

Cooperative game play including cooperative fights, trading, leveling, and synergy system.

Customizable weapons and skill system to play your character how you want to.

Fun initiative system that changes how the battles play out.

Bosses who need teamwork and strategy to defeat.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: The Really Nasty Bankers Game
description:
The Really Nasty Bankers Game brings out all the best family values of double-crossing, scheming, bluffing and greed! Just sit there like a picture of innocence kn owing you've gambled too much of the bank's money and hope that nobody has the nerve to challenge you.

Fourth in the Really Nasty games series, after Horse Racing, Golf and Motor Racing. Inspired by the financial crash of recent years. Straightforward rules and doesn't require any previous knowledge of banking.

The Monopoly-style board game casts players as the chief executives of fictitious banks with names like FullerCrookes and the RippOrf Banking Group. The aim is to invest the bank's cash as recklessly as possible without getting caught, and take home the biggest bonus. And, as a tribute to the financial crash of 2008 where Lloyds TSB and RBS were bailed out by taxpayers, players also have recourse to a 'public bailout' card. If a market collapses while they are heavily invested in it, the player is allowed to keep all their money.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Iron League
description:
Year 2100, world industry has focused on war machines called IRONS and countries compete to have the best Irons teams. Laboratories
look for the best weapons and clubs look for the best pilots.
Countries fight in the famous and hardest league in the world:IRON LEAGUE.
And there are hundreds of teams that fight in each country to compete in the Iron League.
You are an Iron team coach and you have been hired to take the team to victory and win the Iron League title.
Management and sponsors place their trust in you; we know you are the best and you will take the team to victory.
The decisions related to the selection of your team and of your cards, together with the luck of the dice and of the events cards
will be decisive to be able to win or lose. Score more times with the plasma ball than the opposing team;
you can also damage all the rival Irons or hit them with the plasma ball to win points.

The game contains: 3 boards, 6 complete Irons with 2 “silent” rotating machine-guns, 2 Zim guns, 2 shields, 2 beams and 2 light machine-guns (The arms, legs and weapons can be joined together by hand), 1 goal square, 62 cards (24 events cards and 38 action cards), 2 action dices, 1 plasma ball counter, 2 scoreboard counters, 8 damage counters, 6 Iron sheets, 1 summary sheet with scoreboard and 6 pilot identifiers.

Main features:
-Giant robots which measure more than 9 cm, with a lot of details and made of a very resistant ABS plastic.
-Interchangeable legs, arms and weapons. The robots get the weapons from the battle field.
-Random event cards. They can be good, bad or nothing may occur.
-Action cards, which help and provide you with improvements during the game.
-Only one goal place. You can quickly change from attack to defense, be careful!
-Players: 2-6

Action dice:
The action dice are used to carry out actions such as shooting,launching the plasma ball at a target, stealing the ball, etc…
2 action dice are always thrown. There are 5 icons on the dice:
2 pilots: When you throw a dice and you get this drawing, it means 2 points.
1 pilot: When you throw a dice and you get this drawing, it means 1 point.
1 pilot: When you throw a dice and you get this drawing, it means 1 point.
Faulty engine: When you throw a dice and you get this drawing, it means -1 point.
Example of throw: The result is: 2 pilots+1 pilot= +2 +1 =3 points.
Plasma ball: Only used to steal plasma ball.

You need 1 Iron sheet for each Iron of your team. The damagepoints of your Iron are indicated on it and it is associated with a pilot card.
All the weapons that come with the game must be placed on the main board.
Game sequence
1- Pick up 1 Events card
2- Pick up 1 Action card.
3- Movement phase, shoot and plasma ball.
4- Damage
5- Scoreboard.
During your turn each Iron robot has 2 actions.
You can choose these actions:
Move 1 or 2 squares= 1 action
Shoot one time= 1 action
Attack close up= 1 action (Attack with beam, charge/push or slap)
Get up=1 action
Push=1 action
Pass the ball=1 action
Receive the ball=1 action
Trying to hit an enemy with the plasma ball=1 action
Trying to steal the plasma ball=1 action
Examples:
Example 1: Move 1 or 2 squares and try to pass the ball to a companion.

You cannot throw the ball at the goal square. When an Iron robot from your team gets the plasma ball into the goal area, you get 8 points, when you destroy 1 enemy Iron robot, you get 1 point,when you hit it with the plasma ball, you get 2 points.
Use the counters with the “Iron League” logo and use them on the scoreboard to remember the points won.
The turn following a Goal begins with the team that has received the Goal starting the next phase, and the team that scored. All the Irons are automatically repaired and changed places.Each team at one end.

Take your Iron robots to victory!
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rolling Thunder
description:
A solitaire pencil and paper game which simulates an American Rolling Thunder Bombing Mission during the Vietnam War, circa 1966.

The player's force consists of 16 F-105 bombers (Thuds), 8 F-105 Wild Weasels, 10 F-4 Phantom fighters, and 2 EB-66 jamming aircraft. The attack force must locate and attack targets. When a target is located, the player decides how many bombers will attack it. Each bomber can only make one bombing run per game. The force will also encounter hostile SAM (surface to air missile) sites and MiG-21 fighters.

Victory is determined by Objective Points. Points are gained for every target bombed, SAM site destroyed, and enemy MiG fighter shot down. Points are lost for each American plane lost.

The game is played with a six-sided die (or two), a pencil, and the game sheet. The game lasts twenty-five turns.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tactilo Loto
description:
A game for children Ages 3+ and up in which players spin a well with six different textures embedded in it. Players then search for the similar texture on an animal card in an opaque bag.

If you find the right kind of animal you keep the card, otherwise you return it.

The game ends when the bag is empty. The player with the most cards wins!

From the box cover:

A TACTILE DISCOVERY GAME.
Find a cuddly bear, a frizzy sheep or even a rough lizard by touch... that is the challenge launched by the tactilo loto arrow!

name: Dinodeck
description: A Top Trumps style comparison card game about dinosaurs. The acting player chooses which category to compare (height, weight or speed), the players choose cards from their hands and the highest value wins all the cards. Replacement cards are drawn and when the deck runs out, the player with the most cards won wins the game.

name: Capa d'Oro
description:
The players are cigaremakers. They trade and cultivate tobacco over the entire world en try to make the best cigars possible.
During the game you are forced to discover new melanges and fragrance combinations with the different brands of tobacco. By doing so, you will make better cigars that are worth more money and victory points.
First to obtain 60 points wins.

name: Kite Fight
description:
Kite Fight includes three games in one box, with players using the kite, wind and lightning cards in different ways depending on what they're playing. The games included are:

• Catch the Wind — Imagine playing in a park with the land divided into quadrants by wind cards. Over the course of the game, players place kite cards in different parts of the park (that is, the space between wind cards) to try to have the highest valued kite cards on top of the stack, but the first card played in a quadrant determines which cards can be played to that area subsequently. Designer Jason Kotarski describes this game as "sort of a twist on trick-taking with players playing to multiple tricks at once over multiple rounds".

• Ride the Skies — Wind cards fill the air (or rather the table as they're laid out in a grid), and players place their kite cards on top of them to ride the wind. The trick, though is that the card being placed must be equal to the sum of the card being played on and one of the adjacent cards in the grid. Once all of the wind cards are covered, players check each pile to see who played the most cards on each pile, awarding the wind card to that player.

• Full of Air — Catch the most wind cards by participating in kite fights and outnumbering everyone else. To set up, a few wind cards are placed face up on the table, then players take turns placing a kite card at either end of the row, creating a sequence of 1-10 in each row. When a row is complete, whoever contributes the most claims the wind card from that row. Lightning cards let you zap another player's card and replace it with one of your own.

name: Crazy Therapy!!
description:
Crazy Therapy!! is a competitive card game in which two teams exchange in turns the roles of "patients" and "therapists".

Each team draws a card of the deck (48 cards total), which represents a "pathology" (a pattern behavior they have to perform in their "patients" turn)
There´s plenty of funny pathology types, like identity disorders where you have to "be" another specific player, behavior disorders, TICs, and much more madness!!

In the "therapist" turn, you have to ask the patients with questions whose answer should be YES or NO. When all the therapists have asked a question, they can try to make a diagnosis in the end of the turn in an attempt to win. There´s also two special clues in each card: "lamp" and "dartboard". The therapists can request the "lamp" clue at the beginning of their turn, but this has a penalty: they lose the entire turn and they are forced from this moment to reveal their own "dartboard" clue if they fail a diagnosis.

There´s also a special event called "Therapy" when a patient shouts "THERAPY!! and all the patients should switch seats randomly between themselves (note that lots of pathologies take into account some sort of "possitioning" pattern, so i.e.: if you have to act and answer like the person at your right, this changes your answers after a Therapy! because there´s another person at your right!), this event can happens when:

-The patient don´t know the answer of a question.
-The pathology says to do it or when it´s impossible to follow it´s indications.
-A patient fails to following the pattern or indication of the pathology (in which case, if you detect a teammate patient "fails", you should shout Therapy!!)

The goal is to discover the opponents pathology (the "pattern") before they discovers yours!

A fast and funny game that can join in the same table every profile of board game player!!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Crazy Therapy!! es un juego de cartas competitivo en el que dos equipos intercambian los roles de "pacientes" y "terapeutas".

Cada equipo roba una carta del mazo (hay 48 en total), que representa una "patología" (un patrón de comportamiento que tendrán que interpretar en su turno como "pacientes")
Hay muchos tipos de patologías divertidas, como trastornos de identidad donde tendréis que "suplantar" a otro jugador específico, trastornos de comportamiento, tics, ¡¡y muchas mas demencias!!

En el turno de "terapeutas", tendréis que preguntar a los pacientes con preguntas cuya respuesta deba ser SI o NO. Cuando todos los terapeutas han preguntado, pueden intentar hacer un diagnóstico al final del turno para intentar ganar. Hay también dos pistas especiales en cada carta: "bombilla" y "diana". Los terapeutas pueden solicitar la pista "bombilla" al inicio de su turno, pero esto tiene un precio: perderán automáticamente el turno y además, a partir de ese momento estarán obligados a revelar su propia pista "diana" al equipo rival si fallan un diagnóstico.

Hay también un caso especial llamado "Terapia" donde un paciente grita ¡¡TERAPIA!! y todos los pacientes deben intercambiarse aleatoriamente los asientos entre ellos mismos (ten en cuenta que muchas patologías juegan con algún factor de posicionamiento en su patrón, así que por ejemplo: si tienes que actuar y responder como la persona de tu derecha, ¡esto cambia tus respuestas tras una Terapia! ya que ahora habrá otra persona a tu derecha!), este evento ocurre cuando:

-El paciente desconoce la respuesta a una pregunta.
-Lo indica la patología o es imposible cumplir su directriz.
-El paciente falla al interpretar el patrón o la indicación de la patología (en cuyo caso, si detectas un compañero paciente "fallar" deberás gritar ¡Terapia!

¡El objetivo del juego es descifrar la patología rival (el patrón/funcionamiento) antes de que ellos descubran la vuestra!

¡¡Un juego rápido y divertido que unirá en la misma mesa a todos los perfiles de jugadores de mesa!!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Star Trek The Next Generation: The Board Game
description:
Component Game Systems game about Star Trek The Next Generation featuring the Federation, Klingons, Ferengi, and Romulans. The defunct Component Game Systems were apparently related to Companion Games.

The basic idea is that each player need only buy his part of the game, representing in this case a race from the Star Trek universe. Players could buy Starter Kits comprising components relating to one Star Trek Race. This "boardgame" version contains no board, but does contain Starter Kits for the four player sides mentioned above.

Victory can be achieved by either military, economic, or mission-based means. The largest tile map, for 6 players, is formed from 56 7-hex tiles.

The game is compatible with "Star Trek Deep Space Nine The Board Game", which features the DS9 Federation, the Maquis, Cardassians and the Dominion.

Part of the Component Game System.
categories: Economic, Exploration, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Flick Maze
description:
In Flick Maze, the first fully 3D-printed flicking board game, 1-4 players will flick their discs as quickly and skillfully as possible to score goals through a maze, which can be different each time you play. You can play Flick Maze with 25 different custom tracks or design your own tracks. The game includes five modes of play.

Can you outflick your opponents? Can you be the quickest flicker in the universe?

name: Shift Tac Toe
description: Two players play Tic-Tac-Toe on a "Connect Four" type board (meaning placing a disk sends it to the bottom first). On their turn, a player can drop a disc in, or slide a row one space to the left or right. Since the board is a 3x3, slides can sometimes send pieces out of the unit and back into regular play. The first to achieve 3-in-a-row is the winner.

name: Monkey Math
description:
In Monkey Math, a child hangs a specific amount of bananas in one hand of the monkey, after which another amount which places the monkeys arms in balance has to be placed in the other hand.

This game was made only for educational purpose.

Monkey Math (2005) originally is based on 1+1=2 which was released in 1978. The later incorporates a cardboard balance and has game rules for 2-4 players.
publishers: Jumbo, Learning Mates, Monarch Publishers, MonkeyBean Toys

name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Side Effects
description:
All expansion cards available for the Machine of Death game, shipped in a separate box the same size as the main game box.

This includes 300 extra game cards, 100 Intel cards, and 230 Webcomics Pals cards.

(Does NOT include the extra blank card deck.)

Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination is a storytelling game set in a world in which a machine can predict how a person will die with 100% accuracy with only a small blood sample. However, the machine delights in being vague and twisted. A card reading "Old Age" could mean you die in your sleep at age 120, or it could mean you're run over tomorrow by an elderly driver who forgot to take his pills today. Players of the game take the role of assassins, who must use the various tools at their disposal -- from storytelling to a slew of items available from specialty Black Market shops -- to create a situation in which a target is killed in a way in line with their Death Prediction. The Machine of Death Game uses this basic idea, of assassins working in a world were cause of death is known to create various game modes.

The General Gameplay of most modes works like this:

• A target is assigned, and given certain details (including Death Prediction, and possibly extra details like a favourite food or crippling phobia).
• Players – assassins – are given Black Market Gift Cards. This is their inventory, what they have to use in order to accomplish their goal: killing the target.
• Players use the Gift Cards to devise a plan.
• The plan is greenlit, either by a Chief player, or via consensus, depending on game mode.
• The timer starts and the plan is put into action. This is represented by dice rolling to beat a "difficulty score." An unlikely plan hinging on a single item may need to roll a 6 for that item, but a rock-solid intricate plan may need to only roll a 2 for all Black Market Gift Cards used.
• The plan is revised, in case of failure of one or more dice rolls. The details of this portion vary greatly from mode to mode, but involve either replacing Black Market Items, creating a new viable plan with the existing items, or calling in "Specialists"
• The target is either killed or escapes. Again, depending on mode, this is either the end of the round or the game.

Game Modes:


Head-to-Head Mode that's very similar to Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples. There's a judge ("the Chief"), who decides whose assassination plan is the best, and gives them a chance to try it out. Designed for 4+ playes.
Co-op Mode, where you players are a team of assassins, and have to come up with a plan together to kill targets that the group comes up with.
Co-op can be diced further: you can play individual rounds, or Mission Mode, where targets are predetermined and have different levels of difficulty. There's also the more strategic Chief Mode, where there's no timer, but the Chief can rate your plan's likelihood of success and let you take risks on whether it'll work or not.
Cutthroat Mode, where players can actually assassinate each other (should you want a more competitive version)
The Day Off Mode, which isn't about murder at all but rather draws upon your bevy of assassin skills to accomplish tasks like "opening a stuck jam jar" and "transplanting a tulip bulb."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Links
description: In Links we will have fun finding the word that unites two or more characteristic cards and we can do it in 7 different ways. Depending on the number of players, of time available and why not, of our mood, we could choose different challenges and different ways of create "links" by exclaiming the right word at the right time!

name: Fleets
description:
Players start out with a few ships in one of 9 "quadrants". On each turn, you gain ships based on the number of star bases you've conquered plus a bonus ship for each quadrant you completely control. Only one ship is allowed per space and each ship can move up to 3 spaces in any direction. You can then attack single enemy ships with 1 to 3 ships of your own at a time. The defender rolls one die and the attacker rolls as many dice as ships used in the attack. Whoever rolls the single highest die removes one enemy ship involved in the fight. Ties result in no losses. The game continues until one player controls a set number of quadrants, i.e. 3 quadrants in a 4-player game.
The designer released a the very-similar Stargate SG-1, based on the sci-fi TV show. That version adds ground troops and action cards but uses the same board.

Re-implemented by:

Stargate SG-1

name: Cromlet
description:
From the Press Release:

Cromlet is a card game for 2-6 players ages 8 and up. Timing is everything: cards are played and Cromlets are claimed, but players can try to foil each others moves, and six wild cards in the deck keep everybody guessing in this strategy-heavy card game that takes 30-45 minutes to play.

name: Super Duo
description:
You'll never win alone.

In Super Duo, a group of wannabe superheroes have come together to deal with the city's most pressing problems. Only two of you can be true heroes. Meet your collective doom, or rise to Fame and Glory.

Super Duo is a short and simple card game. Collect, complete and collaborate in an epic quest. Strategic choices, a little luck, and a watchful eye on your friends are the key to winning.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Vendors
description:
Take on the role of the IT director of a large enterprise - a telecom, bank, or energy company. Compete in the technology race, acquiring the most innovative software from leading providers in order to efficiently serve your customers and gain new ones. your number of customers will determine your position in the market and your eventual victory. But watch out for technical problems. Perhaps you will need the help of an agile vendor?

Introduction:
In the game Vendors players assume the roles of IT directors in large enterprises and strive to effectively develop their IT systems to attract and serve the greatest number of customers. To acquire new customers directors must choose from among - not always compatible - offers from various vendors and eal with the ensuing technical prolems. Whoever's company has the largest number of customers - both business and individual - at the end of the game wins.

Goal:
The goal of the game is to gain the most pairs of Customers (individual and business). At the end of the game, each pair of individual and business Customers gives 1 victory point. The winner is the player with the most points.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Space Chase
description:
Race to amass 1500 days in space, get one rocket to the "splashdown" or "target" site, and have no rockets remaining in play on the board.

Players each start with an astronaut on the board's outer track, and roll a single die. The astronaut is used to collect the six components needed to build a rocket, as well as other "game effect" cards.

Once a player has all six cards, he may then roll two dice: a red die to move his rocket on the inner board, and the white die to gather the components for more rockets. A player may have up to two rockets in space at any one time.

Players score days in space by passing over the green spaces marking planets and other interesting features within the solar system. Some cards and spaces also allow a player to score.

Some cards and board spaces may be used to move your own rocket to your advantage, or another player's rocket to their disadvantage. The board contains three dead-end spaces pathways ("burn-out", Uranus, and the Sun) that penalize a player as well as destroying his rocket.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Утиные истории: Улётное приключение
description:
The team of ducks goes on a new adventure. Uncle Scrooge dreams of finding treasures, but it's not that simple! The nephews have their own understanding of fun, and Launchpad and Donald cause an emergency just by being on board!  If they don't find common, ehm... air, this flight might be their last one.

In this wild game, you will take turns piloting the plane. While doing that, you will need some guidance from your crew members, but everyone will be trying to pursue their own secret goals.  Enjoy the view from the window and don't be afraid to crash into the rocks: no matter how the flight goes, you will have a memorable adventure! 

An ingenious adventure game with hidden roles
A great fit for children and adults alike

—description from the publisher (translated)

Утиные истории: Улётное приключение

Команда уток отправляется в новое приключение. Дядя Скрудж мечтает отыскать сокровища, но не всё так просто! Племянники по-своему понимают веселье, а Зигзаг с Дональдом на борту — уже чрезвычайная ситуация. Если герои не найдут общий язык, полёт окажется для них последним.
В этой бесшабашной игре вы будете по очереди рулить самолётом. Вам нужно не только работать сообща, но и стремиться раньше всех достигнуть своей тайной цели. Наслаждайтесь видом из иллюминатора и не бойтесь врезаться в скалы: как бы ни сложился полёт, вас ждёт запоминающееся приключение!

Оригинальная приключенческая игра с тайными ролями.
Можно играть как с детьми, так и взрослой компанией.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Travel
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Communication Limits, Hidden Roles, Player Judge, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Crazy Clock Game
description: The game comes with a pack of cards illustrating, step-by-step, how to build the Rube Goldberg contraption. That deck is dealt out randomly to the players. The player with card 1 plays it, assembling the parts indicated on the card. He continues playing cards in sequence if he can. When he no longer can, he grabs a random card from the player to his left (unless it is that player's last card) --which may allow him to continue. If not, the player who has the next card plays it, and so on. The last card gives that player a chance to crank the clock and wake the sleeper (and win!). If that fails, play passes to his right.

name: SuDoku Hex!
description:
SuDoku Hex! is a print-and-play game offered by Reiner Knizia.

This is a game with a board consisting of seven sets of size seven hexes on which tiles numbered 1-7 are randomly place on each set. Then players take turns placing numbered tiles onto the board with the restriction that no repeating digits are allowed in any direction, like a sudoku puzzle. Scoring is similar to Ingenious.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: HysteriCoach Hockey
description: HysteriCoach Hockey is an edition of HysteriCoach for the Canadian and American market. It has a new graphic design. Some rules are changed from the original version, fitting better Hockey rules.

name: The Twits Card Game
description:
Based on characters created by Roald Dahl, this game is billed as... The sneakiest, nastiest, dirtiest game in the world!

It is a simple card game, played over several rounds, in which players manage the cards in their hands in order to score as many points as possible each round.

Some of the cards have positive values and some of the cards have negative values. There are also special cards marked 'upside down' that change the polarity of the cards in a players hand.

On his or her turn a player takes the top card from the draw deck, banks one set of cards if possible, and then passes one card to the left. 'Upside down' cards may not be passed to another player.

A set of three identical cards may be 'banked' during a players turn. When one player has banked three sets of cards the round ends and the players score their hands.

All banked cards, whether plus or minus, score plus the face value of the set. For example three +10 cards score 10 points and three -6 cards score 6 points. Three 'upside down' cards may be banked for a score of 0.

All the cards in each players' hand are then added together to determine how many points are scored. An 'Upside down' card in the players hand causes all + cards to become - and all - cards to become +. If the player has more than one upside down card they cancel each other out.

Once the hands have been scored another round begins.

The first player to reach 100 points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Novel-based

name: Cyborg: The Ultimate Adventure
description:
"Cyborg - The Ultimate Adventure" is a two-player wargame with both SF and Fantasy elements ("After the atomic wars, magic filled the land..."). One player controls Princess Gloriana and her entourage, who are trying to get from the North East corner of the map to the Holy City in the South West, where Gloriana's coronation will take place. Gloriana is escorted by cyborgs, Amazons, and Imperial Guardsmen, and is watched over from afar by the magic-using Guardians in the Holy City. The other player controls Aemulatio, the sister of the dead king, who is trying to capture and sacrifice Gloriana in order to seize the throne herself. Aemulatio fields mutants, gargoyles, and a pair of Necromancers (amusingly named Kcud and Nootrac) against Gloriana's forces.

Playing time is listed as "2 - 3 hour(s)" on the cover, but the rules declare there is no time limit. For Gloriana to win, she must reach the Holy City or totally rout Aemulatio's minions; for Aemulatio to win, her forces need only capture Gloriana (even if Aemulatio and her Necromancers are all dead, which would be a very Pyrrhic victory).

A six-sided die (not included) is required to resolve combat, and also to allow the Necromancers to cast one spell with random effects once per turn, and the Guardians to cast one spell each of "Mind and Magic" per turn.

The lurid cover art by R. P. "Dick" Winther, seems intent on evoking both Silver Age comics and 1940s pulp magazine covers, but falls far short of Excalibre's self-proclaimed "Beautiful graphics and detail." A gargoyle is seizing a terrified Gloriana by the thigh, and appears to be wrestling her atop a rock... but closer inspection of the lower left corner of the cover reveals a second, smaller gargoyle in flight, and the space between it and Gloriana is filled with ant-sized fighting men. Presumably the main figures are meant to be aloft, though you'd never know it to look at them, making this cover one of the best examples of the classically "bad" game art of the 1970s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Squiggle
description:
SQUIGGLE™, a fun game for kids, teens and adults, will stretch your imagination to its limits. Players have a limited time to create a picture or object from a random line: a squiggle. There could be hundreds of pictures or objects created from a simple squiggle; it all depends on which way you look at it.

The SQUIGGLE Score Book provides a point value for over 870 pictures and objects that you may create. It also measures players' and teams' creativity level.

name: What Do You Meme?: Spongebob Squarepants
description:
What do you meme expansion featuring spongebob and friends.

Compete with your friends and family to create the funniest Spongebob memes. Do this by using one of your dealt caption cards to caption the photo card in each round.

Can be used with both What Do You Meme? core game and/or What Do You Meme? Family Edition.

Contains
30 caption cards
50 photo cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Torpedo Game
description:
Summary from the box ...

"It's a fast paced battle at sea. It's an action packed game for the whole family."

Instructions (from box lid) ...

"To Set Up
Each player places six of the steel balls in the loading slot of his torpedo gun. Each player sets up three ships in the notches at his end of the game board.

To Play
The object is to knock over the opponent's ships with the torpedoes (the steel balls). First, turn the torpedo tubes to the direction of the enemy ship, by using the target finder through which you can sight the ship. Then, fire the torpedoes by pressing the trigger. Players may rotate turns or fire simultaneously. Each player totals his score for the ships he has sunk. 100 is a perfect score."

name: Quirky!
description:
Quirky is an abstract strategy board game of luck (of the draw), placement (strategy), stacking and points accumulation on a triangular wooden board.

Based on the number '3' and designed for three players by Games Above Board, the (Canadian) publisher states Quirky may also be played by two players.

Each player has a colour (which may change during the game) and, taking turns, draws different-shaped pieces at random from a bag - placing them on the board regardless of the owner yet being careful not to help the opponent(s) nor hinder their own strategy.

Should the colours change, players retain their points scored and continue playing against what was previously their own color pieces and strategy.

Pieces may be placed 3-high and top pieces may be removed.

Placement or exposure of 3 same-colour pieces in a triangle scores 3 points.

The object is to be the first to score 45 points.

name: Super Nova
description:
From the Rules Introduction:

Super Nova is a game of intergalactic expansion and conquest. Players start from their home worlds, discover new planets, and compete for control of other planets. Power is wielded militarily, diplomatically, and economically, with an occasional natural disaster thrown in. To win, you must create the empire that supports the most population.

Super Nova was originally published in a collectible format, but is now published as a 165-card complete game.

Expanded by:

Super Nova: Event Horizon
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Economic, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tension
description: This old Gabriel production features a spinner that only shows one color at a time. When it stops, players rush to place their disks into wells on the board which match the spinner's color. The first player to get rid of all his disks is the winner.
publishers: Gabriel, Kohner Bros., Peter Pan Playthings

name: Trivitria Up
description:
Trivitria Up combines trivia and tactics in a unique way. Players try to earn and get their own building pieces to the uprising tower while avoiding making the tower collapse.
Players can get their building pieces to the tower by succeeding with the trivia questions, with a skillful roll of a dice or if other players don't get their answers right. All the players build the same tower and exciting tactics comes to play when players try to make tower building hard for others.
Goal in the game is to get as many own building pieces to the uprising tower as possible. Winner is the player who had most building pieces in the tower at the time of tower collapse. Loser is... well, do we have to say it..

name: Are You Chicken? (腰抜けやろう!!)
description:
Publisher's summary
腰抜けやろう!! (Koshinuke Yarou!!),
Are You Chicken!! is a game of chicken with simple rules.
(The publisher is the designer of the game).

Each Player takes 1 card from the DRAW pile and lines it up in front of themselves
to form the Chicken Road.

Compare the TOTAL COUNT of the numbers on the cards with other players.

The player who gets most number of cards lined up with the TOTAL COUNT stated
on the cards within [5] wins the round and scores points.

Play multiple rounds.
The first player to get to 20 points wins the overall game.
publishers: GALLERY OUCHI (ギャラリーおうち)

name: UNO: Doctor Who
description:
Another themed variation on the classic card game.

Features 15 character cards representing heroes, villains and iconic imagery from the Dr Who series. Play along with The Doctor, Cybermen, Daleks, the Tardis and more. Includes 112 cards for 2-10 players. With fully molded and decorated Dalek collectors card case.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Exterminate" card - when played, the player holding the lowest number of cards immediately has to draw 4 cards from the deck.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: 3 Monkeys
description: 3 Monkeys is a party game in which player must make static mime of various emotions - fear, hunger, ambition, greed, despair... - with their face. Every round, a player must mime three emotions - one with hand over ears, one with hand over eyes, and the last one with hands over mouth. It's not always that easy...

name: Numberplace City
description:
Sudoku and board games are combined in Numberplace City.

You are the president of a construction company that undertook the construction of an undersea city. We will build the buildings at the same time as our rivals, but we cannot build the same building in the same column, the same row, and the same block.

After you have built the minimum number of buildings, you can use various effects. Some of the effects include taking the start player marker, spinning the board, or winning the game.

Well, who is the best architect?

name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: 3D spel
description:
Shredder has a terror plan to destroy the city's entire sewer system. He has filled all water reservoirs with deadly laser balls. His henchmen stand ready at the gates to let the laser balls roll deep into the sewer system and destroy the entire foundation of the city.

The mutant heroes must defeat Shredder at the Technodrome to save the city.

Contents:

1 threedimensional Board
4 Turtle Figures
1 Shredder Figure
6 Sewer Covers
6 Enemies
10 Laserballs
1 sixsided Die
1 foursided Die
1 Rulebook
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Alga, Paradigm Games Ltd, Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele

name: Topix
description: Topix is the quick-fire game of naming chosen topics against the clock. Good fun for those who don't mind recalling words against the clock - not everyone's taste, but quick to play.

name: Mages
description:
"Bang!" meets "Settlers" in an epic tournament of magic! A card, dice, and token game - fun for casual or serious gamers.

Mages is a card and dice game for recommended 2-5 players. The game length varies depending on the amount of active players, but an average game lasts 30-60 minutes. We recommend the minimum playing age to be 12 years old. The set up of the game is fairly simple and only takes a few minutes to do.

The point of the game:

Be the last Mage alive or be the first Mage to reach the status of Master Mage (level 3 in all 4 magic skill areas).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Kaminett
description:
Kaminett is a hybrid backgammon/chinese checkers game. Each player has a set of 6 different size 3D pieces which are each 1x1xN (with N varying from 1 to 6). These all start upright on home squares. The object is to move them across the board.

Each turn, the player rolls a die and moves the corresponding piece. A piece moves by flipping it 90 degrees in a chosen direction. On the first move, this means laying the upright piece down so that it occupies N squares on the board.

The big catch is that you can only move to unoccupied squares.

name: Office Politics
description:
In Office Politics, players attempt to establish themselves as the dominant force in a company, which is represented as a pyramidal hierarchy of departments.

Players weave their webs of influence through the company, starting from the bottom and spreading through the connections among departments. To establish control over a department, a player must spend kudos (the game's currency) and he or she must outspend other players with similar interests. Each player also has a deck of cards that can help them to establish control, or to hinder others from doing so. Each controlled department gains the player income; higher level departments yield more kudos.

Once a player controls twelve departments, he or she is declared the winner and the game ends.

name: Flying Circus
description:
Use manouver cards from your hand trying to achieve a better total than your opponents. The winner takes one of the 12 aeroplane cards that are setup on the table and add to your score. When all the aeroplanes of the same color are collected you can try to get Red Baron himshelf!
Winner is the one with the most points.

A light filler game!

name: Schatztaucher
description: Players make progressively deeper dives into the ocean waters (eight levels on the game board), gathering gold coins and stockpiling the necessary spears/harpoons that eventually allow one player to fight off the sharks and giant octopi at the ocean floor and bring a treasure chest back to the surface to win the game.

name: Rennfieber
description:
Rennfieber is a horse-racing game where players auction for, train, bet on and race horses.

In the first phase of the game players auction for horses, trying to gain those with the best potential form statistic (form). Form influences starting placement and the movement of each horse. This statistic starts low but can be influenced by winning and losing races or through training. The pursuant training phase also allows the opportunity to collect cards that can influence form, aid in races and win money.

Before a race, players select which of their horses they wish to enter. Bets are placed on horses based on their form, starting position and taking into account any cards a player has to influence the race. During the race, players roll a die and compare the result to the horse's form to determine the movement value. Horses can move in and out of lanes based on the positions of other horses and any special cards that are used.

At the end of the race, bets are resolved and a predetermined purse is paid to the top 3 horses. Play proceeds with a second race followed by a third stage of auctioning, training and racing. At the completion of the third race, the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pentagon Games
description:
A book containing three games:


Pentagon

Pentagon is not a simulation in the formal sense of the word. The events in the game are intended to be illustrative and the decisions fictitious, woven from the progress of play. But by giving the players incentives both to compete and to cooperate, the game does simulate bureaucratic politics. And the content of bureaucratic politics is similar in tone and substance to real debates over military budgets. Pentagon shows how political factors influence the shape of budgets before the bureaucracy even gets down to decisions on weapons procurement and their merits.


The R&D Game: Congressional Chutes and Ladders

The R&D Game is designed as a solitaire game. It is based on a decision-tree mechanism that leads the player through a set of alternative developments. This type of approach is sometimes called a "scripted role" model because the main emphasis is on broad decision choices rather than narrow selection of tactics. Given the broad choice, the decision tree itself generates much of the action, unlike a two-player or multi-player game in which action flows from the decisions of each of the players.


The Last Days of Saigon

An introductory level wargame. The goal of each player is to destroy the other player's forces, so the game does not follow the historical values. The map is pretty basic, moderately large scale, 3-color with just basic terrain. Units are mostly Brigade-level units with a few regimental and batallion units thrown in. There is a mostly abstract representation of air, and naval units. [Note: This game was also published as 'Last Days At Saigon' in 'Bridge' magazine, Volume 4 #1 (11/75) bound-in, with b&w components, as part of a 'Vietnam in Retrospect' issue.]
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Odysseus
description:
One player takes on the role of Odysseus, trying to get safely to Ithaka. The other plays Poseidon, attempting to prevent same. Odysseus moves according to the spinner with distance determined by color results on dice. Various spaces generate event cards. Poseidon moves via cloud and if he can catch a ship there is an attack on that ship.

Rated for Ages 10 and up.

name: Mini Archimedes
description:
This travel-sized version of the four-player Archimedes Professional is played on a 7x6 board. The object is to capture the opponent's King by surrounding him with colored pegs. The Kings are the black and white pegs and start on the Throne squares at either end of the board. The other 30 pegs are multi-colored.

On your move, you first move your King defensively, by sliding to an adjacent free space. Next, you place a colored peg offensively, hoping to box the opponent King in.

An optional rule allows a captured King to displace a colored peg if it happens to lie on a straight line away from him along with another same-color peg (at any distance). Further, Kings aren't allowed to come adjacent to each other.
publishers: Arxon, Invicta Games, Jensen, Spółdzielnia Rzemieślnicza Piaseczno

name: Horse Sense
description: Be the first player to collect ten horses of one breed and you win. You can collect Thoroughbreds, Arabians, Clydesdales, Tennessee Walkers, and Quarter Horses. You can buy horses from the band when it is your turn, and can make trades with other players. Players also will have different horse-related careers throughout the game, allowing you to collect horses and receive income.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Egomania
description:
From the back of the box:

"Be an Egomaniac! Let unbridled self-interest be your guide. Unleash those long repressed diabolical yearnings to triumph over others as you maneuver for power, control, and total victory."

"The object of the game is for you to become the Supreme Ego by amassing the required amount of Powers and Properties. Owning Powers gives you potential control over other Egos' freedom of movement, security, access to information, and the amount of their money. Owning Properties gives you the potential to control and block other Egos' board movement strategies. The inevitable conflicts that arise are resolved by direct negotiations between players, resulting in bargains that are as devilishly clever as human invention permits."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Voyage of the Dawn Treader
description: The object of the game is to be the first to reach the "end of the world" by accumulating five Dawn Treader ship discs. You get those by reaching the islands (without being sent to an island by the spinner) or by landing on one of the Aslan squares along the board's circuit. Shortcuts may accelerate your voyage, other circles can send you back and the islands may trap you for a while.

name: Partyzone: The Inheritance
description:
You are about to enter a world of romance and intrigue, of high society and scandal. Many surprises lie ahead...and the party you are about to throw will be remembered and talked about for months to come!

Each Partyzone Game is a complete mystery party in a box. It is a party game for you and your guests. It provides a theme for your party. It is an icebreaker to help get your party started. You don't sit down and play; instead, you and your guests move around and socialize with each other. Just what you would want at any good party!

In The Inheritance Scenario, your guests are given roles as members of the Caldwell family, who have gathered at the family mansion for the reading of the will of the patriarch, the late Jonathan Jerome Caldwell. During this evening of mystery and exposé, your guests will determine who among them is entitled to compete for the inheritance… Each guest has a mysterious past and some secrets to protect, and each has one or more missions that involve the other guests at the party. Many of these missions conflict with one another.

This Partyzone game of intrigue and deception for adults includes instructions and party planning booklet, 12 invitations and envelopes, 20 identification badges, decorations, and much more

name: James Bond 007: Goldfinger
description:
Goldfinger is hiding in Fort Knox (the center of a 9X9 grid) guarded by 8 henchmen (blue). 16 agents (red), under the guidance of Mr. Bond, have been sent to apprehend him.

Movement of pieces is easy... move any one of your men any distance along a straight line. If you can trap an opponent's piece between two of yours, it is captured and removed from the board. Goldfinger requires all four adjacent points occupied before he is captured.

The object for the red player is to capture Goldfinger; for blue to win, Goldfinger must escape.

If either player has a winning move on his next turn he MUST tell his opponent. According to the rules: "Winning should occur by strategy, rather than by oversight."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Raid on the Bunker
description:
This solitaire game was published in Warhawks magazine #1.

The Zetans have placed a bomb on the Time Platform... your squad of mercenaries must avoid or eliminate 14 Zetan guards in the research facility, without causing any casualties to the scientists, and get to the 'Time Platform' in seven game turns to win... easier said than done.

name: Armored Trooper Votoms: Plotters City Woodo
description:
Complexity level 4 on Takara's 1-5 scale (1=easiest)

Based off the science fiction mecha anime Armored Trooper Votoms, but quite different in look and feel than Tsukuda's line of Votoms wargames.

Still uses hexes and counters, but also includes 24 miniature metal mecha for the main robots in the game. It includes 6 maps, and 6 small fold-up buildings. It also includes 2 periscopes (one for each player) for helping to determine line of sight. Basically its a rectangular tube with an angled mirror that you point towards the robot on the bottom end, and you look into the other end that also has an angled mirror that points at you. Using this, you can see from the robots point of view (sorry, it's tough to explain).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball
description:
A fantasy sports game, fairly close in rules to baseball. There are many minor rules differences, and characters can be injured as well. You have a team of characters that each have their own statistics. You play cards based on what you pitch you expect the other team to throw, or attempt to throw a type of pitch the other team isn't expecting.

There is an expansion that adds items and spells to the game.

Expanded by:

Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit

name: Monster Maker School Festival
description:
Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 2nd in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this game, there are various events at the school festival worth points to the player who plays the highest rating (1-10); if there is a tie, the highest non-tied ranking wins the event (so the winner when scores of 9,9,5,and 4 are played is the player who played the 5). Some events are unpopular and worth negative points that you don't want to win.

name: You Just Became a Millionaire
description: A player draws a card that poses a question, and each player predicts how others will answer. Players wager an amount on their prediction and then the question is answered, presumably honestly. The flavor hook to this game is that all players are immensely wealthy, and all the questions are about what they are going to do now that they are loaded.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Hasbro, The Marketing Resources Group, Inc.

name: Blaster Bots
description:
From the publisher's website:

Bored by their trek across the endless vacuum of space, a shipload of killer robots decide to have some fun. Coding themselves to utilize their most deadly weapons, all but one are destroyed in a matter of seconds. Can you survive the Phazo-Oscillating Beam Master or avoid the deadly rays of the Ionified Reflecto-Blaster and Residulating Impulsor?

Blaster Bots is a quick card game for 3-6 players. Firing Mechanisms, Weapon Effects and Target cards combine to make new, unexpected and sometimes downright mind-boggling weapons. Half the fun is saying the names of the weapons you'll create. The other half is figuring out what they do when they go off. As usual, everything you need to play comes crammed in one small box.

name: Tri-nim
description:
The gameboard is an equilateral triangle consisting of thirty-six smaller equilateral triangles. Each triangle has a point value from zero to six. The closer to any corner of the large triangle; the higher the value of the smaller triangle.

The first player arranges counters in piles on any of the zero point triangles. Players alternate turns moving stacks of counters with the object being to move the counters off the corners of the large triangle.

name: Quebec Libre
description: Quebec Libre is a game simulation of the politics and economy of the Canadian Confederation at a time in which a major section of the population of the country is questioning the continued validity of the Confederation concept. The period covered by the game is that of the mandate of the separatist Parti Quebecois government in Quebec.

name: Shootout Pro Soccer
description:
Shootout Pro Soccer allows the table-top gamer the opportunity to coach their favorite North American Soccer League(NASL) stars in soccer action. All 24 NASL teams are represented with player ratings based on 1979 statistics. Players are rated on their shooting and ball control ability, as well as the likelihood that they would register an assist. Goalkeepers are each individually rated as well. Each team is also rated for its overall defensive ability.

Coaches (gamers) set lineups, and make basic strategic and tactical decisions. The game plays very quickly making it perfect for replays of entire seasons. While the game can be quite enjoyable played against an opponent, it is perfect for solitaire play.

name: Messages
description:
From the box:

Three games for those who love playing with words and ideas. The symbol tokens are used to form picture phrases and sentences, known as rebuses. Many opportunities for players to express their cleverness, creativity & sense of humor.

The Fill "Er Up Game
Pool your ideas to make Rebuses to fill the board entirely. Red spots add challenges & make each game played a different experience.

The Clear the Deck Game
This time you fill the board at random with 64 symbols, and try to discover rebuses among them, so as to clear the board.

The Crossword Rebus Game
Create a board of interconnecting rebuses with few or no black spaces left uncovered by game’s end. Very hard.

name: Combat! Rangers
description: Combat!Rangers recreates the battle of the 2nd Ranger battalion in the hedgerows of Pointe du Hoc on a tactical level. It contains version 4.0 of the Combat! system rules, which can be used with the earlier games in the series, Combat! Normandy and Combat! Stalingrad. Contains over 450 die-cut counters, 19" x 21" map sheet, six scenarios and a complete Combat! Normandy upgrade kit.

name: Villgust Card Game
description:
Japanese card game based off the anime/manga "Villgust".

The object of the game is to get the most experience points from killing monsters and collecting items before a particular card is drawn a second time. ('Lushys', apologies for the likely mis-romanization)

There are a wide variety of characters, armor, weapons, enemies and events among the 120 cards in the game.

Each player starts with a party of characters and a hand of cards. Every round, each character draws a card face up. If it is an 'open' event, it occurs. After that, one of the following actions can be performed: Equip item, Exchange item, replace hand(redraw), Battle, Fix item, Heal/Rest.

name: Finder's Keepers
description: Twenty-four cups are placed on the gameboard. At the beginning of the game, each cup covers a coin valued at 0, 5, 10 or 25. In turn, the players will spin the spinner to determine which shape cup may be lifted. If the player finds a coin, the player keeps the coin and replaces it with one’s own marker. A player is penalized for uncovering a marker. The game is over when a player has discard one’s own last marker. The player with the greatest total in coins is the winner.
publishers: Arrow Games Ltd, Editrice Giochi, Milton Bradley

name: Double Dilemma
description: In Double Dilemma, players take turns drawing a scenario card and reading out the dilemma. A dice roll determines if the rest of the players are required to guess the decision the player will make, or if they will choose from one of the 3 multiple choice decisions listed on the card. Points are awarded for every correct prediction of the reader's decision. If a player is confident of their choice, they can choose to use the "trump" card--and receive either a bonus or a penalty, accordingly. The winner of the game is the first to reach 15 points.

name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York – Action Contraption Game
description: Game is set up in the Mouse Trap fashion. Try to make it to the finish square and avoid being knocked over by one of the traps. Traps include the paint bucket, fire escape, toolbox, toilet, and ladder.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Handicap
description:
The double colored wooden pegs are placed at random in rows in the spaces between the fingers of the hand sculpture, and the hoop is placed over the thumb. Players positions themselves around the hand so that they each can see only one side of the hand and thus only one end and one color of the wooden pegs.

Each player tries to take as many matching pegs (both colors must match) as possible from out of the hand. Here, of course, is where the Handicap comes in. Only the player skilled enough to extract the pairs of pegs of his choice, without letting the others fall out, is likely to win. If the player is successful he can put these pegs aside for the moment.

These pegs are ideally kept until the end of the game, but may be lost during the game if the player is challenged to a Hoop-la Duel. The player can also increase his own collection of pegs by challenging opponents with the same color combination as his own to a duel. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, The Really Useful Games Co., Theta

name: LEGO EXPLORE: My First Builder
description:
Player turn over one brick card on each turn and try to match the card with a brick they need to complete a Lego animal project. The first player to complete their animal wins.

Awards

2003 Årets Børnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory

name: The Babysitters Club Game
description: Share secrets and stories in this game, just like Kristy, Stacy, and all the Babysitters Club members do in the best-selling books. Make your friends giggle and sometimes groan as you answer questions about babysitting, boys, and best friends. There's trivia from the books plus silly stunts to do too.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Geosafari Game of the States
description:
Did you know that London Bridge is in Arizona? Discover this and other fascinating facts about each state as you travel across the USA. Draw a destination card to start your trip. Roll the die, then correctly answer a question about a state's people, places or things. Move your car ahead towards your destination, state by state, the number shown on the die.

DESCRIPTION - from the game
The object of GeoSafari Game of the States game is to be the first player to
visit the four states that match your four State Destination cards. To get
from state to state, answer Question cards correctly. (Don's Game Closet)
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Area Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Children's Hour
description:
Children’s Hour consists of three games:
Peanut the Elephant – Be the first player to reach Peanut’s home to win and also have 25 points. The player with the greatest number of points at the end of 3 games is Peanut’s best friend.
Porky the Pig – Score the greatest number of points by matching the cards in pairs.
ABC Fishing – Place the cards in the slots and then one by one, and in regular turn, fish out the cards with the little fish hook. Keep the cards if they have a scoring value indicated by a star, and discard them is they do not have any scoring value. Each star counts one point. The player with the greatest number of points at the end of the game, wins.

name: Mr. Peter Piper
description:
Try these out on your tongue. Choose one and say it out loud as many times as you can in 15 seconds. Go ahead. No one's listening.
Three Tree Twigs
Crow Cock, Caw Crow
Especially Suspicious Spaghetti
Not Bad! Now, add one of these three fun-filled verbal gymnastic events in which you and your fellow players compete:
Monologue - you and your tongue twister alone
Duet - choose a victim with whom to compete
Challenge - sabotage another player with the most difficult tongue twister in your hand.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: Strike it Rich
description: Each player is a modern prospector buying mines and hoping to strike valuable ores, like silver or gold. On his turn, a player rolls three dice and then skillfully arranges them. Two dice form the Mine Number, which indicates where a strike occurs if the mine is already owned, or indicates the mine the player can buy if it is not owned. When a strike occurs, the third die indicates the type of ore found and, thus, the value of the strike. It pays to own several mines that lie adjacent to one another on the board as adjacent mines help to increase the value of a strike. (A strike can be worth as little as $5,000 or as much as $150,000!) The Object of the game is to be the first player to make a million dollars.

name: Warring Fleets: The Game of Ancient Naval Combat Both Real and Imagined
description:
From the designer: "Although set in the fantasy world of Talomir, Warring Fleets works equally well with historical fleets. Whether commanding Carthagians or Kurinthians, players command opposing fleets in lively fast play combat. Suitable for solo-play, Warring Fleets can used to supplement both Warrior Kings and Warrior Heroes as well as any other rule set of the same period. Over twenty navies are available from the ponderous slaver ships of Merchen to the fast raiders of Kurinthia. Warring Fleets is a real departure from what you may be used to. The action is fast and furious with victory going to the player who can exploit situations as they arise. Do you have what it takes to command…"

Ancient/Medieval/Fantasy Naval wargame for ships. Can be played solo or with lots of players.
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: The Underground Railroad
description: An educational game in which players race to "make the perilous journey north from slavery to freedom on The Underground Railroad" avoiding dangers along the way.

name: Nuttsy Tennis
description: Nuttsy Tennis is a action packed tennis game for two players. The tennis court is downsized to 16" by 32". The tennis ball is attached to a long wire that lets it swing freely over the net, and the miniature tennis rackets are attached to handles with buttons that make them swing.

name: Sphinx
description:
From the box:
SPHINX: 2 or 3 players. Contents: 12 yellow, 12 orange, and 12 red pyramids. The object of the game is to get five pyramids of your own color in a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal row by placing one pyramid at a time. Simple Rules.

From the rules: The object of the game is to get five pyramids in a row, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, the first player to do so wins. Pick a color, the person starting first places a pyramid on the board. With the exception of this first pyramid all others have to be placed next to each other side by side - not corner to corner. When all the pyramids are used up, you can move any one of your own color again, as long as it has two adjoining sides free. Looks simple, doesn't it? But there's a lot more to it than meets the eye. Give it a try - good luck!

name: Na, Typisch!
description: Judge the other players and see if you are right. 35 cards with different phrases like: women are always late. You have to say what you think about it. If the other players think the same way you get points.

name: Bis bald im Wald
description: The bright Bambi feels at home in the big green forest. But it wants other animals for friends. The other forest animals keep hidden behind the numerous trees and bushes. Once they show themselves the bright little Bambi has to remember exactly where they were. And because the wise owl and the sly fox are involved as well, Bambi has to be very clever till it is able to date his new friends in the forest.

name: Triple Flips 6: Sports
description:
Triple Flips 6 includes Championship Boxing, Motorcycle Jumping, and Olympic Biathlon.


Championship Boxing is a 2-player game in which the players attempt to maneuver about the ring and punch one another when in range. There are KO spaces along the players' punch tracks by which a player can hope for an early knockout of her opponent.



Motorcycle Jumping is a 1-player game in which you try to jump as many buses as possible, based on your trajectory and height. Most of your jump is determined by rolls of the die.



Olympic Biathlon allows 2-4 players to cross-country ski and shoot their way to victory. When you get to the shooting range determines the length of the path you take back to the main course once you've shot the target.

name: Noah's Ark
description: Each player has a selection of animals they are trying to get into the Ark. On each turn, spin the spinner. There are spaces with two different animals that allow you to place one of those animals in the ark if you have one. If you spin the blank space, you put nothing in the ark. The first player to get all of their animals in the ark wins!

name: Capn Crunch Island Adventure Game
description:
This game was available by sending money and UPC symbols. It's a professionally packaged game complete with miniature Capn Crunch, Sogmaster and two glow in the dark soggies.

From the box
OBJECT OF THE GAME Be the first member of the Capn's crew to find the SOGMASTER, overcome his soggy tricks,and recover the CAP'N's treasure!

You're essentially using cards and dice to go up a typical Candyland-esque board. You do get to choose the card you advance with out of a hand of three.

name: Rummel Bummel
description:
