The London Murder Mystery game has unique gameplay in that the evidence necessary to solve the crime is buried in 'dossiers'. Each player receives a dossier. A police inspector's report is also included with variable evidence. This is probably the game's most notable mechanic - unlike most of this genre and vintage, this game has strong replayability.

Certainly dated, a flexible vinyl phonograph record sets the scene. Once the evidence has been presented, players make an accusation, based on establishing motive and opportunity. A red plastic 'magnifying glass' is used to check the answer based on the evidence.

name: Flusi
description: Flusi is a simple action game based on a "sock monster" character popularized in childrens' books. The game box doubles as a sock drawer for the game. Players load up sock monsters onto a simple catapult and fling them trying to hit the sock drawer. For each monster than makes it into the drawer, socks are taken. Whoever gets the most socks in a round gets a clothespin. Get two clothespins and win the game! Simple and fun, and kids often do better than the adults.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Novel-based

name: Out of Time: Pirate Revenge
description: From back of box: "Sail the seas evading history's most feared rogues--like Blackbeard and "Calico" Jack Rackham. Engage in fierce battles, bury treasure, and cause mutiny on your opponents' ships. Outwit your enemies to collect the most booty and claim victory. Experience life as a real pirate..."
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: World War II Game
description: This is part of the Learningames History Series. In it, you learn about World War II and the battles that were fought. There are three levels of play included in the rules; Basic Game, Identify the Location of the Event, and Identify the Event Based on the Location. The winner of the game is the player with the most cards.

name: Happy Traveler
description: Players draw a card and list as many answers as possible in 60 seconds, receiving one point for every answer. Categories are similar to those on Family Feud, such as, "Things you eat raw." Cards offer three levels of difficulty.

name: Word Making and Taking
description:
"The Popular Spelling Game"

This game uses cardboard letter tiles that have the upper case letter on one side and the lower case letter on the other. The game includes rules for using these tiles in 21 different word games, including spelling games, anagram games, scrabble-like games, and hangman-like games.
publishers: (Unknown), Chad Valley Co Ltd., De La Rue, H. P. Gibson & Sons, J. Jaques & Son, Roberts Brothers Games, Spear's Games

name: Schloss Silbenstein
description: "Syllable King Castle" is a children's game (Ages 5 - 8) in which players must speak one-word answers to simple questions in order to get past doors on the game board. In addition to knowing the right answer, players must also indicate the syllables in the answer word by knocking on a door with a wooden stick. The first player to reach the top of the castle wins.

name: Shrek 3-D Memory Match-Up
description:
From the Instructions:

"Test your memory with Shrek and all his twisted fairytale friends! Just turn over the cups to find half a fairytale character, then see if you can find the other half!"
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Firing Solution
description:
Prepare For Battle!

Beams of coherent light slice through the ships hull as her captain barks out orders to his crew. We're not out of this yet, all stop, bring us about and ready all forward batteries to fire on my mark... Fire!

Firing Solution is a table top fleet level tactical space combat and campaign game where player field fleets of ships, sending them into battle against their enemies.

Highlights:

Space combat your way... In two or three dimensions on hex grids or measured using any flat playing surface, all without complicated rules or math.
Easily field fleets of ships in battle using any of the 30+ included ships or quickly design your own using the included construction rules.
Damage types and defenses use a rock / paper / scissors approach with each damage type having an appropriate defense. Empires may specialize in particular technologies but no single vessel can excel at everything.
Tactical Data Link squadrons, Escorts, other special equipment and ship orders add considerable depth to fleet tactics.
Command an empire in its struggle for galactic dominance with the included campaign system based on colony control and infrastructure.
The combination of ship elevation and roll status with directional defenses, individual weapon firing arcs and dorsal, ventral or spinal mounting options bring 3D battlefields to life without vectors or other complex math.
Enhance weapons by adding various weapon effects such as barrage, slow arming or spinal mount to alter their capabilities.
Unique damage system scales the severity of each weapon attack allowing larger vessels to dispatch small ships more easily while smaller vessels need to wear down larger targets with repeated strikes.
Use one of the four included Empires or create your own using a simple system allowing the creation of empires tailored to your favorite setting.
And Much More.


Format:
68 Page PDF with Separate Front/Back Cover PDF
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=583
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Mr. Frog
description: Mr. Frog is a children's game where player put leaves on a fungus with a frog on it. As more leaves are put on the fungus it becomes shaky and finally falls over, dropping the frog. The winner is the player who first loses all his/her leaves without dropping the frog.

name: VeggieTales Seek & Match Board Game
description: Help Jimmy Gourd find his cheeseburger, Bob the Tomato retrieve his hat, Larry the Cucumber fetch his duck, or Junior Asparagus search for his ball. Remember where the 4 items for each character are on the game board. The first player to collect all 4 of their character's items and return to the center of the board, WINS!
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious

name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: Jacht op Shredder
description:
You are one of the four hero (not ninja) turtles. 12 cards are placed on the table in a 4*4 square without the corners. Each turtle starts in a different corner. You throw the dice and may move your turtle on the cards in any direction.
When you land on a card, you turn it over. If the card shows a pizza, you get a pizza-card. When you land on an opponent (Bebop, Rock Steady, Krang, Shredder), you'll have to fight him. You throw the dice, you may add pizza-points, and when you have more than indicated on the card, you win the card.
The first to conquer the four bad guys, wins the game.

name: Ex*Pion
description:
In this abstract strategy game you win by either bringing a special neutral unit called the Ex*Pion in your base by pushing it step by step with your own units, or by capturing all of your opponents' unit. You capture your opponents' units by enclosing them with your own units. The Ex*Pion being a neutral unit, it can be used to capture units, but cannot be captured.

Winner of the 1990 As d'Or on the game festival of Cannes.

name: Cranium Grab & Go Mancala Mania
description:
From the publisher:

The game of Mancala with fun Cranium twists! Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel. Fun for kids -- and adults! Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones.
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mancala Mania! A favorite of young and old alike, mancala is an ancient game loved worldwide for its unique combination of simplicity and strategy.

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like reconfiguring the board to create an entirely new game!

Contents:
6-Piece Mancala Board
48 Tokens
6-Sided Die

name: Surveyors of the Galaxy
description:
Equipment:

* pens
* paper
* ruler
* (optional die d6,d8, or d10)

Surveyors of the Galaxy is a game where players are flying spaceships in a scientific race to discover and survey the most star systems. After all players run out of fuel, the player who discovered the most systems wins.

Available at:
http://tomgale.com/galegames/surveyors-v2.htm

name: Domination: Sabot & Laser
description:
Domination: Sabot & Laser is the miniature rules for simulating the battles between the Kalotian Empire and the First and Second Allied Armies of Earth during the Kalotian invasion of Earth in the early 1990's. The game is compatible with Domination, the sister RPG from Starchilde.

The game uses 6mm scale miniatures to represent Human and Kalotian forces. The miniatures for Human forces could be obtained from vendors such as GHQ. The game was slated to have custom Kalotian 6mm miniatures, but ultimately none were ever made. However there are a number of grav style tank 6mm models that could be used in their stead such as C-in-Cs Renegade Legion miniatures.

name: Rules for World War I Naval
description:
Naval wargames rules covering the period 1914-1928. Designed to be played with 1:3000 models on a tabletop or 1:1200 models in a hall. Originally published in 1973. This entry based on the 1975 second edition.
The rules have an introduction to the period followed by rule concepts and ship statistic calculation rules. Then firing guns and torpedoes, hitting mines, clearing mines fuel, submarines, ramming and weather are covered. The final section of the rulebook covers statistics for ships of the period plus where to buy models and get reference material: a task much easier now with the advent of the internet.
The ground scale used is 1:6 and time scale is 1 minute per turn.
Some preparation is required before play can commence as turning circles must be made and ship statistics calculated for the ships in action.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: THC The Game
description: Another treasure from adult game publisher Kheper, THC The Game is designed for people getting high on weed while playing. Players spin and move around the board, completing dares, articulating challenging tongue twisters, and thumb wrestling. The dares are determined by players before the game starts and could be taking a shot or taking off a piece of clothing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Gran Hotel
description:
Another Monopoly-like game.

Each player has a value scale card with 6 levels. All players start with level 1, and in many different ways their level will be changing during the game.
When the level is high, the cost for buying hotels is also high, but at the same time you make more money when other players (?)fall(?) in your hotels.

The hotels are build in different areas, and each area has a number of stars. Hotels in areas with a lot of stars will give you more money.

Box contents:

- 1 square board
- 1 dice
- 4 "meeples"
- 36 hotels (9 of each 4 different colors)
- 24 "?" cards
- 4 values scale cards
- A lot of money

name: Super Powers Skyscraper Caper
description:
Super Powers Skyscraper Caper Board Game features a 3-dimensional board consisting of several buildings. Each player chooses one of the Justice League of America superheros as their playing piece: Superman, Batman, Robin, Wonder Woman, or Green Lantern.

Players fight against villains on rooftops. The player who earns the most points wins the game.

name: Rennraupe Rosalie
description:
from the instruction:

A game with colored dice for 2 to 4 quick players Ages 4 and up.

Hush! Can you hear pattering of the caterpillars`little feet? In an exciting competition, the colorful caterpillars crawl busily along their paths.
The dice determines which caterpillar will be the first to arrive.

name: Maus und Bär
description:
Mouse and Bear are good friends. They have a lot of fun exercising together! Why don't you join in?

The 36 domino tiles/cards are color-coded and each of them describes one exercise (e.g. crawl under the table, hop around on one foot, make yourself really tall). It's mainly played like dominoes but each player has to successfully do the exercise before the tile is allowed to stay on the table.

The game is targeted at kids age 4 - 8 and is part of Ravensburger's small box "Mitbring-Spiele" (take-along games) series.

(Maus und Bär is based on the popular German kids tv series "Die Sendung mit der Maus".)

name: Kullerblume
description:
Children's game where they try and create a colored flower.
Three marbles, a bowl and lots of colored petals and the game can begin!
White, red, yellow or blue? Nobody knows what petal the marbles will land on.

Well hidden under the cup three marbles are rolling. For each marble that lands on a colored leaf, you get a petal of the same color.
The first one to collect six colored petals and thus creates a colored flower wins the game.

name: Beaveropoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

GO BEAVERS!
Buy, sell, and trade Oregon State University! Memorial Union, Valley Library, the Trysting Tree, it’s all for sale as you play Beaver-opoly. You may soon be hanging out at The Beanery or who knows? You may become the newest Benny Beaver!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Righteous! Book of Mormon Edition
description:
Similar to the popular Scene It! DVD games, Righteous! gives Latter-day Saints a fun and interactive way to learn about the people, places, and events in the Book of Mormon. The game spaces are pictures of the prophets and other individuals throughout the Book of Mormon, organized in chronological order. Players or teams roll the number die and the action die. Players first follow one of the actions, including the chance to answer a multi-play DVD question. If they answer correctly, then they move the number of spaces shown on the second die until they get to the "Seal the Deal" portion, where they will go through a special set of questions to win the game. The first player or team to "Seal the Deal" wins! An ideal family night activity.
Contents:

Adjustable Game Board
Righteous! Dice
Four Book of Mormon Character Game Pieces
Stack of Golden Question Cards
Stack of Blessed or Suppressed Cards
Righteous! Book of Mormon Edition DVD
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: New Faces Game
description:
Based on the popular 1970's UK TV show, this game gave families the chance to audition and star in their own show in the comfort of their own home!
The aim of the game was to get your act through an audition for the "New Faces" TV show, and then move on to the Star Circuit. The winner is the first player to accumulate £20,000, after safely negotiating all three circuits of the board.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Abundance
description:
Abundance is a roll and move game which teaches basic financial principles and incorporates character or spiritual development as a means of achieving financial success. Players track income, expenses, assets, liabilities and "Potential Energy" (character) in order to achieve financial success. Many of the more lucrative paths are only available to those who achieve a higher spiritual ranking. Players must aid one another to increase spiritual scores.

From the publisher's website:

"Learn to unleash your Lion Within™, the key to infinite returns and getting rich even if you have little or no money.
In the game’s active environment, you will learn in a few hours what could take months or even years elsewhere. It allows you to practice getting rich both spiritually and financially so that you can have a greater capacity to go out and do it in real life.

The Abundance™ Game Will Teach You:
• How your spiritual well-being and character are directly related to making you rich.
• How the rich use creativity to make their money.
• How “good investments” are determined more by your mind than by the deal itself.
• How you can discover opportunity in your life that has been there all along."

Abundance was designed to be a successor to Cashflow 101 by the former employee and Kiyosaki (Cashflow 101 designer) trained trainer.


Redevelopment of Cashflow 101

name: Recall
description:
Recall: A Challenging Game of Observation

Object of the Game: Arrange a few simple picture cards in a tray. Show them to the player for several seconds. Then ask them to reconstruct the same design with their cards. That’s the basic idea behind Recall. An endless variety of designs can be made to challenge the ability of the players. Both young and old can compete on an equal basis, making Recall a good game for the whole family.

name: P P P Penguin Race Game
description:
Be the first to get all your penguins, or the most penguins, to the finish.

Each player starts with 3 penguins and 5 icebergs, places them all on the start space and chooses one of the 4 coloured trails to race along. A player moves his penguins and icebergs along his chosen trail by the throw of the two dice in any combination. Penguins hop from iceberg to iceberg by exact dice throw. If a 6 is rolled, the player may take any unoccupied iceberg from any other player and place it anywhere on his own trail.

A simple children's racing game that teaches how to plan ahead as only one penguin can occupy each iceberg at a time.

Contains 12 black & white wooden penguins, 30 small cardboard icebergs and 2 standard dice.

name: Monopoly: Flensburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Flensburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Paderborn
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Paderborn, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ley Lines
description:
Ley Lines is played with a Piecepack Set and Dominoes. It was an entry in the LudicSynergy contest.

Each player is the head of an ancient druidic order, building geographic conduits, called ley lines (dominoes), through which mystic energy can be channeled from the sources of such energy, called cairns (coins), to the order's sacred druidic stronghold, a tor (pawn). Each suit represents a different druidic order: worshipers of the sun (suns), worshipers of the moon (moons), worshipers of mankind (crowns), and worshipers of nature (arms).

Rules can be found on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Battle for Hoth
description:
“Battle between Rebels & Imperial troops on the Icy World of Hoth. Takes place in the Star Wars Universe. Each figure represents a hero, vehicle or unit of troops. Victory: The Rebels win if they destroy all the AT-AT Walkers. The Empire wins if they destroy the Ion Cannon & the Shield Generators.”

The game is played on an 8x8 grid or chessboard. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combatants. The Rebel force consists of Luke in Speeder (becomes Luke on Foot if hit), Shield Generator, Ion Cannon, five Snow Speeders, two Laser Turrets, and six Rebel Troop Units. The Empire force consists of four AT-AT Walkers, two AT-AT Scouts, two Probe Droids, two Heavy Blaster Teams, and six Snow Troopers. Each unit is rated for movement distance and attack range. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck and card play determines when units may move or attack.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Monopoly: Leeds (Limited Edition)
description:
Only 500 copies of this private version of Monopoly were ever produced.

Note: This is different than the public version from 2008.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Family Favourites
description:
This 1960's card game comes with 44 cards depicting family pets. There are several different types of pets and each card has a number as well as an animal on it.

The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of your cards by playing a card with either the same animal or the same number on it as the last card played. The number of cards you start with depends on the number of players. Every turn you try to play a card. If you cannot, you must draw a card instead. Once a player goes out, a hand ends and the remaining players must add up the point values left in their hands.

After 6 rounds, the player with the lowest score is declared the winner.

name: Rügen Rails
description:
Yet another Michael Mette designed and web-published variant of the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. As with several of his more recent games, this game takes place on a much smaller map than the traditional games in the series, so small in fact, that it is limited to only 2 players. It takes place primarily on Ruegen Island, off the northern coast of Germany.

The game can be downloaded here:
http://www.zahag.de/MMsKSg/rails/rr/main.html
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Galicja 1914
description:
A game from "Dragon Hobby" magazine (10) 2/2000 about the Austro-Hungarian and Russian fight near Krasnik and Zamosc in August 1914.

The game's rules are based on Tannenberg 1914 rules.

name: Die Biene Maja: "Willi, wo bist du?"
description: Maja is looking for her friends hiding under the flowers but Thekla the Spider is lurking about. Can Maja find her friends before finding Thekla?

name: Race Across America
description:
Race Across America is a free download game from Gen1400 Gaming. You can download Race Across America from www.gen1400.com.

In Race Across America (RAA) you compete with other players racing across states. Pick and choose which states you would like to race in or draw some randomly.

RAA is not just a racing game. Before you go on to the next state you will have to complete a challenge. The Challenge could be as easy as rolling an even number or as hard as rolling a 5.

RAA is a fun family game that is also educational. Each state is represented by a card. The State's capital is also listed on every state card.

name: A Terrible Resolve
description:
“The Japanese hoped that World War II would make them the masters of the Pacific. They recognized the industrial might of the United States. Their strategy was therefore to destroy the American Navy with a surprise attack on Pearl Harbor. The plan almost worked. The Japanese ran wild in the Pacific and seemed invincible. The most devastating weapons in their navy were their aircraft carriers. In 1942 the Americans had been driven from the Philipines and Australia was in peril. The next step in their campaign was to seize control of the American controlled island of Midway.”

“The Americans had different ideas. They had cracked the Japanese code and were routinely reading their secret messages. They uncovered the Japanese plan to attack Midway and decided to gamble everything on ambushing the Japanese carriers. The Yorktown was rapidly repaired and sent to join the Enterprise and Hornet. The Japanese air strike hit Midway Island hard. But then the Americans located the enemy carriers and attacked. The shocked Japanese retaliated but lost all four of their carriers."

"Yamamoto had once said that he was afraid that the United States was a sleeping giant, which would awaken with a terrible resolve. He was right.”

A miniatures wargame of aerial attack intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on two 7.5x5 foot tables, one containing the American fleet and one containing the Japanese fleet. The game may be played using simple paper miniatures (print-and-play components are available) or with waterline models of ships and aircraft mounted on stands.
categories: Educational, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Shattered Sword
description:
Shattered Sword is a Fantasy warfare card game for two or more players. Each player chooses an army, and the cards represent units in your army. Players can choose their units for each game based upon the point system which is included, or any other manner the players choose. Players can play on any suitable card table or larger surface which represents the battlefield where the opposing armies will fight.

Each faction comes packaged as an Army box deck of 54 cards, which contains 24 Unit Cards, 16 Command Cards and 12 Spell Cards. New releases now include Reinforcement packs for each Army containing Specialty Units, Command and Spell Cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Monopoly: Sephora
description:
Buy, sell and trade Sephora beauty products as you vie to own your very own Sephora store.

What's the same?
-The object of the game and the game rules. Vie to own it all and bankrupt your opponents to win.

What's different?
-Game board spaces and corresponding Title Deed cards feature Sephora beauty products. All property values are the same as in the original game.
-Sephora Experts replace the traditional railroad spaces.
-Beauty Dare and Beauty Bargain cards replace classic Chance and Community Chest cards, respectively. All cards are used in the same way.
-Primping Tax replaces Luxury Tax and Income Tax replaces City Tax.
-The money looks different but the denominations remain the same.
-Choose from six pewter tokens designed with the Sephora enthusiast in mind. Which will you be? The mirror, powder brush, compact, mascara, blow dryer or lipstick?
-Houses and hotels are renamed Sephora Bags and Sephora Stores, respectively.

Victory occurs in the classic fashion. Whoever is left when all other players have gone bankrupt wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Nuke Norway Now
description:
Allways wanted to A-bomb Norway and steamroll and
put tarmac all over it, including the cities and the civilians?

NUKE NORWAY NOW / Handmade not mass produced version.
English version officially released at Essen2009 together with NNN "the soundtrack"
Swedish version Officially released: 7 December 2008 (No longer produced)
Tactical & strategical boardgame for 2players
( includes a 3player scenario also)
Age: Ages 12 and up with an adult explaining the rules)
Gameplay time: 180minutes +

Including in the game box:
Rulebook
Big full colour game map
90+ Swedish units
90+ Norwegian units
30 other units.
A-bomb radiation diagram
36+ event cards

Perhapsable bonus:
Nuke Norway Now pin, NNN Warsong (opera)
NNN bookmark, NNN T-shirt, small book about Same.

Planned expansions in 2009
"Same rebellion 2011" for 3players
"Swedish Jihad outbreak"

Released expansions:
Norwegian SS-zombies ( here at bgg)

Translation to english for the Internationalmarket
by Wulf Corbett (also a boardgamegeek:))

Soundtrack by Henrik Svensson and the
pure satanicmetalband DemonicShadow and Emmerich.
http://www.myspace.com/demonicrock

NNN the soundtrack videorelease at youtube
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WuonzSP3Bko

1. March for Freedom ( Official Nuke Norway Now tune)
2. Legions of Death - Demonic Shadow
3. Vengeance - Demonic Shadow
4. In the Dark - Demonic Shadow
5. Medal of honour -Emmerich
6. March for Freedom (official party version)
7. Vaktregemente Göran Perssons marshvisa

All music is copyright demonicshadow,Henrik Svensson,
Emmerich, NNN music Peter Stenberg 009©
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Génies en herbe
description:
A trivia board game based on the popular TV show "Génies en herbe". (aired on Société Radio-Canada)

Has many of the same mechanics of the TV show.

Covering many fields of knowledge and containing over 3500 questions written by one of the TV judges.

Content:
1 board game
1 black cards holder
6 divider cards
1 dice
1 Rulebook
1 box with 750 question cards
10, 20 and 100 points money bills
1 hiding-card
6 playing tokens

Game goal:
Victory goes to the first player to reach the agreed upon point limit (ex: 300 points, 500 points).
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Autokinisi
description:
Autokinisi is a Greek educational game targeted at younger ages, although grown-ups can also enjoy it, and it is ideal for families. It was published in the 80s in Greece by Imago and is no longer in print.

It is played by 3-5 players with one of them not taking active part but playing the role of a general supervisor. Basically, he takes all the non-player roles in the game, like the traffic controller, the insurance agent, the examiner for the driving license etc)

The goal of the game is to drive your car in such a way so that you won't run out of money and at the same time create problems to the others to drive them to bankruptcy. By moving various pointers on the board you try to avoid STOP signs, obstacles etc so that you 'll save money, while forcing the other players to make violations and pay fines. How the pointers will be moved and the random events that take place are determined by random card draws.

The game contains:
A driving map
A series of bank notes
Four automobiles
A series of cards
A table with violations, fines and questions that need to be answered in order to obtain a license.

name: Hammer & Nails
description:
Spin the spinner, pick a piece, and hammer it in with the little hammer.

This is a kids game that is intended to develop fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination.

It uses a small hammer, and real metal nails.

name: Naruto Ninja Battleground
description: Naruto, Sasuke and Kakashi Battle Itachi, Gaara, and Orochimaru in the Forrest of Death. Each player takes control of a three ninja team in an epic fight. The Object of the game is to either eliminate the opponents team OR be in control of both Hidden Scrolls!

name: Doblo
description: In this dice rolling game, players try to make a connection of three, four and five. The roll of the die determines what character should be filled in on the scoring form: X,0 or -. You can only win this game with a little luck of the die and a lot of strategic thinking.

name: Yotta Know Waterfowl
description:
Part of a series of "Yotta Know..." games on different topics, Yotta Know Waterfowl is a game played on a six-by-six grid board on which players place cards depicting birds to be identified. The first player to identify seven waterfowl wins the round. Rolling dice adds a randomizing element to gameplay, while a handicap system allows players of varying knowledge levels to play against each other.
The game uses a deck of 54 waterfowl, all of which are found in North America.
Expanded by:

Yotta Know Birds
Yotta Know Mammals

name: Otto & Bruno
description:
The thick cards in this game show the characters Otto and Bruno, each on an opposing side. Each side also has a number in one of four colors, different from the opposing side. Players gather cards in racks, aiming to collect sets of either four numbers in a single color or four colors in a single number, but periodically the racks and decks are flipped so the alternative card sides are in play.

Listed among the notable card games in Fairplay's 1993 À la carte prize.

Re-implements:

The Cocoo's

name: Wie der Blitz!
description: You play various rounds. Whoever concentrates hard and can discard cards in accordance with the color rules, gets a thunderbolt as a reward. Whoever is the first to collect three thunderbolts wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: The Little Prince
description:
From the box:

A family game based on the motion picture adapted from the internationally popular book by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

From the instructions:

The object of the game is to be the first to either:

1. Travel the entire length of the path, OR

2. Complete a "Quotation Sequence" using the quotation cards and/or wild (rose) cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Дремучий лес
description:
Дремучий лес is a Russian board game with RPG elements. The game field is randomly built before each game from square cards of the locations, backside-up. Each player starts the game from "his" edge of a field, and travels across the woods, moving on a vertical and a horizontal directions. When he stops at a upturned location card, it has to be opened.

Each player has one of six possible characters: Киевский грамотей (Kiev Sage), Свейский купец (Swedish Merchant), Черниговская дружинница (Chernigov Fighting Girl), Степная шаманка (Steppe Witch-doctor), Заезжий викинг (Visitant Viking), Печенежский разведчик (Pecheneg Scout).

Cards from the playing cards deck are dealt to the players. They can use them to obtain useful items and NPC fellow travelers, to kelp with a quest, or to fight other players.

The game is over, when all the locations cards are uncovered.

Game atmosphere is impregnated by Russian fairy tales.

Contents of the game box:

100 playing cards
30 cards of location
4 markers of characters
Dice
Game rules

name: Munchkin Cookie
description:
Publisher's DescriptionIn 2008, the Dev Team -- smelling slightly of eggnog -- came up with the Munchkin Resurrection Cookie, featuring the grinning Super Munchkin. (We tried to fit his whole body, but his swelled head took up too much room. Too many victories in the dungeon have inflated his ego.)

We didn't sell any. We baked up a limited number and gave them all as gifts to staff, distributors, and other friends. These people are very special to us, and we wanted to give them the very nicest thing you can give to a munchkin... deserved in-game benefits!

Rule

If you suffer Bad Stuff that includes "death" in any Munchkin card game, you may eat this cookie to avoid all the Bad Stuff.

In Munchkin Quest, if you eat this cookie immediately after you flip your last heart to black, you are resurrected! Flip all your hearts back to red. You respawn instantly, in the room where you died, and you don't have to drop your stuff.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Shin Sengoku Daimyo
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #2.

A remake of Feudal Lord for beginners of wargaming.
This remake takes place in central Japan during the Sengoku period. Players plays a daimyo (lord).

Contents:
● 1 sheet map (B3)
● 1 countersheet (390 counters - size 12.5mm)
● 50 Cards (size 45mm x 68mm)

name: Popgeni
description:
A Swedish trivia game about pop music, with 3000 questions of the rock-pop-disco-soul scene of the 1960's to 1980's.

The number of players is not specified so the only limit is practicality; the game lasts until a pre-agreed number of points or rounds played.

A Finnish edition was published around the same time in the eighties by Kirjalito/Pelito as Hit Parade, with somewhat localized content of the Finnish music scene.

name: Undead States of America
description:
Undead States of America is an exciting tabletop wargame in which players recreate the battles and campaigns of a fictional Zombie War.

You are responsible for the refugees that follow you now. Gather your army from wherever you find pockets of resistance. Feed them, arm them, and train them for what is to come while the shambling hordes continue to gather on the horizon. Lead your troops to escape the initial outbreak, raid cities for supplies, rescue refugees, and break into military installations.

This isn't about urban survival any more.

This is war.

name: Piggy in the Middle
description:
A fun game to help children learn about money. roll a die travel round the board, earning pocket money to fill your piggy bank and spending it as you go.

This game is designed to help children learn about basic social and mathematical aspects of money.

name: Il Gioco della RAI
description: Quiz game about the RAI (italian TV broadcast company) for the 50's anniversary

name: Equilibrium
description: In Equilibrium, each player takes control of a fledgling country and tries to bring balance to it's economic, political and military aspects. Beyond the theme, Equilibrium is a novel card game in which each player will slowly deconstruct a deck of cards. To play cards into your play area, you have to remove other cards permanently from your deck. Score cards played will reward players for the cards left in their deck. However, each card left in their deck also scores -1 VP no matter what. Players can decide to end their game on any turn... once they think their deck has reached "Equilibrium".
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Sofort
description: There are 13 letter dice and three number dice. All dice are rolled at once. The numbers on the dice determine the goal of the round: The letter dice have values, and the players have to find a word made of the available letters with the overall value determined by the dice.

name: War Games Rules 1750 to 1850
description:
Napoleonic era wargame rules by prolific wargame designer Phil Barker. Book was first printed in January, 1971 and was reprinted and amended in September, 1972. 20 page rulebook includes 2 quick reference charts.

From the introduction:

These rules form one of a number of sets covering various periods based on the same mechanism as the very successful Ancient set produced by the Research Group, and used in three successive national conventions.

Our dates are set to include the first systematic use of light infantry and mobile artillery, and to exclude the expanding-bullet rifle. Where possible we have used sources from near the end of our period as these provide informed comment as well as facts.

...

We expect that these rules will be mainly used with Napoleonic Troops, and hope that we will now see the last of French Infantry attacking in line, instead of in columns covered by skirmishers and accompanied by horse artillery! Try it, it works!

We can also thoroughly recommend the American Revolution, the French Revolutionary Wars, and the South American Wars of Independence as alternative excuses for battle, while throughout the whole period there is ample scope in the wars on the Indian sub-continent for those so inclined.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Legendák kapitánya
description: This game is set on the world of the rpg 7th Sea. Players are captains whose goal is to become a legend. They have to acquire artifacts by accomplishing missions like destroying pirates or carrying gold to safety. There are four artifacts for each captain that they have to acquire in order to win.

name: Takeover
description:
from the web site,

GOAL

To Own Five Out of Eight Sectors.

PLAY SUMMARY

Players move their tokens by the roll of dice, Move To Instructions, and the INTERNET in which to purchase companies, which leads to owning sectors. Players can also sell, trade, and do Takeovers to get companies and sectors from others. A sector has 2, 3, or 4, companies. Each company in its sector has the same symbol.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kollgátan
description: This trivia game is based on a radio show, the players try to answer various questions on the Icelandic language in six categories: meaning of a word, literature, lyrics, sayings, the mix and the hat-trick). When you answer correctly you get 'a feather in your hat' for each category - the first one to collect all six feathers wins the game.

name: Pickering's Jungle Game
description:
A roll and move satire of Australian politics.

The object is to pass 4 laws as Prime Minister (each costing votes). Players become Prime Minister by owning the most electorates, and then taking the role off the current Prime Minister.

Electorates and votes are split into 3 types:

Big Smoke
Village
Mulga


Electorates can be taken from other players with the right type of votes. Players can defend the electorate with their votes in a bidding war, but the loser loses all the votes they put up.

Votes are gained and lost more or less randomly around the board (though often you gain/lose X votes per electorate of a certain type that you have).

name: Picture Pairs Matching Game
description:
Develops concentration and problem-solving skills.

This colorful game encourages young children to recognize and match objects, skills they will need when they learn to read and write. Players identify the familiar pictures of everyday objects shown on the lotto cards and match them to similar pictures on the game boards.

There are many different ways to play, and each version is progressively more difficult. The materials in this game can be used for story telling, as well as for sorting and organizing.
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Kunskapsjakten
description:
Kunskapsjakten is a trimmed-down reimplementation of NE-spelet with 4,000 new questions compared to 8,000 in the original game. As before, players move around the board and answer questions to assemble trophies (a miniature encyclopaedia) representing ten fields of knowledge.

"Kunskapsjakten" is also the name of a single book of 1,000 additional questions, a series of books each containing 500 questions, and an online feature where you can score points by answering timed questions (Swedish only).

name: Kokkolan laivanvarustajat: Skeppsredarna i Gamla Carleby
description:
Kokkolan laivanvarustajat - Skeppsredarna i Gamla Carleby (Shipowners of Kokkola) is a historical boardgame where players try to become the richest shipowner in Northern Europe. The game takes place in the 18th and 19th centuries, when Kokkola was one of the most significant maritime towns in Finland and a major export hub, especially of tar and timber - essential commodities for the large navies of the major European powers of the time.

In the beginning each player has a small ship which can carry one unit of cargo (initially, tar). Cargoes have a fixed buying price and profit depends on which port they are sold in. Each port provides 1 or 2 types of cargo, roughly historical - London wants tar and timber, provides luxuries and salt - and by trading in this way, players try to amass the biggest fortune before the cargoes run out.

Each round a player can sell or buy cargo and buy a bigger ship (carries 2 units) or cannon, which protects from pirates. Movement is by dice rolling, and before sailing a player takes a 'sea-card' with varying results - a pilot who helps in reaching the next port, pirates who steal the cargo, favourable or adverse winds or a special price event. The latter are also historical, such as the unrest following the French Revolution causing increased demand for grain in Amsterdam, or events of the Crimean War.

When the last cargo is bought, the game ends and the player with most money wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Angel
description:
Based on a tv series with the same name. The board represents different locations (the docks, police station, the apartment of Cordelia, a cemetery, ...) in Los Angeles. One player plays with the character Wolfram & Hart (the advocates of the devil). The other players play with Angel and his acolytes (Cordelia, Gunn & Wesley).

The principle of the game is to win points by fulfilling mission cards, these points are needed for the destiny track. The ultimate goal of the game is to advance the soul of Angel on the destiny track to level six (six points).

name: Tapp
description:
Tapp is a regional (Southwestern Germany / Wuerttemberg) traditional trick taking game with 36 Cards (4 suits, french cards from 6 up to Ace, worth 11 (ace), 10 (10), 4 (King), 3 (Queen), 2 (Jack) and zero (6,7,8,9)), with similarities to Skat, Binokel and Tarock. Each player gets eleven cards (3 player-game) three are laid aside as the "talon" or 8 cards (4-player-game) with 4 cards for the "talon". "Coeur" is always highest, the others are equal of value. There are different ways players can decide to "play". The one who "plays" does this against the other players (like in Skat). Usually ("trump game") you need 61 points to win the game.

Description and rules: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapp_%28Kartenspiel%29

name: Who Wants To Be a Millionaire? Sport & Leisure
description:
Manufacturer's Description
A new way of playing the board game based on the popular TV quiz show. The host uses a score pad to plot the progress of the players whilst testing them with questions on all types of Sports and Leisure activities.

Tension and excitement builds up as the players get closer to the million, and as in the TV show, they can use their lifelines.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: BrainBox: Art
description:
Did you know that Vincent van Gogh painted over 900 paintings in his lifetime? And can you name the artist of Britain’s greatest painting? Developed in conjunction with London’s National Gallery, BrainBox Art is full of interesting facts and amazing images of some of the best paintings in the world in stunning high quality on 56 beautifully-illustrated cards.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more,
Ages 8 to 88,
Contains 56 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight-sided die,
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zanzibar
description:
Oh how wild is Africa! Cards depicting animals (a lion, giraffe, elephant, zebra,...) are dealed. Then each player on his turn plays one of his cards in to one of the two matching card decks. A player who can play a card on his turn stays in the round; one who doesn't has to pass for this round. The final player to pass in a round wins one of the two decks. The player that in the end has the most different animals wins.
Zanzibar is the 2009 original edition. Wilde Bande is the German translation, edited by Amigo in 2010.
publishers: Albi, AMIGO, Shafir Games (המשחקים של חיים שפיר)

name: Troll
description:
Troll is a two player game played on an empty 8x8 square board.
Each player owns two opposite edges.
Each player drops one of his stones on an empty cell.
If at least one opponent stone is between that stone and another friendly stone,then all opponent stones that were between those stones flip its color.
Wins the player who managers to do a path connecting his two opposite edges.

name: Team Talk
description:
6 players: The players are divided into two teams, where one player is assigned to guess. The two other players in the same team now takes turn adding one word to a sentence about the word that has to be guessed.

4 players: The players are divided into two teams, one player from each team is assigne to guess. The other players now takes turn adding one word to a sentence about the word that has to be guessed.
publishers: danspil, The Really Useful Games Co.

name: Riches 'n Rascals
description:
Discover the wonders of the ancient world in a cut-throat board game of piracy, trading and treasure.

Boats laden with gold, diamonds and great treasure, sail the Seven Seas in Riches 'n Rascals - grappling with pirates and encountering wonderous and momentous moments in world history.
You begin your journey in the biting cold of the Ice Age, a time when terrifying sabre toothed tigers and mighty mammoths roam ice covered lands. As you sail the seas trading and pirating, you travel through the ages encountering the invention of the wheel, the great pyramids, Tutankhamen's magnificent mask and other great human achievements.
Can you fill your treasure chest with the most loot through cunning trading and pirating?
A cut-throat game of adventure and intrigue, Riches 'n Rascals is an exciting educational game where players discover world history without any background knowledge. No two games are exactly the same, enabling players to play indefinitely, discovering more & more about world history.

How Riches 'n Rascals is played:
On your turn you roll the two dice (a numbered die and ‘scroll’ die) and move your boat counter filed with gold, diamonds or other treasure to lands near and far. You trade with other lands at their home port and pirate other players by landing on their boats. If a ‘scroll’ die is rolled, you consult the ‘History Scrolls’ - read out what is happening in this place and time in history and follow the Scrolls’ instructions. If great achievements are happening in history you may get to double your loot or have a second turn, if there is strife - you may lose your loot or miss a turn. Any loot you safely bring back to your home port can be placed in your Treasure Chest where it is safe from all pirating.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Children's Game, Civilization, Economic, Educational, Mythology, Pirates, Prehistoric
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Fleet
description:
Fleet is a space battle between small fleets for 2-5 players using 1-2 Treehouse sets and a few coins.

Players move 3 or 5 (depending on the setup) Icehouse ships around on the surface, in an attempt to out-maneuver and destroy their opponents. Larger ships can move farther than smaller ships and take more damage to destroy. Use the black hole, wormhole, and special weapon to your advantage against your enemies. Last fleet standing is the winner.

Fleet was designed by Josh Cole. The full rules are available at http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Fleet

name: Portal
description:
Portal is a two-player abstract game played on a hex board where player's attempt to capture each others pieces. Each player has four different sized units that can move different amounts of spaces on a turn (1-4). Pieces are allowed free movement but may not move through a space they have already occupied that turn or move through another piece. Pieces can only capture in a straight line of hexes equal to their movement amount and may jump other pieces when capturing.

A key aspect to Portal is the turn structure. On alternating turns players will make one and two movements. That is, on turn 1, P1 will move once and P2 twice. On turn 2, P1 moves twice and P2 moves once and so on.

A portal board consists of three seperate types of "special" hexes.

The middle hex is the Portal. If you begin your turn with a piece in the portal you may move it to any open open, non-special space on the board and then make your movement(s) for that turn.

The spaces surrounding the portal are weakened. A piece in those spaces may not make a capturing move, except a "1" may capture into the portal only.

The red corner spaces are protected. A piece in that space cannot be captured, however, it must be moved out of that space on the player's next turn or it is removed from the board.

The game ends when one player has one or fewer pieces remaining on the board. Each remaining piece scores points equal to its movement value. The player with the higher score wins.

Portal is currently entered in the nestorgames continuous abstract contest as well as the 1,000 Year Design Challenge.

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/48043/item/1260124#ite...

www.thousandyeargame.com

name: IQ Test
description:
A brain challenging trivia game.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player.
Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Chicago-opoly
description:
How do you make a game about the second city?

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the CHICAGO we could into this box. It’s FULL OF BLUES, PIZZA, SPORTS, A LITTLE MORE PIZZA AND...LOTS OF WIND! LOOKING FOR A FUN WAY TO EXPERIENCE THE WINDY CITY? HERE IT IS!

Here’s a Quick Idea of How to Play... Buy your favorite Chicago properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and A LOT more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Chicago! You may soon be the mayor of Chicago... or you may be stuck in the traffic jam of your life! Get your game on!

This is Chi-town... and it’s your roll!

Publisher's Website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Jeugd
description:
Het Groot Van Dale spel der Nederlandse Taal is a word game based on the major dictionary of the Dutch language. It consists of a board over which the players move their pawns, answering questions pertaining to the Dutch language, in the fields of word knowledge and spelling. Correct answers earn dictionary markers which are put under the pawn. Depending on whether a player has one, two or three dictionaries, the questions become increasingly difficult, making the end game a challenge. The game ends when a player reaches the finish space on the board while having three dictionary markers.

Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal Jeugd is especially made for children at the elementary school.

name: Durch die Sümpfe
description:
From the back of the box:

A family game full of variety for 2-4 players aged 6 and over.

Who is the first to arrive safe and sound at the jetty? During the race on the way to the jetty you will have to lead your scouts through the dangerous marshland into the finish.

Contents:
1 board
4 pieces
6 coloured chips
1 coloured die

name: Soletrando
description:
Soletrando is a spelling game based on the Soletrando TV Show. It can be played both as a videogame or as a boardgame. The goal of the game is to correctly spell more words than other players.

Each match has 5 rounds. The 1st, 2nd, 4th and 5th rounds are played like this: in your turn, the player on your left chooses a card based on your age and level (1 or 2). You must correctly spell the word, including hyphens. At any time you can ask for a tip. The player on your left must read the definition of the word. If you don´t make any mistakes, put a token in the column for the current round. The only difference in the 3rd round, is that a dice must be played to determine the level of the word for spelling.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Tridio
description:
Tridio is an abstract educational game to help developping spatial insight.
It helps to see the relationship between 2D and 3D objects.

The game is developed by Productief BV and used in schools in the Netherlands.

Game is played by building a structure on the board, each player sitting at another side of the board (so another view on the structure). Everybody is building the 2D view from there side of the board.

By selecting a cube, and rolling the dice. 1 cube will be moved. Before the actual move. Every player should update his 2D view as it would look like after the move.

Tridio Basisspel is the first game in the Tridio series.

name: Pour l'amour d'une reine
description:
A mini-game from the oldschool French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 18 - Dec 1983). In the game, adventurers must seduce the Queen of the Kingdom of Passion and eliminate all others courtiers while controlling military patrols. The game is a mix between roleplaying games and boardgame as each player defines the seduction and discretion score for his character. Several magic items may be found to help him in his mission.
The game can be played by 2 to 4 players.
The game has only 10 counters : 4 characters and 6 patrols.
It needs 2 d6 dices to play.
The games ends when a character has managed to sit on the throne besides the queen and all other players are captured, or it ends when all the characters are captured and remain in the depths of the dungeon.

name: Rock'n Roll
description:
Um jogo de cartas de ritmo alucinante!

Para vencer é preciso descartar todas as cartas de sua mão. Seja esperto e aproveite para fazer com que os outros comprem cartas e você fique com a mão vazia. Na hora do Rock'n Rooll não deixe que os outros o ultrapassem e descartem as cartas primeiro. Com agilidade e inteligencia você consegue vencer o jogo. Diversão não vai faltar para quem joga Rock'n Roll.



O objetivo do jogo é esvaziar sua mão. Para tal, você deve sempre jogar uma carta com 1 número acima ou 1 abaixo ou com o mesmo número da carta anterior.
Quando entra em jogo a Carta Rock'n Roll, não tem mais ordem de jogo. Joga a carta quem quiser e tem que seguir o comando da Carta Rock'n Roll (jogar apenas cartas vermelhas, apenas pretas, etc.)



A fast-paced cardgame!You need to get rid of all card in your hand to win. Be smart and take the chance to force other players to draw cards while you empty your hand. When it's Rock'n Roll time, do not let the other players discard their cards first. You can win the game allying dexterity with intelligence. Leisure is guaranteed when you play Rock'n Roll.


The goal of the game is to get rid of all your cards. Each player goes in a clockwise direction and needs to play a card with a number that exactly 1 below, the same or 1 higher than the previous card.
When someone plays a Rock'n Roll Card, there's no order of play anymore, each player plays a card following the Rock'n Roll Card rule (only red cards, only black card, etc.).

name: Geopol
description:
From the game box:

Q: Do you know a county like Vietnam?
A: Yes, of course!
Q: Can you show this on the map?
A: .... eee I....wait wait...
Q: Did you know that 87 million people live there?
A: ...OK...

Board game that you are holding is made for getting knowledge about geopolitical in a fun way and to spend time in a great way.
World is full of amazing stuff, look around and compare countries by size, population, economy and power - it makes you think.

You goal is to answer and show correct placement and collect 5 cards from each continent.
Game lasts until one player has collected 5 cards from each continent, or if each country is claimed by someone or is the game gets boring, then the ones who has most cards is the winner.

On your turn you roll two dice. One dice shows which of the continents you have to choose from (6 is free choice) and the other dice shows how many countries you can try for this turn. Then player collects 1 or more cards from the corresponding card pack and sets himself ready. Then 2 minute timer is activated and active players must show with small tokens where each of those selected countries are.

There are many many optional rules for game play.

name: GaroBouc
description:
From the publisher:
Fast new kids game for who like to gamble with luck and hope for the best. Be the brave hiker and sneak by the goat, so you would be pushed off the mountain hard.

Each player has two hikers in their own color and spin the spinner. Then they have a choice of move (1-3), not move at all (pass) or move the goat.
Goat makes random circles and kicked of one hiker (if it can hit it). First player to reach the mountain top is the winner.

name: Fancy Nancy's Fabulous Fashionista Game
description:
Designed by Mary Jo Reutter, winner of the 2010 Excellence in Game Design award at the Toy and Game Industry (TAGIE) Awards.

For 2-4 players ages 5 and up, players must try to gather an fashion outfit, and create a glorious ensemble!

In Fancy Nancy Fabulous Fashionista Game,players assemble their Fancy Nancy ensembles (held in the armoire and shoe rack!) by trading and collecting the necessary fashion elements. The first to have three runway-ready outfits is the winner.

The game comes with 4 armoires and shoe racks; 12 matching dress and shoe tokens and rules for different ways to play. Also included are bonus cling stickers that can be used to fancy-up the armoires or just about anything else that needs that special touch!

Released early in 2011, and published by BriarPatch.

name: Spielezeit mit Adelheid
description: Simple roll-and-move with three pawns each. You have to go through a maze and need cards to pass some spots. There are also spots to draw new cards. Two pawns on the same spot block the space. First player having all three pawns in the goal wins (goal has not to be reached exactely)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Würfel-Wörter
description:
Five dice with letters are rolled. Now every player tries to build a word only with thes five letter, bur can use the five letters as often as they wish. The player rolled can use one joker letter.

Write down your word an put it in the game box. If all players but one wrote down a word the words will be scored. Each word is one point per letter plus a bonus for beeing fast.

name: Hero vs. Zombies
description:
A solitaire print and play game designed for the 'one full sheet label' board game design contest in December, 2010, temporarily available here: http://boardgamegeek.com/image/879311/amnese?size=original

The player controls a hero who, with their trusted ally and a select array of items, must defend the last Resistance H. Q. from a horde of zombies.

Each turn a horde of zombies moves towards Resistance HQ (the player's home base). The player then has a series of actions with which to move about the city and defeat the zombies. If zombies reach Resistance HQ, the game is over. The player wins if they defeat all the attacking zombies.

The random setup, different movement of zombies, and the selection of items ensure this is a different game each time.

Whilst designed for solitaire play, a cooperative multi-player variant is included in the rulebook, temporarily available here: http://www.mediafire.com/file/l3zaiwifym2dupm/HvZ_rules_1.0....

name: Fette Beute
description:
Hungry Dinosaurs roam through their territories searching for food. But if the little dinosaurs are too greedy, the dangerous T-Rex takes his chance. Who gets the biggest pray in the end? A card game where you shouldn't be greedy.

This is a push-your-luck game.
First you gamble with your 2 dino-cards where you will look for food (in 2 out of 3 places). Luck then decides in what 2 places you can roam for food. On your turn you open the cards finding food. You can turn cards as long as you want. But there are T-Rex in the cards to and if you draw one you loose all the food you found. So try to gather enough but don't push your luck.

Components:
3 territory tokens
3 territory cards
8 dinosaur cards
60 pray cards
The game is part of the T-RexWorld line of Die Spiegelburg.

name: Monsieur sport athlétisme
description:
The goal is to reach scoring the most points in different disciplines of athletics to be named "Super Champion"!

The board represents a stadium with its running track and its vaulting. Each player receives initially a pawn and a map of "bonus" per event, and these cards can be favorable or unfavorable to the player to an opponent. For the first event, the 100 meters, you draw lots which starts (with the corridor No. 1) and the other players play in the direction of clockwise. In each round, the player rolls dice and moves as many spaces, some will make replay or rewind! The first who crossed the finish line wins 3 points, second 2 points, third 1 point.
In the 110 meter hurdles, the same rules apply but the passage of the hedges is if you go out at 1 or 6. In the 400 meters, using 2 dice and make a lap. In the 800 meters, you do 2 laps and you need to cast off the rope after the first round.

High jump, you throw 2 dice and make a minimum total (3 points for 1m30, 1m40 4 points etc. ...). In the long jump, the principle is the same, but the launch of a special die tells you if the jump is "bitten" or not!

Remember that in every event you have a card you favor or giving an opponent a handicap.
The player who collected the most points at the end of the 6 tests was crowned "Super Champion"

name: Stonehenge Soccer
description:
Number of players: 2–4

Object of the game: The player that shoots the soccer ball the best will win the game.

Equipment: You will need the box, four trilithons and a set of ten of the same color disks per player.

Playing the Game

When all of the players are ready to begin, each player touches their goal with one of their thumbs and hold their ball straight up with their pointer finger. All players yell "one, two, three, shoot" to begin. A player can then "shoot" the ball by gently flicking it with their other pointer finger. There are no turns to this game, so the players can shoot as fast or as slow as they wish.

The game ends when all of the players are out of disks. Scoring is completed and the one who scored the most points wins. If there is a tie, out of the tied players, the player who has the least amount of balls through their home goal is the winner.

"What a great day for Stonehenge Soccer, Chet."

"You betcha, Bret. Both teams have just finished making their appropriate sacrifices and they are ready to take the pitch."

name: Kaiju Kaos: The Miniatures Game
description:
A miniatures game where players play colossal creatures and human-sized kaijin monsters such as Scarecrows, Werewolves, and Zombies as well as huge monstrous creatures (think Godzilla) in a battle to the last remaining creature.

Each player with have a sheet detailing their monster, it's characteristics and attributes. Using a custom d10 system, the players will battle each other using various attribute modifiers. This is a 28mm scale skirmish game where human (and humanoid creatures) are 28mm and and monsters are up to 14" tall.

name: Party Gras
description:
With a game name like Party Gras, you better believe the goal of this game is to collect more strings of beads than any other player.

At the start of the game, the players divide the beads evenly amongst themselves, then place the beads around their necks. Each player receives two challenges cards out of the 300 hundred in the game. Each challenge card features three challenges from the following categories:

• Mind Control – Get another player to do what's listed on the card, such as asking you to lower your voice.
• Caught in the Act – Spot someone doing the action listed on the card, such as text messaging.
• Talk It Out – Start a conversation and find someone who satisfies the condition listed, such as liking werewolves more than vampires.
• Fashion Police – Find someone who matches the description on the card, such as two players who have shirts of the same color.
• Go Crazy & Challenge – Do what the card tells you to do.

If you find someone who fits the challenge, then show that player the card and take 1-2 beads from that player, as noted on the card. Discard that card and take a new one. Anyone de-beaded due to a card can choose to discard one card in hand and draw a new one.

The player with the most beads once the preset time limit expires wins the game.

name: Tout le monde veut prendre sa place
description:
The board game from the French show of the same name on France 2 --
"Everyone wants to take his place"

The goal of the game is to earn points to challenge and defeat the champion in the final step of the game.

At the beginning of the game a player is selected to be the champion (or the champion of the previous game) and wait for an opponent.

During the first two steps of the game, other players answer series of questions and earn points to qualify them to the final.Players may choose to answer directly, or choose between four possible answers or between two possible answers, influencing the amount of points they earn.

In the third step of the game, the player with the most points faces the champion defeat him and take his place!
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole – Circles of Strength Game
description:
"It's good vs. evil in this exciting game themed from the fantasy family adventure film Legend of the Guardians. The brave young Barn Owl faces off against the evil Sooty Owl."

This is a smaller, themed reimplementation of Reversi with 36 spaces rather than the usual 64. The resulting game play is faster. After all 36 disks have been played, the game is over and the player who has the most owls face up wins.

Contents Include: Game Board, 36 disks and instructions.

Re-implements:

Othello

name: Boy Crazy
description:
Boy Crazy is a simple collectible card game for girls, created by Decipher Inc. during the Pokémon Trading Card Game boom.

Cards are distributed in packs of 9 cards. Each card featured a picture of a boy aged 12–22, his first name, set of statistics about him (height, date of birth, color of eyes), and a list of his likes and dislikes. Cards includes boys from across the United States, from different ethnic backgrounds and hair and eye colors, including disabled boys.

Game is basically a very simple matchmaking game. Minimum requirements for game are at least 9 cards, and each player should have pencil and paper. Play begins when players decide who gets to go first. Using the Boy Crazy cards (9 cards or more), first player secretly writes down which boy she likes best and why. Then the first player lays out the cards so everyone can see them. The other players try to make a match by writing who they think is the best boy for the first player and why. Then, each of the other players take turns revealing who they chose as her match. After the first player reveals her response, scores are tabulated for that round. Each player who correctly matches the first player's response scores a point. Play continues until every girl has a chance for her friends to guess her match. To start a new round players should discard starting set of 9 cards and draw a new set of 9 cards. The player or players who makes the most correct guesses wins.

The game was so popular that Decipher launched a companion "Boy Crazy" magazine in September 2001.

name: Classique
description:
A cycling game. 2 to 6 players. Copyright 1984 Peter English. Materials: black and white laminated board featuring a course and cartoon graphics, spinner (you can use a 6 sided die, 34 bonus tabs, 7 cutout figures for bunch and riders, 6 rider cards (Bernard, Eddy, Fausto, Jacques, Sean, Tom - functionally identical).
Riders can be either in "the bunch" or making a break out in front or left behind. When in the bunch the rider figure remains on your card where you also place bonus tabs that are accumulated by reaching certain points in the race first and also when rolling on your turn a 4 or 5 if in the bunch, or 6. Main mechanism is roll and move along a track that includes squares for gaining bonus tabs and penalties that can move you back. The race takes the riders past fans, through an avalanche, past a protest, into a thunderstorm, up the Kremmelburg climb, across cobbles and up the Poggio climb before the finish. Each turn, each player spins the spinner (rolls the die), moves individually or stays in the bunch and and after all players the bunch moves. The bunch always moves three spaces. To break away from the bunch you must roll a 4 or more. A minimum of one rider must remain in the bunch. Generally there can only be up to 2 riders per square (1 on the Kobbleburg climb) and the bunch will swallow you back up if it catches you or leave you off the back if it passes you. Players use their bonus tabs to increase their movement rate or to increase the speed of the bunch when the bunch moves.
The strategy revolves around collecting bonus tabs and deciding when and at which part of the course to make an individual break. The winner is the first rider past the finishing post.

name: Odds-On The new greyhound race game
description: Players 'invest' their money on which greyhound will win. The greyhound trap number cards are shuffled and the bookmaker takes out some cards. He then offers odds based on the knowledge that some greyhounds will have less cards than other ones. The players now bet. The race is simple. The bookmaker turns over a card and that greyhound moves one space. Then another one is turned and that greyhound (it could be the same one) moves one space. After 6 races, the player with the most money wins.

name: Lerne München kennen
description:
This is a trivia game about the German city of Munich.

Players roll a die, move around the trails on the board across Munich (a satelite photo) and answer questions about the state. The first one to make it back to the starting space after collecting 8 cards from the different Bavarian regions and answering a final question correctly wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Schmidt Spiele, Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München, Süddeutsche Zeitung

name: Time's Up!: de Troy
description:
Time's Up! is a party game for teams of two or more players (best with teams of two). The same set of famous names is used for each of three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted). In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

It's a limited edition of the game set in the World of Lanfeust.

It's a promotional item available only when you buy 3 comic book by Christophe Arleston.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: Re Cuor di Leone
description:
A collectible card game of the early '90s.
Description from rules:
"It 'set in medieval Europe, an era full of myths and legends that we intentionally revisited with historic elements and other purely fantastic. Each player plays the parts of a royal family, consisting of a king, a queen, a prince and a princess.
The goal is to eliminate as many opponents of real characters.
Family members will fall into fights or be victims of one of the many plots hatched in secret at court.
In defense of their King, the Army will cross the territories of the Kingdoms, scene of several battles, and fight to the death, accompanied by terrible Adventurers from the most prestigious "Compagnie di Ventura" (mercenary).
Meanwhile the men of the Court can weave plots in the risky realm enemy, drawing huge sums from the royal treasury.
In addition, powerful spells and tremendous sorcery influence the destiny of each player ... "

Players prepare their own decks of cards dividing that in Kingdom's deck and draw deck.
Each round a player can discover up to 3 cards from the Kingdom, according to the last card face can perform different actions that can be:
- Attack an enemy kingdom;
- Prepare the defenses of his kingdom;
- Increase his royal treasury;
- Weave a plot against an opponent;
After discovering his Kingdom cards , if have the Armies in hand can play it, eventually integrating with the "Compagnie di Ventura" (mercenary) purchased using the treasure.
At the end of the turn draw from the deck to bring their hand to 8 cards.
When one of the decks of a player runs out, the game ends and the player who has managed to eliminate many real charachter won.

name: Skeletons in the closet
description:
From the publishers web site:
Skeletons Closet is revealing board game where players share their dark secrets, likes and dislikes, and thoughts with other players. In turn, each player draws cards, which are written in either the objects, people or attitudes. The players set the order they want the card to be in and the other players try to guess what that order is. Most correctly guessed, the player can move around the board faster than others! The player who manages to evade the game board first, wins, but ... win was his to keep at least one skeleton to reveal his own closet!
Skeletons Closet is a party game where winner must share a one secret, but losers has to do a lot more....
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Spacca 15
description:
Italian board game of the '70, based on the quiz show "Spaccaquindici".
Three players try to answer questions to identify characters and events through pictures or meaning of common words.
The mechanism of the game also included the typical actions of some card games, how to bet or fold, so the player must have skills typical of game of chance in addition to the mnemonic knowledge.
The player who scores 15 points is the winner.

name: Mouse blaster
description:
On this (quite literally) cat and mouse game, two rounds are played, with each player taking the role of the cat or the mouse in each of them. The one controlling the mouse must move it with a magnetic stick around the course, go to one end where there's a cheese and go back to his shelter, while avoiding the tomatos thrown by the player controlling the cat, who tries to knock down the mouse as much times as he can before it escapes.

After both players have played controlling the cat, the one who knocked off the mouse more times wins the game.

name: Chicken Dance
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Chicken Dance is a non-authorized version of Dancing Eggs. According to HABA, Top Toys does not have license to produce this game, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Dancing Eggs.




Chicken Dance has 16 eggs, and Dancing Eggs has 10, but the games are otherwise virtually identical.

From Dancing Eggs:
First a player rolls the red die.
