Depending on the result of the die roll, players can: attempt to be the first to take an egg from the box (or steal from someone else if there are none left in the box); drop an egg on the table and then compete to catch it; or even get up and run around the table to try to be the first back to their seat. When a player successfully wins an egg, he or she then rolls the white die, which indicates the location of the egg; between your cheek and your shoulder, your chin and the breast, between your knees, etc. When the first person drops an egg, the game ends and the one having the most points wins the game.

name: Crossword Dice
description:
Object of the game is try Your skill with words to win the greatest number of crossword cards.

In his turn player throws the 6 dice and attempts to form a word(s). If the player can use all six letters then he takes the top card of the card pile but he can only keep it if he can join it to his dice arrangement by forming another word or extending the excisting word.

When all the cards have been claimed the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Slag om Amersfoort
description:
In Slag om Amersfoort (Battle for Amersfoort) the players try to conquer the Dutch city of Amersfoort. The game is situated in the 16th century, when the forces of field marshal Maarten van Rossum occupied the city.

Every turn, players can try to have one of their pawns enter the city. Then they roll the dice to move the pawns that are already in a city. Whenever pawns of different players are on the same spot, the players roll the dice to fight. The losing pawn is thrown out of the city. Instead of moving their pawns, a player can also try to answer a trivia question to "acquire" the location of one of their pawns.

The game ends when one of the players has acquired the four location on their secret mission card. Alternatively, the game can also end when a certain number of pawns have been ejected from the city; in this case Maarten van Rossem wins, together with the player who won the most fights.

Rules for a simplified game for children "Amersfoort op Drakenpoten" (Amersfoort on Dragon's Feet) are also included.

name: Square Off
description:
Children's game to help develope spatial awareness.
Players draw tile and have to work out if it can contribute to the 6 tile pattern they have in front of them. As tiles can be any way up, this is quite a test for a young brain.
The winner is the one who completes his/her pattern first.

name: Définimages
description:
Définimages is a riddle and charade-like game, where players solve puzzles based on definitions and with 60 picture cards, which illustrate monosyllabic words.

Variant A: The 60 picture cards are displayed so they can be seen by all the players. Each round, a player is a appointed as "Game Master" and reads a definition; the first player to find the cards (2, 3 or 4) illustrating the syllables of the word defined wins the points of that turn. After a round (10 definitions: 10 turns), an other player is Game Master for the next round; a game can have up to 10 rounds (of 10 turns).

Variant B: The players agree on the number of cards (from 30 to 60) to be displayed and a time limit (or to not have a time limit). The players try to make as many words as possible by picking the picture cards illustrating the syllables of a word. All the players play concurrently.

In both variants, each word is worth the number of cards it required to illustrate the syllables of the word.

There's also a variant for children.

name: The Invasion of Italy
description:
In the early months of 1943, the United States and British Commonwealth forces had finally defeated Rommel and the axis armies of North Africa. The allied leaders were in disagreement on what the next step should be; invade Italy, the Balkans, or France. Stalin was desperate to open another front in Europe. Churchill wanted to invade Italy which he labeled “the soft underbelly of the Axis”. It was agreed that since no invasion of Northern France could be undertaken in 1943, that the invasion of Sicily would take place. The allied commanders were sure that invading Italy would all but destroy the Italians will to fight, and maybe the government and Mussolini would be overthrown.

The German high command was also aware that Italy’s support for the war was dwindling. German units that were needed for the Eastern front were sent to Italy to help defend against an allied attack and to police the Italian army in case of a coup. With most of Germany’s army and supplies on the Eastern front and a weakening ally in Italy, Germany is desperate to keep the allies out of Southern Europe.

The Invasion of Italy is an Axis & Allies style game that puts you in the seat of the Axis commanders who are racing to get their army into a position to defend Southern Europe, and Allied commanders who are ready to open another front in Europe to relieve the Russians on the Eastern front. Will you follow history as the allies and invade Sicily and then Italy, or will you try to take Rome first and severe the Axis army in Europe? Can the Axis hold out long enough with their limited supplies, or will Italy fall and leave Germany defending Italy…..ALONE?

The game features a map of Italy (36" x 48")(91 cm x 122 cm) divided into controllable territories. One player plays the side of the Axis controlling the Italian and German units defending Italy against the Allied Invasion. The other player controls the Allies who have 20 turns to take as many victory cities as possible before the Germans can reinforce Italy. Game uses a D12 combat system and pieces from the Axis & Allies series of games and is a variant of these games.

The Game comes with map , rules, and some units. You will need additional pieces to play the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Wissen für Millionen
description:
Objective: be the first travelling round the world and win a million Euros
- moving by turn -
if you found the correct answer for a question move the number you bet for
if you are positioned on a risc area you even have to move back; positioned on a airfield distance is larger, but you are confrontated with more difficult questions like citations, even a bit 'weird' ones
you may choose the level of difficulty, but all players are challenged to find the correct answer - and may move if ...

name: Pondus Pub
description:
Pondus Pub is a quiz game set in the Pondus universe by cartoon drawer Frode Øverli. Each player takes turns in throwing a die and answer questions to be awarded with cheese pops, beer or red wine. These assets are needed to hit on the girls in the pub. Once you have gathered at least five of these assets (by answering questions correctly), you can try to hit on a girl. Each girl has different needs, so you might fail, and need to collect more alcohol and snacks. If you are caught by the bartender, you are sent out of the pub to go around the block and get some fresh air!

--

Fra esken: "Glem Robbie Fowler, Steven Gerrard og el Niño Torres! Hat-trick kan nå scores på en pub nær deg, nærmere bestemt Pondus Pub. Og vi snakker ikke om fotball, det er nemlig Jokkes bedrifter utenfor oldboysligaen som danner bakteppe for spillet. Holder du hodet kaldt, flaksen varm og hjernen koblet til ryggmargen, kan du bli med helt til siste runde. Spille skal svare på spørsmål i kategoriene: Fleip eller fakta, Hvorfor vet jeg dette? Rubb og rake."
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: The Three Stooges Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Calling all knuckleheads!
It's time to wheel and deal with Curly, Larry and Mo, the kings of slapstick. Enjoy this classic game of risk taking and deal making as you compete to own memorable locations from the Three Stooges films. Laugh out loud as you buy Moronika and Mildew College; sell Rutentuten’s Tomb and the Los Arms Hospital; and trade Gypsum Goode Antiques and the Cannonball Express. Don’t be a "featherbrain imbecile” and go bankrupt! This hilarious trio is yours for the taking! “Step aside nitwit, I’ll show you how to do this."

Includes six collectible tokens: Derby hat, Mallet, Seltzer bottle, Pipe wrench, Cream pie and Violin. Slaps and eye pokes not included.
“Woob, Woob, Woob!”
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Think: Kids – Memo-Krimi
description:
Children version of game Think: Memo Crime.
The players have to remember small details as a detectives and collect as many winning chips as possible if they story is correct.

Players roll the dice, move accordingly and draw two word cards from one of the stacks showed on the square they landed and tell a story must be both chronologically and substantively correct and if the words happen every time the word cards correctly.

Four stacks of incredible stories lie in the mysterious attic. Who remembers them best and be the most creative to retold these stories, wins the game.

Contents:

1 game board,
112 word cards,
1 dice,
40 chips profit,
one character
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory

name: Word Wave
description:
Word Wave is the fast-paced game of word making and taking. This game challenges you to find words fast. Create words and shout them out as wave after wave of letter tiles launch from the device. Steal words from other players by adding letters to make new words. The player with the most points when the last letters launch, wins!

A switch on the side of the Word Wave machine lets you choose how often new letter tiles shoot out of the device. Each round lasts ten minutes or less.

name: Battle Royale: The First Silesian War
description:
(From the game's Consimworld folder)

Battle Royale is the first in a series of games dealing with campaigns of famous 18th century military leaders (Frederick the Great and Marlborough among others).

Battle Royale is a simple wargame about the First Silesian War, 1741-42. The campaign marks the debut of Frederick the Great's military career, however inauspicious this was for him personally. The war began with Prussia taking advantage of a perceived weakness of the new and first Queen of Austria, Maria Theresa, when she assumed the throne. Bavaria, France, and Saxony contested Maria's claim to the Austrian crown, as well as having long disputes over their borders or policies of the Austrian empire. Prussia sought to claim the rich province of Silesia from Austria and in a whirlwind (for the time) campaign in 1740 seized virtually the entire province. Prussia's Allies took longer to mobilize their forces and work out the disputes they had with one another to form a coalition to defeat Austria and overthrow its new queen. A long era of war in central Europe was about to begin. Can you do as well, or better, than your historical counterparts?

The game uses the "chit-pull" system with a deck of cards similar to Paul Rohrbaugh's Pocket Battle Games series from Against the Odds.
categories: Age of Reason, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: The History Channel presents Time Troopers
description:
Answer history trivia questions correctly and advance along a board track. Answer wrong and go back. Fate cards may force you go back as well. Play cooperatively or competitively with up to 4 players.

Hosted by John Cleese as Agent Wormold, there are video clips that have to be identified as well as questions.

name: Monopoly: Bochum
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bochum, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Heilbronn
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Heilbronn, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Potsdam
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Potsdam, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Défifoo Marron
description:
The game is played in 5 rounds for which the number of cards per player changes each time (7,8,9,8,7).

Each player bets on the number of tricks that he hoped to get.
There are 5 colors with the numbers 1 to 9 and knight, king, executioner (0 or 10 depending on the player's choice), dragon and the witch who are are stronger (except in the last 3 turn or they are worthless).

The first player commits a color, the others should play the same color and bigger card to take the trick.
At the end of the game everyone counts the number of tricks performed. if the bet is won, the player multiplies the "tricks" by two and adds it to his 100 points. If the bet is not won it calculates and subtracts the difference to his score.
Player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Monopoly: Texas Edition
description: Monopoly using Texas themed properties such as The Alamo, the Astrodome and the LBJ Presidential Library.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Greyhound Race Game
description:
Box slogan "Exciting Game For All the Family,With All the Thrills of the Track."

The object of the game is to get your greyhound first over the finish line.

Choose your trap number, choose your stake and on which dog you wish to bet on. Fany bets such as Forecasts or Combinations are allowed (although heaven knows what a 7 year old would make of that).

When you land on the special spaces, most tell you to draw a card and follow the instructions. There are good and bad cards draw. Some cards relate to bonuses, reserve dogs, competitive greyhounds, and sprint racing are all part of the game.

name: Realstat Gymnastics
description:
An unusual subject for a statistical sports game. Designed to be very fast so that an entire Olympic gymnastic competition could be played in one evening.

Over 250 gymnasts are rated for their abilities. These are based on performances at the real Olympic Games. Essentially, roll dice for each perticipant and that roll is checked against their rating to give them their score.

Statistics are provided in paper lists rather than individual cards.

name: Persona
description:
A pseudo-psychology game, intending to reveal how much you know about your friends and, in return, what they think of you. This is not how to win the game though. The winner is the player with the most points at the end. You earn points by lying, choosing good moves for your playing piece or by drawing cards (100% luck).

Movement is by the roll of two dice. You have two playing pieces (your 'ego' and your 'id'. At ther start, just the ego is used. But once the hex 'Inferiority Complex' has been passed, you bring your id on to the board. Thereafter, you can move one piece the total of the dice rolled or you can move both your playing pieces by allocating one die to the ego and one die to the id. There are lots of cards, five types and when you land on certain hexes you have to take a card and obey the instructions.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Le Jeu du Chat
description:
You can play with the famous 'Chat' (by cartoonist Philippe Geluck) through a game that includes 560 drawings and 600 tasks!

This is a game full of humour and surprises for all the family!

Tasks include drawing, questions, mimics, guesses and observations. Players moves their respective pawns on something similar to 'snake and ladders', the landing square indicating what task to perform. The player wins by landing on the final square.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Soccer Replay: 1978 Argentina
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1978 world cup in Argentina and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Dragonfly
description:
Dragonfly is a Chess variant played on a 7x7 board using most of the pieces of orthodox Chess, but not a Queen. The setup position puts the king in the center of the first row, with the Bishops left and the Knights to the right. Pawns have no initial double move, all other pieces move as in Chess. Castling is allowed, too.

In practice, two sets of pieces are necessary to execute the game's Shogi-like drops: captured pieces are held in reserve and can re-enter later under the capturing player's control.

Pawns which reach the opposite side promote to a unit in the opponent's reserve (!), if there is one, essentially re-capturing the reserve unit. Captured pawns cannot be dropped and remain out of play.

name: BrainBox: British History
description:
Do you know where the UK’s first motorway was built in 1958? Was it 8, 18 or 28 miles long? Can you name the English pop band often referred to as the Fab Four? In this version of BrainBox we take a look back at England’s most successful and influential people, events and inventions.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more
Ages 8 to 88
Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight-sided die

name: Pocket Quiz: Gehirnjogging
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

name: Captain Kidd
description:
The game consists of 30 treasure chest tiles which also show a jewel in one of six colors, and six large wooden pirate meeples.
The tiles are laid out in a 6 x 5 grid and a pirate is placed on a tile of each color, covering the jewel so it can no longer be seen. The active player now rolls a color die and has to find the jewel in the right color (by picking up the pirate). If correct, the player gets the tile and places the pirate on another tile in that color. If wrong, the pirate is put back onto the tile. The game ends when only three colors are left; the player with most tiles is the winner.

name: Conni auf dem Bauernhof
description:
Objective: get as many cards as possible
- acting simultaneously -
place 8 cards uncovered upon the table;
distribute remainig cards among players, forming a staple;
simultaneously all players uncover their top one;
if there is a matching one in the middle - grasp at it as fast as possible.
Successfully catching a card players have to form a 'loot' staple, on top last obtained card, uncovered! If a player uncovers a matching card during next turns the whole staple can be caught. Game ends after all 8 cards are picked up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Farming

name: Grabbit
description:
Children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hilarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. Amphibian themed game that uses a rotating tree to spin mosquitos towards the frog. The goal is to make the frog grab up all 6 bugs before the timer stops. When the time stops the tree pops off the base.

From the box: "Grab the bugs before the time stops and the tree pops!"

Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Heinrich Himmler Promo Card
description:
The semi-educational game of time travel and abduction!

Evil Baby Orphanage is a communal deck party card game for three or more players. Each player takes on the role of a Time Nanny using advanced time out technology to rid the time stream of the world's worst villains and "prehabilitate" them to be accountants, or ballerinas, or something.

Heinrich Himmler is a "Babbling" Promo Card. If left unsupervised each other Time-Nanny to your left and right get to draw 1 Nanny-Card

name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Nero Promo Card
description:
The semi-educational game of time travel and abduction!

Evil Baby Orphanage is a communal deck party card game for three or more players. Each player takes on the role of a Time Nanny using advanced time out technology to rid the time stream of the world's worst villains and "prehabilitate" them to be accountants, or ballerinas, or something.

Nero is a "Bully" Promo Card. If left unsupervised these Evil Babies shove an Evil baby from another Orphanage. Choose any Time-Nanny, that Time-Nanny must select one of their Evil Babies and give it to a Time-Nanny to their Left or Right.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition des Vins
description:
By answering questions correctly and by being the first one to fill your token with 6 colours, you can win the game.

There are 3000 Q&As, divided into 6 themes:
- Wine Geography
- Terroirs and Cepages
- Wine history
- Wine and Culture
- Wine and Science
- Surprise

The box includes:

- a board
- 3000 cards
- 2 card containers
- a die
- 6 round pawns and 36 coloured triangle markers.

name: Monopoly: Wismar
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Wismar, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Wangerooge
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Wangerooge, an East Frisian island in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Oberpfalz
description: Monopoly set of Oberpfalz, a region in southern Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Hamm
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Hamm, a German city on the northern edge of the Ruhr area.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chicago
description: In Chicago, set in the United States during the age of Prohibition, the players are gang bosses who fight to control the city of Chicago. They try to earn money by controlling the areas of Chicago and building casinos and moonshine stills. Once Prohibition is lifted, the player with the most money wins – but before that happens, the player with the most money is arrested (like Al Capone) and half his funds claimed as punishment. Thus, you need to be second in order to win!

name: Soho!
description:
Publisher Description, from:

http://smokealondonpeculiar.co.uk/index.php/about/soho/what-...

Soho! is a game of skill and judgement for 2-6 players of all ages inspired by the two things for which this small, historic patch of London is famous around the globe: its pubs, and its one-way system.

Each player is the editor of a small literary magazine. Before the next issue can be printed, six pieces of rashly commissioned copy need to be retrieved from a somewhat motley bunch of recalcitrant writers:

Travel blogger and author of Leicester: City of Crisps Toby D’Azure.
Girl-about-town and sparkly-heeled chick-lit tyro Sophie Blush.
Postmodern goremeister and connoisseur of noir Justin Slick.
Aga-endorsing barbour-clad romantic novelist Lavinia Snowe.
Former Para turned lad-mag agony uncle David “Dave” Green.
Otherworldly and oddly androgynous sci-fi bod CT Vermillion.

All are published authors but, on account of not being published as often as they feel they should be, will still take freelance work wherever they can get it, and aren’t too fussed about style or topic: in fact, all insist that being able to turn in stuff “outside their normal comfort zone” stops them getting stuck in a generic rut and keeps them fresh and edgy; the alternative suggestion – that they have no shame and will do anything for a free lunch and a small sub to get them through till next Friday – is, they say, just insulting nonsense. On this, they are all agreed; on everything else, they are united only in their mutual contempt, jealousy, and suspicion. They are, in a word, writers.

And, being writers, all six are currently holed up in six Soho pubs, cadging free drinks, chatting up people half their age (but with, oddly, twice their looks), and complaining vociferously about their agents, about dumbing down in the publishing industry, and about how they didn’t want that Eastenders gig anyway as it would have compromised their artistic integrity and also possibly involved buying a TV licence.

The noble editors’ thankless task is to contact all six writers and extricate their beer/sauvignon-stained prose from whichever unwholesome pocket or handbag it’s been stuffed in. The first to do so scores a small moral victory or, to borrow a phrase from Monopoly, wins.

To get from one pub to the next the editors can walk, hail a cab, or grab a Boris Bike. Taxis are fast, but much of Soho is alleyways or paved, and it’s not easy finding somewhere to pull up. Bikes are nippy, but what about those cobbles on Broadwick Street? – ouch! And, of course, this is Soho, where the streets are narrow and the inexplicable commonplace ...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Shinsen-gumi
description:
“Shinsen-gumi” covers the actions of shinsen-gumi in Kyoto city during its high time.
Each player acts as one of its team leaders, such as Saitoh, Nagakura, Harada.
Players must manage his team members and their armory to keep the security of Kyoto.
The enemies appear by random card and players must fight with them. Some important historical events such as Ikedaya-incident, duel of Abura-kohji could happen during the game.
The key member of Shinsen-gumi, such as Hijikata, Okita could reinforce players team randomly.
The beautiful map covers from Imadegawa street to 7-jou street and from Kamo river to Mibu-temple.
1 map, 2 counter sheets, 72 cards

One of the most rare game in IF series.

name: Ondernemersspel
description:
A game about door-to-door sales.

The game plan shows a typical town map, with manly one-way streets. At the start, each player buys an office, where his salesmen will start every round. In each round, every player selects how many items they think they can sell. Then, everyone secretly selects their selling price. The person with the lowest price moves all his hired salesmen first, and has the best chances of selling his items.

The game ends after a set number of rounds, with the richest player being the winner.

name: Krimi Total: Das Gift der Rivalen
description:
General info on the "Krimi Total" series: Murder mystery games in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery. The game is played in several rounds; there are discussions, allegations, and at the end of the game everybody has to state who they think the culprit is and what happened.

Info on this particular case: This case is aimed at teenagers, so it is less brutal (no murder).

It's one of the biggest days of the school year. The casting of the drama group will take place after lunch break! Who is going to get the leading role? But suddenly an ambulance arrives, taking Marie, one of the top contenders for the leading role, to the hospital. What happened? Was it an accident? Or is somebody else to blame for Marie's sudden illness? And if so, who is it?

In "Das Gift der Rivalen" there are 9 obligatory roles: (4 male, 5 female) and one optional role that can be either male or female. The roles are mostly 13-to-15-year-old students from the drama group and their friends. There are two adult roles (teachers) and the optional role is also an adult (police inspector).

name: Wild Cards: Baby Animals Around the World
description: The wildlife of five continents and the polar regions comes alive in this card game and book set. Play Memory, Old Maid and Go Fish and learn what it's like to grow up as a polar bear in the far North, an elephant in Africa, a sloth in South America, or an Emperor Penguin in the Antarctic. There are dramatic images and facts on every playing card, and in the companion fact book.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Kalua: God Expansion
description:
Small expansion released at Essen 2012.

Can be played in two different ways:
- Gives the players a one-shot effect.
- Permanent powers.

name: Lacuna Expanse: A New Empire
description:
The Lacuna Expanse is a region of space with millions of habitable worlds, but we were not here first. The Sābēn Demesne are the original inhabitants, and they want us out.

Work together with the other players to build a space station before the Sābēn can send enough enemy ships to wipe you out.

Each player builds out their own colony separate from the other players. Each building they add to their colony gives them additional abilities. The players trade to help each other build better colonies with the ultimate goal of working together to build a space station capable of defending colonies from enemy ships. To achieve this some players will build a space station lab while others use espionage or ships to fend off enemies. In the end, if you don't work together, you will be annihilated.

This board game is based upon the popular online space game of the same name.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Hvad ved du om Danmark
description:
New family quiz game about Denmark.
What all Danes should know about their country!
Questions in varying difficulty allows the entire family to play this game. More than 2400 questions in categories such as: The past, Culture and famous people, Nature and Science, Geography, Sport and common knowledge.


Morsom og lærerig familiequiz om Danmark.

Hvad bør alle dansker vide om deres land? Find ud af det i dette spændende spil - hvilken dansk politiker har en dyr smag og bærer ofte Gucci-tasker? Hvilken placering fik de danske badmintonherrer ved EM for hold i Amsterdam 2012? Hvad er navnet på restaurant Noma en forkortelse af? - og meget, meget mere.

Masser af nye spørgsmål, nyt lækkert design og sjov spilteknik sørger for mange underholdende og belærende stunder for hele familien.

Spillet indeholder 2.400 spørgsmål fordelt på seks forskellige kategorier: Før i tiden, Kultur og kendte, Natur og videnskab, Geografisk, Sportsligt og Almen viden.

Test din viden og lær mere i denne herlige spørgeleg om Danmark.

name: Zoom!
description:
I see, I see little eye ... and wears glasses ...

Search as fast as you can as many objects and people to the description on the wheel, mark what you find with the stickers of your color. Hurry because the sandglass!
Six fun and beautifully illustrated looking plates, twenty four assignments, a wheel and an unpredictable sandglass: these are the elements of this super cute look and search game.

Each player gets stickers and a scoreboard in the chosen color. Then you can choose which side of the wheel you play, simple or slightly tougher side! Choose a board game together, turn the sandglass and ready ... START!

Whoever has the most stickers is the winner of the round!

name: Funky Party Games: Mutprobe
description: The party guests behave at once so strange? Toilet paper is wrapped around your neck, smelling suspiciously at the food or do other embarrassing things? They only want one thing: The test of courage exist! At the beginning of each party each guest pulls one of the 50 challenge cards. There is the task what must be executed within the next hour. Who get the most painful test of courage and do it receives Crown. And players who fail serve the bravest for the rest of the evening!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Das geheimnisvolle Schloss
description:
The mysterious witch Schlos Salt Mania has now come up with a very special job for Bibi and her young witches-girlfriends. The aim is to climb the highest tower of the castle!
But beware there are many obstacles on the way - the ground under their feet may open up or a bewitched tree catapult them at the start.

The first player who reaches to the highest tower first is the winner.

name: colovero
description:
Colovero is an easy trick-takting game.

rules from the publishers homepage:

The player to the left of the dealer is the first to play a card. In clockwise order, all the other players also play a card. Once all players have played their card, the orange and green cards are scored separately. The color with the higher score wins the trick. If the colors tie, the color with the highest individual card wins. If that is also a tie, the color with the highest card played last wins.

If a joker is part of the trick, it wins the trick for its color, no matter what the score is. If both jokers are played, the joker played last wins. The trick goes to the player who played the winning card. The player who won the trick places the trick in front of himself with the winning card face up.

At the end of the round, when all players have played their nine cards, the color that won the most tricks in that round is the winning color.

Players receive one point for each trick of the winning color and lose one point for each trick of the losing color. This total score is the result of this round. The results of the rounds are added up as you keep playing. It is up to the players to decide how many rounds they would like to play. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Minirolly und Minigolf
description:
2 different games with a similar approach: build your individual course, play it and create a new one...
Objective:
score as many points as possible by pushing the ball with a swinging hammer into target zone; repeat it 4 x and add results; if your ball leaves the course or if you don't master the obstacle ==> penalty
You can modify course and target zone up to 16 different challenges

name: Monopoly: Sevilla
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Sevilla, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Battle of Red Cliffs: 2013 Essen Promo – Earth Element
description: Earth Element is an event card. When it is drawn, active draws a card then place it on the side face up. When the round ends, all players may use it as an additional score card to score. Remove from the game after scoring.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Fútbol Strategy
description:
Fútbol Strategy gives you teams of 12 footballers that share the same nationality to pick the six stars you want to build a game plan around and contest a fast, strategic, and fun version of the beautiful game against your opponent.

Move your stars into different spaces in their defense, middle, or attacking thirds. Search for space on offense while cover and closing down on defense. The action cards resolve play and serve as the game clock, referencing one of the six unique ratings that each of your footballers have, making each unique and interesting to play. Pass, shoot, clear, and tackle. Futbol Strategy has realistic rules for corner kicks, free kicks, and penalty kicks while remaining sleek and easy to play.

Midway through the first game both players will be very comfortable with the system. Games then will play in just 30 minutes despite offering interesting strategic decisions in the beginning and tense tactical decisions throughout.

name: Suspicion
description:
Suspicion is a game of strategy and social maneuvering. As wealthy tycoons from the 1800's, players compete for power to take influence away from each other while trying to not become a target themselves.

Each round of the game consists of two phases. In the first phase, players play Arsenal cards with numbers ranging from -5 to 5 in value in front of themselves or other players one at a time. After each player has placed three cards, the three highest non-tied values gain control of a Power Deck.

In the second phase, the players with Power Decks, which consist of cards representing all the players, vote on a player to take Influence tokens from. If all three judges pick the same person, that player instead takes three Influence tokens from any players they choose. If all three judges pick different people, then the judges must each give one Influence token to another player of their choice. Otherwise, the two judges who picked the same person take one Influence token each from the player they targeted.

At this point, the Dealer passes the Arsenal deck to the player to their left who deals everyone three cards and play goes back to the first phase. The game ends when every player has been Dealer for one round. The player with the most Influence tokens at the end of the game wins.

Each player also has a secret Agenda card with conditions like "Have three 3's in front of you during the first phase of a round". If the player fulfills one of the three conditions on their card, they may turn it in and take the appropriate number of Influence tokens from any player(s) of their choice. They will get a new Agenda card at the end of that round.

name: Zitatsachen
description:
"The proverbial exciting game to wise words and silly sayings."

A roll and move game with 1500 questions.

name: Deck Delver
description:
Deck Delver is a solitaire dungeon crawler type that plays with a small deck. A portion of the cards are dealt face down in a variety of layouts such as "the Pyramid solitaire game", and then players will have a hand of 5 cards which will act as their inventory of potions and other items.

To explore, simply uncover a card that is free. If it is a monster, you need to fight it by playing a card from your hand, adding the bonus to beat at least 2 of its 3 stats. Once a monster beaten, it goes to your discard pile which in turn increases your inventory like a deck building game. On the other hand, if you miss then you remove cards from the top of your deck.

If your deck runs out its game over. The goal of the game is to reach the dungeon's boss and beat it to reclaim an artifact to become stronger for your next dungeon. In the rule book is included 8 different layouts you can set up the game.

Full color heavy ink version may be found in the link section since the file is too large to upload.

Rules have been updated to V1.3

There is an Expansion currently in the Alpha stage to include a multiplayer co-op rules and new cards too see details below

name: Castle
description:
In this simple abstract game, you will attempt to gain more points than your opponents by placing stones onto the board. Castle contains 3 different boards, each with slightly different rules and a different component requirement.

Came with the Level 99 Games Minigame Library.

name: Popcorn
description:
A dexterity game in which a domed center containing 4 colors of marbles is then automated with 2 D cell batteries to begin to "pop" and move. On each of 4 sides of the dome is a row of slots for each player and colored to match each of the balls or popcorn; blue, green, white and red. In front of each slot is a button and if pressed will push out the popcorn that falls into the slot if it is not a matching color. Each slot can hold up to two balls and the goal is to get as many of your matching color as possible.

2 "D" cell batteries are required for popcorn effect to work.

name: Hampelino
description:
Philip is the best acrobat from far and wide. He is very ﬂexible in order to be able to perform the most unbelievable movements. Little monkey Bo, his friend, is simply amazed at his feats. Are you as ﬂexible as Philip?

Each turn two mobility cards are turned face up. Each mobility card shows Philip with a marked body part. They show which acrobatics you should perform. Example: When Philip's shoulder and knee are marked on the two face up cards, all players are supposed to touch their shoulder with their knee (the players can freely pick between left or right). If none of the players can correctly execute the acrobatics, monkey Bo will move closer to the banana. The players win the game ends when all mobility cards are used before Bo reaches the banana.

name: The Jane Game
description:
The Jane Game is a trivia board game devoted to Jane Austen’s six novels. It is designed to bring Austen admirers together to share in her stories, characters, wit and language. While playing, each participant enters Jane’s world as one of her heroines. As such, you seek after a fortunate life by becoming an accomplished woman, gaining societal experience and choosing to marry or not. Through chance, expertise and choice you could become the envied Mrs. Darcy, the pitied Mrs. Collins or the new roommate of Miss Bates.

The Jane Game is for 2-7 players (Austen wrote seven heroines into her six novels) and lasts about an hour to an hour and a half, depending on how chatty and good-humored the heroines are.

The overall objective is to obtain the greatest Life Fortune. This can be done by trading your accomplishment cards in for something of greater value. The player with the most Life Fortune is the winner.


Designer's Summary:

The Jane Game is a mixture between a role-playing and trivia game. Each player becomes one of Jane Austen’s heroines seeking after a fortunate life. This fortunate life is best achieved by becoming an accomplished lady, a societal woman and by marrying well.

The game has two phases: Courtship and Marriage.
During the Courtship Phase, turns consist of either answering trivia (there are options of guidance from a governess for those who are not as well versed in Austen’s works) or of acquiring Societal Tokens (Family, Ball, Trip). Trivia answered correctly gives Accomplishment Cards, which are used to acquire Societal Tokens.

The Marriage Phase is quick and starts once the first heroine is married. At this point, each heroine goes to the church where proposals come according to how well trivia is answered. She then can choose her hero (i.e. Mr. Darcy), alternate (i.e. Mr. Collins), or to not marry at all (i.e. become Miss Bates’ new roommate).

Once all heroines have the option to marry or not, Life Fortune Points are counted and the heroine with the most wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Theomachie: Spieleschmiede Erweiterung
description:
The Spieleschmiede Erweiterung is a small expansion for Theomachie. This expansion was available only for supporters of the game on German crowdfunding platform Spieleschmiede.

The expansion contains 8 additional prayer cards (4 different cards). These prayer cards have symbols of two different spheres, instead of one. During gameplay these cards are handled as if they originated from both spheres.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Sveriges Mästerkock
description:
Sveriges Mästerkock is a quiz game with 2000 food questions. The theme is from the BBC TV show Masterchef. The questions are diveded into 5 categories (Food, Spice, Recipe, Chemistry & Technique, Compote).

The game is played in 3 phases. First the players are divided into two teams answering questions together. When a team has managed to give a correct answer in each of the 5 categories (or 8 correct answers in any categories) then that team is dissolved and each member play separately. The individual players now compete with each other to get to final. The first 2 players that give correct answers on each category get to the final.

The two players in the final individually answers as many questions they can in one minute and the one with the most correct answers is the masterchef and winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Say the Word
description: Say the Word is a "repeat-after-me silly story memory" game! In this cooperative game, take a zany character, some silly words, and an offbeat challenge, then put them all together one phrase or sentence at a time. Can't recall a word? Have the other players "charade" it for you. Repeat the story start to finish for the big win!

name: Pizza Mania
description: Chef calls out toppings for children to put on (and take off) their pizzas. Reinforces listening, counting, and early addition and subtraction. After 1 minute, Chef calls out what toppings the pizzas should have. All players with the correct toppings win.

name: Der Natur auf der Spur
description:
Der Natur auf der Spur includes three games that challenge players to match tracks to the animals that make them and seeds and nuts to the plants from whence they originate. The game includes paired tiles showing tracks and an animal (or nuts and trees); on the front, these items bleed over the tiles so that you can match them like jigsaw pieces, while on the back these items are separate, making it tougher to know which item goes with which.

In the first game, players set the time on the time-tracker to sunset, then lay out the animal half of the paired tiles. They shuffle the track-half of the tiles, then lay them out. Players take turns trying to match tracks to animals, advancing the time-tracker whenever they're wrong. If they match all the animals before night falls, they win.

In the second game, players use the harder side of the paired tiles, but otherwise gameplay is the same.

In the third game, players use both the animal and tree tiles, laying out one half of these pairs. Players take turns revealing one tile from the other halves, and every other player race to find the match, claiming the tile when doing so.

name: Семейное древо
description:
Семейное древо (Family Tree): the entertaining board genealogy.

Rightgames LLC and the “Mosaicum” project have released an educational board game, Family Tree. Players make up family trees during the game learning russian history and lifestyles of different generations. Family Tree inculcates interest to country’s past and own family history in a game form and develops improvisation and counting skills.

How much do we know about our ancestors? Where were they from? What job did they have and what were they fond of? How did they find their partners in life? We rarely think of it in our childhood but it’s getting harder to find the answers by each year passing by. That’s why it is so important to rouse up children’s interest in family history as early as possible. Understanding of generation continuity and forefathers’ connection with historical events is just necessary for the child to grow up as an all-sufficient and self-contained person.

Each player is telling a story of a common Russian family, constructing its genealogy table. The game is based on the character cards with people of different generations on them, born in pre-revolutionary times at the first half of the 20th century towards to people of nowadays. Each character has a name, a profession, a date of birth and a portrait designed in a family picture album style – all these traits combine into a whole appearance of a typical representative of his age and social group, like a soviet scientist or a present-day manager, for example.

Single characters don’t form a tree yet – they should be bound with family relationships. Married couples, children and parents need to be matched by age. It can be calculated in mind but birth dates are added to the cards for more convenience. After all, firstly, husbands and wives should meet each other: play a meeting card and tell a short acquaintance story. Also there are some event cards which can be played at the character, suitable by age – passing through the Great Patriotic war, attendance at Yuri Gagarin’s first space flight start, election to State Duma (Russian Lower chamber). In such a way a personal family history binds with the global history of the country.

There are two varieties of game rules: “The big family tree” and “Dynasties”. The first one better goes with big companies up to 10 players and is suitable for the first play. In this case players construct one big tree, and the one who will be the first in playing all cards from the hand wins the game.

“Dynasties” is a basic and mostly profound game mode comfortable up to 4 players. Each player makes up his own family tree or several at time which can be united during the game. Families of different players can become related with each other. Overall number of relatives, antiquity of the exact family name and participation in historical events influences the victory.

name: Zombie Plague: The Card Game
description:
Zombie Plague TCG "The Card Game" is a two player Game designed by Dan Leighly. Zombie Plague is a complete card game with everything needed to play included.

Game Objective: You are the Commanding General of an army of warriors seeking to annihilate the enemy and rule the world. You will have the power of these warrior forces at your disposal, while battling against the enemy, and trying to avoid at all costs, the Zombie Plague.

Battle: Any character card can battle any opponent’s card directly across from them.

When a player attacks, only the attacking player rolls the die and the opponent defends with the attack or range points on the card.

The losing player's card is collected by the winning player.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Village Idiot
description:
A fast, trick taking game of medieval village politics!

Life in a medieval village can be very political. On one side you have the Mayor - respected, powerful, able to affect real change. On the other side you have the Village Idiot.

Challenge other players to a battle of skill and luck. Add to the rules of the game as you seize power but beware! No one is above the law. Claw your way to the top and do your best to stay there in this fast, fun, trick taking game with a twist! Village Idiot plays in less than an hour for 3-10 people. You'll be jumping right out of your seat!

Based on several classic party games, Village Idiot combines trick taking, rules making and six rounds of play with every round progressively changing as players build upon the basic rules.

Objective: Become the mayor of your small, medieval village.

Game Play: The entire deck is dealt out to all of the players. The deck consists of numbered cards from 2 - 15. Several cards have special abilities or act as wild cards.

In round one, whoever has the Start card (a 4) begins play. Each player must then play one or two cards of a higher number. Play continues clockwise. The first player to discard all of their cards becomes the Mayor and scores 5 points. The second becomes the Councilor and scores 4 points, and so on.

The last player with cards in their hand becomes the Village Idiot.

Players then rearrange their seating So that play begins with the Mayor, proceeds to the Councilor and so on. The player who has become the Mayor then gets to add one rule to the game, which must be followed until the game ends. Any player who does not follow this rule finds themselves drawing more cards rather than playing them.

The game continues for six rounds, with seating changing and new rules entering play. At the end of the sixth round, the player with the most points wins.

Easy to learn as all of the rules fit on two standard, poker sized cards. Village Idiot can be played with family or friends and be as fun or as cutthroat as you want it to be!

name: Animalacious
description:
Publisher's description:

In Animalacious everyone is an animal. The object of the game is to guess which animal you are. If you woke up one day as a different animal and there were no mirrors how would you figure out which animal you are? Well, you would use cunning and craftiness and you would observe those around you, and of course you’d use your animal instincts.

More specifically: Imagine Celebrity Head where you are an animal rather than a celebrity. Add a deck of cards with pre-specified questions (descriptions), in response to which all players vote for which animal best fits that description. Points are scored for voting for the most popular choice! Players are entitled to guess the identity of their animal after scoring 10 points.

The components include cards (identities and questions), headbands, name badges, dry-erase markers and voting wheels.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Travel Game – Featuring Questions from Volume 6
description:
From the box back:

Contains one deck (97 cards) featuring questions from Volume 6 and a Die. Roll the die and read the corresponding color question; answer correctly and get a question from the next card. Get that one right and keep the card. First player to collect 12 cards wins.

Features questions from Trivial Pursuit: Volume 6.

name: JUX
description:
JUX, a story building game for creative thinkers, is a card game for 2-8 players that lets you all become co-authors of your own wacky, where's-it-going tale. The goal of JUX is to create a story by building a collaborative, run-on sentence, inspired by the quirky illustrations. The game takes 5 minutes to learn, and lasts 30 minutes or longer (depending on how much fun you are having).

Each round begins by revealing a new Objective card and choosing "the best way" or "the worst way" to pursue it. Each player in turn then adds a sentence fragment, using one of their images cards, to extend or to improve the current story - playing off of what others have played.

A player just created a hilarious twist to the story? Give them a Appreciation Token for their creative contribution. Someone's new addition sounds like the best way to accomplish the objective, instead of the worst way? Challenge their card, and make a convincing argument to your friends. Branch the story onto a new path to take the tale in a new direction. Think up a creative ending to the collaborative story to finish the round. All will gain you Appreciation Token, an acknowledgement for your creative thinking throughout play. Collect the most Appreciation Token to become the Best Storyteller!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – C Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Real-time, World War II

name: No Shame Charades
description:
No Shame Charades is the unclassy twist to the classic party game. Perfect for social adults with an unfiltered sense of humor.

The game comes with a 2 minute sand timer, 20 Game Changer cards and 480 phrase cards, each with it's own hilarious definition to help the one person that doesn't know what a "Rusty Trombone" is.

Phrases derive from 4 main topic areas:
- today's pop culture(ish) (ex. "Anchorman", tiger blood, bath salts)
- dark matter (crack baby, kidnap)
- adult stuff (dry hump, walk of shame, morningwood)
- general funny (brain fart, "sh*t hit the fan", explosive diarrhea)

There are 4 types of Game Changer cards - lose a turn, all play, charade with a beverage in one hand, and reverse the timer.

Each team takes 2 minute turns to act out as many phrase cards possible. For every phrase correctly guessed, your team earns 1 point. If a card is passed, you lose a point. At the end of each round, the other teams can earn a point by taking 1 correct guess at a card that was passed during the round. Watch out for Game Changers - these cards will make you wish you\'ve never been born. First team to 21 wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Anti-Hero
description:
Anti-hero is a solitaire Print & Play game which has RPG style character development elements. The player takes on the role of a fledging superhero/villain created by a freak accident at a local nuclear facility. Your character is just getting to grips with his new skills and powers which he has acquired through the mutation of his genes.

The accident is kept quiet and your character is the only survivor. The radiation has made you smarter and more dangerous than the humans in this city. The city officials must pay for what has happened to you and your colleagues, but no one wants to hear your story, not the Police Commissioner, the District Attorney or the Mayor, but you will make them pay for what they have done.

The game uses a combination of dice to create your powers, skills gained through experience points and actions which will see the player, rob banks, hire goons, investigate and blackmail city officials. Can you take control of the city before you are stopped? You are the anti-hero.

name: Monopoly: Curaçao
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Curaçao, a tropical Dutch island in the Carribean.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Superheroes
description:
Two games in one.
In the first game, the players are superheroes and try to reach the last square marked with a M, during the race the villains try to stop the superheroes. The player who arrives first wins.
In the second game, the doctor octopus try to reach the M square before spiderman capture him.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sanasokkelo
description: Sanasokkelo (which means word labyrinth) is Finnish word game. Game consist of circular board, which has four rings of letter spaces and one letter space in the middle. Nearby letter spaces are connected with lines. There is 73 of these rounded holes in the board. At the start of every game you will randomize cardboard letter tiles to these holes. Now you decide how long you will play and turn around the board. Then everybody tries to make words with letters, that are connected with lines. When you find a word (at least four letters long), you shout it and collect the points. You get one point for every letter in the word you found. You get special points, if you can use the letter in the middle or letters in the third (red) circle. When time runs out, the player with most points is the winner. The game can be played in any language, which have approximately same letter distribution in words as in Finnish.

name: StartUp
description:
StartUp is a business board game in which players compete to guide their startup company from launch to the completion of a corporate headquarters. Along the way there are Business Opportunities, Capital Opportunities, and IPO Opportunities. Build Expertise to increase your chances for success and your company's value in an Initial Public Offering. Navigate lawsuits, price wars, networking opportunities and shock cards along the way.
Unlike other business board games, Startup is a lot of fun, even when you are not winning. You lose by succeeding more slowly, not by getting crushed.

The Startup board game teaches business and math skills and models many real business situations, such as the value of investing in your business, the risks and rewards of business opportunities, and the trade-offs in a Capital Opportunity or an IPO.

Startup is fun for the whole family and will have your 9 year old jumping up and down thrilled to have completed an IPO!

StartUp is challenging for any age from child to adult. Although there is some luck involved, the better player will usually win, kind of like real life.
